sim-operations.c
Go to the documentation of this file.
1#ifndef SIM_OPERATIONS
2#define SIM_OPERATIONS
3#include "sim-operations.h"

10const gsc_GenOptions GSC_BASIC_OPT = {
11 .will_name_offspring = GSC_FALSE,
12 .offspring_name_prefix = NULL,
13 .family_size = 1,
14 .will_track_pedigree = GSC_FALSE,
15 .will_allocate_ids = GSC_TRUE,
16 .filename_prefix = NULL,
17 .will_save_pedigree_to_file = GSC_FALSE,
18 .will_save_bvs_to_file = GSC_NO_EFFECTSET,
19 .will_save_alleles_to_file = GSC_FALSE,
20 .will_save_to_simdata = GSC_TRUE
21};
22
33static void* gsc_malloc_wrap(const size_t size, char exitonfail) {
34 if (size == 0) {
35 fprintf(stderr, "0 memory allocation requested.\n");
36 return NULL;
37 }
38 void* v = GSC_MALLOC(size);
39 if (v == NULL) {
40 if (exitonfail) {
41 fprintf(stderr, "Memory allocation failed. Exiting.\n"); exit(2);
42 } else {
43 fprintf(stderr, "Memory allocation failed.\n");
44 }
45 }
46 return v;
47}
48
61gsc_AlleleMatrix* gsc_create_empty_allelematrix(const int n_markers, const int n_labels, const int* labelDefaults, const int n_genotypes) {
62 gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_AlleleMatrix),GSC_TRUE);
63
64 m->n_genotypes = n_genotypes;
65 m->n_markers = n_markers;
66 m->n_labels = n_labels;
67 //m->alleles = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char*) * CONTIG_WIDTH);
68 for (int i = 0; i < n_genotypes; ++i) {
69 m->alleles[i] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char) * (n_markers<<1),GSC_TRUE);
70 memset(m->alleles[i], 0, sizeof(char) * (n_markers<<1));
71 //m->ids[i] = 0;
72 }
73 memset(m->alleles + n_genotypes, 0, sizeof(char*) * (CONTIG_WIDTH - n_genotypes)); // setting the pointers to NULL
74
75 if (n_labels > 0) {
76 m->labels = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int*) * n_labels,GSC_TRUE);
77 for (int i = 0; i < n_labels; ++i) {
78 m->labels[i] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int) * CONTIG_WIDTH,GSC_TRUE);
79 for (int j = 0; j < CONTIG_WIDTH; ++j) {
80 m->labels[i][j] = labelDefaults[i];
81 }
82 }
83 } else if (n_labels == 0) {
84 m->labels = NULL;
85 } else {
86 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid negative number of labels provided to gsc_create_empty_allelematrix");
87 m->labels = NULL;
88 }
89
90 memset(m->ids, 0, sizeof(gsc_PedigreeID) * CONTIG_WIDTH);
91 memset(m->pedigrees[0], 0, sizeof(gsc_PedigreeID) * CONTIG_WIDTH);
92 memset(m->pedigrees[1], 0, sizeof(gsc_PedigreeID) * CONTIG_WIDTH);
93 memset(m->groups, 0, sizeof(gsc_GroupNum) * CONTIG_WIDTH);
94 memset(m->names, 0, sizeof(char*) * CONTIG_WIDTH); // setting the pointers to NULL
95
96 m->next = NULL;
97
98 return m;
99}
100
108gsc_SimData* gsc_create_empty_simdata(RND_U32 RNGseed) {
109 gsc_SimData* d = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_SimData),GSC_TRUE);
110 d->n_labels = 0;
111 d->label_ids = NULL;
112 d->label_defaults = NULL;
113 d->genome.n_markers = 0;
114 d->genome.marker_names = NULL;
115 d->genome.names_alphabetical = NULL;
116 d->genome.n_maps = 0;
117 d->genome.map_ids = NULL;
118 d->genome.maps = NULL;
119 d->m = NULL;
120 d->n_eff_sets = 0;
121 d->e = NULL;
122 rnd_pcg_seed( &d->rng, RNGseed );
123 d->current_id = GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
124 d->n_groups = 0;
125 return d;
126}
127
138void gsc_clear_simdata(gsc_SimData* d) {
139 // Free label defaults
140 if (d->n_labels > 0) {
141 if (d->label_ids != NULL) {
142 GSC_FREE(d->label_ids);
143 }
144 if (d->label_defaults != NULL) {
145 GSC_FREE(d->label_defaults);
146 }
147 }
148
149 // Free other details
150 gsc_delete_genome(&(d->genome));
151 for (int i = 0; i < d->n_eff_sets; ++i) {
152 gsc_delete_effect_matrix(&(d->e[i]));
153 }
154 if (d->n_eff_sets > 0) {
155 GSC_FREE(d->eff_set_ids);
156 GSC_FREE(d->e);
157 }
158 gsc_delete_allele_matrix(d->m);
159
160 // Clear all values
161 d->n_labels = 0;
162 d->label_ids = NULL;
163 d->label_defaults = NULL;
164 d->genome.n_markers = 0;
165 d->genome.marker_names = NULL;
166 d->genome.n_maps = 0;
167 d->genome.map_ids = NULL;
168 d->genome.maps = NULL;
169 d->m = NULL;
170 d->n_eff_sets = 0;
171 d->e = NULL;
172 d->current_id = GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
173 d->n_groups = 0;
174}
175
176/*-------------------------Random generators---------------------------------*/
177
178/* https://www.everything2.com/title/Generating+random+numbers+with+a+Poisson+distribution
179https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poisson_distribution#Generating_Poisson-distributed_random_variables
180*/
191int gsc_randpoi(rnd_pcg_t* rng, double lambda) {
192 if (lambda <= 0) { // invalid parameter.
193 //In this case we use the function to generate number of crossovers
194 // so if parameter/length passed in is invalid, we just want no crossovers
195 return 0;
196 }
197
198 int k = 0;
199 double target = exp(-lambda);
200 double p = rnd_pcg_nextf(rng);
201 while (p > target) {
202 k += 1;
203 p *= rnd_pcg_nextf(rng);
204 }
205 return k;
206}
207
208/*end random generators*/
209
210/*------------------------Supporter Functions--------------------------------*/
211
230struct gsc_TableSize gsc_get_file_dimensions(const char* filename, const char sep) {
231 struct gsc_TableSize details;
232 details.num_columns = 0;
233 details.num_rows = 0;
234
235 FILE* fp;
236 int c; // this is used to store the output of fgetc i.e. the next character in the file
237 if ((fp = fopen(filename, "r")) == NULL) {
238 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open file %s.\n", filename); exit(1);
239 }
240 c = fgetc(fp);
241
242 while (c != EOF && c != '\n') {
243 //RPACKINSERT R_CheckUserInterrupt();
244 if (c == sep) {
245 details.num_columns += 1; // add count for columns of form [colname]sep
246 }
247 c = fgetc(fp);
248 }
249
250 details.num_columns += 1; // add another column that was bounded by sep[colname][EOF or \n]
251 details.num_rows = 1; // we successfully got the first row
252
253 // now get all the rows. What we care about in the rows is the number of them
254 c = fgetc(fp);
255 int sep_count = 0; // for each row, count the columns to make sure they match and the file is valid
256 int has_length = GSC_FALSE;
257 while (c != EOF) {
258 //RPACKINSERT R_CheckUserInterrupt();
259 if (c == '\n') {
260 details.num_rows += 1; // add count for columns of form [colname]sep
261
262 // check we have right number of columns and reset counter
263 if (has_length && sep_count != details.num_columns-1) {
264 // we have a bad number of columns
265 details.num_columns = 0;
266 fclose(fp);
267 fprintf(stderr, "Bad columns on row %d\n", details.num_rows + 1); exit(1);
268 }
269 sep_count = 0;
270 has_length = GSC_FALSE;
271
272 } else if (c == sep) {
273 sep_count += 1;
274 } else if (has_length == GSC_FALSE) {
275 has_length = GSC_TRUE;
276 }
277 c = fgetc(fp);
278 }
279 if (has_length) {
280 details.num_rows += 1; // for the last row before EOF
281 }
282
283 fclose(fp);
284 return details;
285}
286
308int gsc_get_from_ordered_uint_list(const unsigned int target, const unsigned int listLen, const unsigned int* list) {
309 unsigned int first = 0, last = listLen - 1;
310 int index = (first + last) / 2;
311 while (list[index] != target && first <= last) {
312 if (list[index] == 0) {
313 int lookahead = 1;
314 while(1) {
315 if (index+lookahead <= last && list[index+lookahead] != 0) {
316 if (list[index+lookahead] == target) {
317 return index+lookahead;
318 } else if (list[index+lookahead] < target) {
319 first = index+lookahead + 1;
320 break;
321 } else {
322 last = index - 1;
323 break;
324 }
325 } else if (index-lookahead <= last && list[index-lookahead] != 0) {
326 if (list[index-lookahead] == target) {
327 return index-lookahead;
328 } else if (list[index-lookahead] < target) {
329 first = index + 1;
330 break;
331 } else {
332 last = index-lookahead - 1;
333 break;
334 }
335 }
336 ++lookahead;
337 if (index+lookahead <= last || index-lookahead >= first) {
338 // failed to find any nonzeros between first and last
339 return -1;
340 }
341 }
342
343 } else { // No need to dodge 0. Normal binary search.
344 if (list[index] == target) {
345 return index;
346 } else if (list[index] < target) {
347 first = index + 1;
348 } else {
349 last = index - 1;
350 }
351
352 }
353 // index has been updated, no matter the branch.
354 index = (first + last) / 2;
355 }
356
357 if (first > last) {
358 return -1;
359 }
360 return index;
361}
362
384int gsc_get_from_ordered_pedigree_list(const gsc_PedigreeID target, const unsigned int listLen, const gsc_PedigreeID* list) {
385 unsigned int first = 0, last = listLen - 1;
386 int index = (first + last) / 2;
387 while (list[index].id != target.id && first <= last) {
388 if (list[index].id == GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
389 int lookahead = 1;
390 while(1) {
391 if (index+lookahead <= last && list[index+lookahead].id != GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
392 if (list[index+lookahead].id == target.id) {
393 return index+lookahead;
394 } else if (list[index+lookahead].id < target.id) {
395 first = index+lookahead + 1;
396 break;
397 } else {
398 last = index - 1;
399 break;
400 }
401 } else if (index-lookahead <= last && list[index-lookahead].id != GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
402 if (list[index-lookahead].id == target.id) {
403 return index-lookahead;
404 } else if (list[index-lookahead].id < target.id) {
405 first = index + 1;
406 break;
407 } else {
408 last = index-lookahead - 1;
409 break;
410 }
411 }
412 ++lookahead;
413 if (index+lookahead <= last || index-lookahead >= first) {
414 // failed to find any nonzeros between first and last
415 return -1;
416 }
417 }
418
419 } else { // No need to dodge 0. Normal binary search.
420 if (list[index].id == target.id) {
421 return index;
422 } else if (list[index].id < target.id) {
423 first = index + 1;
424 } else {
425 last = index - 1;
426 }
427
428 }
429 // index has been updated, no matter the branch.
430 index = (first + last) / 2;
431 }
432
433 if (first > last) {
434 return -1;
435 }
436 return index;
437}
438
455int gsc_get_from_unordered_str_list(const char* target, const int listLen, const char** list) {
456 for (int i = 0; i < listLen; ++i) {
457 if (strcmp(list[i], target) == 0) {
458 return i;
459 }
460 }
461 return -1; // did not find a match.
462}
463
480int gsc_get_from_ordered_str_list(const char* target, const int listLen, const char** list) {
481 unsigned int first = 0, last = listLen - 1;
482 int index = (first + last) / 2;
483 int comparison = strcmp(target,list[index]);
484 while (comparison != 0 && first <= last) {
485 if (comparison == 0) {
486 return index;
487 } else if (comparison < 0) {
488 first = index + 1;
489 } else {
490 last = index - 1;
491 }
492
493 // index has been updated, no matter the branch.
494 index = (first + last) / 2;
495 comparison = strcmp(target, list[index]);
496 }
497
498 if (first > last) {
499 return -1;
500 }
501 return index;
502}
503
504
518void gsc_shuffle_up_to(rnd_pcg_t* rng, size_t* sequence, const size_t total_n, const size_t n_to_shuffle) {
519 if (n_to_shuffle > 1) {
520 size_t maxi = total_n > n_to_shuffle ? n_to_shuffle - 1 : total_n - 1;
521 size_t i;
522 for (i = 0; i < maxi; ++i) {
523 // items before i are already shuffled
524 size_t j = i + rnd_pcg_range(rng,0,total_n - i - 1);
525
526 // add the next chosen value to the end of the shuffle
527 size_t t = sequence[j];
528 sequence[j] = sequence[i];
529 sequence[i] = t;
530 }
531 }
532}
533
548static void gsc_set_names(gsc_AlleleMatrix* a, const char* prefix, const int suffix, const int from_index) {
549 char sname[NAME_LENGTH];
550 char format[NAME_LENGTH];
551 if (prefix == NULL) {
552 // make it an empty string instead, so it is not displayed as (null)
553 prefix = "";
554 }
555 // use sname to save the number of digits to pad by:
556 sprintf(sname, "%%0%dd", gsc_get_integer_digits(a->n_genotypes - from_index)); // Creates: %0[n]d
557 sprintf(format, "%s%s", prefix, sname);
558
559 int livingsuffix = suffix;
560 ++livingsuffix;
561 for (int i = from_index; i < a->n_genotypes; ++i) {
562 // clear name if it's pre-existing
563 if (a->names[i] != NULL) {
564 GSC_FREE(a->names[i]);
565 }
566
567 // save new name
568 sprintf(sname, format, livingsuffix);
569 a->names[i] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char) * (strlen(sname) + 1),GSC_TRUE);
570 strcpy(a->names[i], sname);
571
572 ++livingsuffix;
573 }
574}
575
587gsc_LabelID gsc_create_new_label(gsc_SimData* d, const int setTo) {
588 // Add new label default
589 if (d->n_labels == 0) {
590 d->label_ids = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_LabelID) * 1,GSC_TRUE);
591 d->label_ids[0] = (gsc_LabelID){.id=1};
592
593 d->label_defaults = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int) * 1,GSC_TRUE);
594 d->label_defaults[0] = setTo;
595
596 } else if (d->n_labels > 0) {
597
598 gsc_LabelID* new_label_ids;
599 if (d->label_ids != NULL) {
600 new_label_ids = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_LabelID) * (d->n_labels + 1),GSC_TRUE);
601 memcpy(new_label_ids,d->label_ids,sizeof(gsc_LabelID)*d->n_labels);
602 new_label_ids[d->n_labels] = gsc_get_new_label_id(d);
603 GSC_FREE(d->label_ids);
604
605 } else { // d->label_ids == NULL
606 // If the other labels do not have identifiers, they're corrupted and
607 // deserve to be destroyed.
608 new_label_ids = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_LabelID) * 1,GSC_TRUE);
609 d->n_labels = 0;
610 new_label_ids[d->n_labels] = gsc_get_new_label_id(d);
611 }
612 d->label_ids = new_label_ids;
613
614 int* new_label_defaults = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int) * (d->n_labels + 1),GSC_TRUE);
615 if (d->label_defaults != NULL) {
616 for (int i = 0; i < d->n_labels; ++i) {
617 new_label_defaults[i] = d->label_defaults[i];
618 }
619 GSC_FREE(d->label_defaults);
620 } else if (d->n_labels > 0) {
621 memset(new_label_defaults, 0, sizeof(int) * d->n_labels);
622 }
623 new_label_defaults[d->n_labels] = setTo;
624 d->label_defaults = new_label_defaults;
625
626 } else {
627 fprintf(stderr, "Labels malformed; gsc_SimData may be corrupted.\n");
628 return (gsc_LabelID){.id=GSC_UNINIT};
629 }
630 d->n_labels += 1;
631
632 // Set all values of that label to the default
633 gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
634 int warned = GSC_FALSE;
635 do {
636 // Do we need to destroy the extant label table? happens if label_ids were missing and we discarded them
637 if (m->n_labels != d->n_labels - 1 && m->labels != NULL) {
638 for (int i = 0; i < m->n_labels; ++i) {
639 GSC_FREE(m->labels[i]);
640 }
641 GSC_FREE(m->labels);
642 m->labels = NULL;
643 }
644
645 m->n_labels = d->n_labels;
646
647 // Consider the case when we need to expand the label list
648 if (m->n_labels > 1 && m->labels != NULL) {
649 int newLabel = m->n_labels - 1;
650
651 // Create label list
652 int** oldLabelList = m->labels;
653 m->labels = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int*) * m->n_labels,GSC_TRUE);
654 for (int i = 0; i < m->n_labels - 1; ++i) {
655 m->labels[i] = oldLabelList[i];
656 }
657 m->labels[newLabel] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int) * CONTIG_WIDTH,GSC_TRUE);
658 GSC_FREE(oldLabelList);
659
660 // Set labels
661 if (setTo == 0) {
662 memset(m->labels[newLabel], 0, sizeof(int) * CONTIG_WIDTH);
663 } else {
664 for (int i = 0; i < CONTIG_WIDTH; ++i) {
665 m->labels[newLabel][i] = setTo;
666 }
667 }
668
669 // Consider the case we need to initialise the label list
670 } else if (m->n_labels == 1 && m->labels == NULL) {
671 // Create the label list
672 m->labels = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int*) * 1,GSC_TRUE);
673 m->labels[0] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int) * CONTIG_WIDTH,GSC_TRUE);
674
675 // Set labels
676 if (setTo == 0) {
677 memset(m->labels[0], 0, sizeof(int) * CONTIG_WIDTH);
678 } else {
679 for (int i = 0; i < CONTIG_WIDTH; ++i) {
680 m->labels[0][i] = setTo;
681 }
682 }
683
684 } else if (!warned) {
685 fprintf(stderr, "Unable to create new label for all genotypes; gsc_SimData may be corrupted.\n");
686 warned = GSC_TRUE;
687 }
688
689 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
690 return d->label_ids[d->n_labels - 1];
691}
692
704void gsc_change_label_default(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_LabelID whichLabel, const int newDefault) {
705 int labelIndex;
706 if (whichLabel.id == GSC_NO_LABEL.id || (labelIndex = gsc_get_index_of_label(d, whichLabel)) < 0) {
707 fprintf(stderr, "Nonexistent label %d\n", whichLabel.id);
708 return;
709 }
710 d->label_defaults[labelIndex] = newDefault;
711}
712
728void gsc_change_label_to(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum whichGroup, const gsc_LabelID whichLabel, const int setTo) {
729 int labelIndex;
730 if (whichLabel.id == GSC_NO_LABEL.id || (labelIndex = gsc_get_index_of_label(d, whichLabel)) < 0) {
731 fprintf(stderr, "Nonexistent label %d\n", whichLabel.id);
732 return;
733 }
734 // Risks: if m->labels or m->labels[i] don't exist for labels where they should,
735 // will get some out of bounds accesses.
736
737 gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
738 if (whichGroup.num != GSC_NO_GROUP.num) { // set the labels of group members
739 do {
740
741 for (int i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
742 if (m->groups[i].num == whichGroup.num) {
743 m->labels[labelIndex][i] = setTo;
744 }
745 }
746
747 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
748
749 } else { // whichGroup == 0 so set the labels of all genotypes
750 do {
751
752 if (setTo == 0) {
753 memset(m->labels[labelIndex], 0, sizeof(int) * m->n_genotypes);
754 } else {
755 for (int i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
756 m->labels[labelIndex][i] = setTo;
757 }
758 }
759
760 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
761 }
762}
763
781void gsc_change_label_by_amount(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum whichGroup, const gsc_LabelID whichLabel, const int byValue) {
782 int labelIndex;
783 if (whichLabel.id == GSC_NO_LABEL.id || (labelIndex = gsc_get_index_of_label(d, whichLabel)) < 0) {
784 fprintf(stderr, "Nonexistent label %d\n", whichLabel.id);
785 return;
786 }
787 // Risks: if m->labels or m->labels[i] don't exist for labels where they should,
788 // will get some out of bounds accesses.
789
790 gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
791 if (whichGroup.num != GSC_NO_GROUP.num) { // set the labels of group members
792 do {
793
794 for (int i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
795 if (m->groups[i].num == whichGroup.num) {
796 m->labels[labelIndex][i] += byValue;
797 }
798 }
799
800 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
801
802 } else { // whichGroup == 0 so set the labels of all genotypes
803 do {
804
805 for (int i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
806 m->labels[labelIndex][i] += byValue;
807 }
808
809 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
810 }
811
812}
813
837void gsc_change_label_to_values(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum whichGroup, const int startIndex, const gsc_LabelID whichLabel,
838 const int n_values, const int* values) {
839 int labelIndex;
840 if (whichLabel.id == GSC_NO_LABEL.id || (labelIndex = gsc_get_index_of_label(d, whichLabel)) < 0) {
841 fprintf(stderr, "Nonexistent label %d\n", whichLabel.id);
842 return;
843 }
844
845 gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
846 int currentIndex = 0;
847 if (whichGroup.num != GSC_NO_GROUP.num) { // set the labels of group members
848 // First scan through to find firstIndex
849 do {
850
851 for (int i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
852 if (m->groups[i].num == whichGroup.num) {
853 // Update label if it is between startIndex and startIndex + n_values
854 if (currentIndex >= startIndex) {
855 m->labels[labelIndex][i] = values[currentIndex - startIndex];
856 }
857 currentIndex++;
858 if (currentIndex - startIndex >= n_values) {
859 return;
860 }
861 }
862 }
863
864 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
865
866 } else { // whichGroup == 0 so set the labels of all genotypes
867 do {
868
869 for (int i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
870 // Update label if it is between startIndex and startIndex + n_values
871 if (currentIndex >= startIndex) {
872 m->labels[labelIndex][i] = values[currentIndex - startIndex];
873 }
874 currentIndex++;
875 if (currentIndex - startIndex >= n_values) {
876 return;
877 }
878 }
879
880 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
881 }
882}
883
911void gsc_change_names_to_values(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum whichGroup, const int startIndex, const int n_values, const char** values) {
912 // this will be much improved once we can hash our names.
913
914 gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
915 int currentIndex = 0;
916 if (whichGroup.num != GSC_NO_GROUP.num) { // set the names of group members
917 // First scan through to find firstIndex
918 do {
919
920 for (int i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
921 if (m->groups[i].num == whichGroup.num) {
922 // Update name if index is between startIndex and startIndex + n_values
923 if (currentIndex >= startIndex) {
924 // clear name if it's pre-existing
925 if (m->names[i] != NULL) {
926 GSC_FREE(m->names[i]);
927 }
928
929 // save new name
930 const int whichName = currentIndex - startIndex;
931 m->names[i] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char) * (strlen(values[whichName]) + 1),GSC_TRUE);
932 strcpy(m->names[i], values[whichName]);
933 }
934 currentIndex++;
935 if (currentIndex > n_values) {
936 return;
937 }
938 }
939 }
940
941 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
942
943 } else { // whichGroup == 0 so set the names of all genotypes
944 do {
945
946 for (int i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
947 // Update name if it is between startIndex and startIndex + n_values
948 if (currentIndex >= startIndex) {
949 // clear name if it's pre-existing
950 if (m->names[i] != NULL) {
951 GSC_FREE(m->names[i]);
952 }
953
954 // save new name
955 const int whichName = currentIndex - startIndex;
956 const int nameLen = strlen(values[whichName]);
957 m->names[i] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char) * (nameLen + 1),GSC_TRUE);
958 strncpy(m->names[i], values[whichName], nameLen);
959 }
960 currentIndex++;
961 if (currentIndex > n_values) {
962 return;
963 }
964 }
965
966 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
967 }
968}
969
990void gsc_change_allele_symbol(gsc_SimData* d, const char* which_marker, char from, char to) {
991 unsigned int nmarkers = 0;
992 unsigned int ngenos = 0;
993 unsigned int nalleles = 0;
994
995 size_t markeri;
996 if (which_marker == NULL) {
997 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d,NO_GROUP);
998 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_start(&it);
999
1000 while (IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
1001 for (size_t m = 0; m < d->genome.n_markers; ++m) {
1002 if (from == loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos][m << 1]) {
1003 loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos][m << 1] = to;
1004 ++nalleles;
1005 ++ngenos;
1006 }
1007 if (from == loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos][(m << 1) + 1]) {
1008 loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos][(m << 1) + 1] = to;
1009 ++nalleles;
1010 if (loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos][m << 1] != loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos][(m << 1) + 1]) {
1011 ++ngenos;
1012 }
1013 }
1014 }
1015
1016 loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
1017 }
1018
1019 gsc_delete_bidirectional_iter(&it);
1020
1021
1022 } else if (gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(which_marker, d->genome, &markeri)) {
1023 nmarkers = 1;
1024 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d,NO_GROUP);
1025 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_start(&it);
1026 while (IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
1027 if (from == loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos][markeri << 1]) {
1028 loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos][markeri << 1] = to;
1029 ++nalleles;
1030 ++ngenos;
1031 }
1032 if (from == loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos][(markeri << 1) + 1]) {
1033 loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos][(markeri << 1) + 1] = to;
1034 ++nalleles;
1035 if (loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos][markeri << 1] != loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos][(markeri << 1) + 1]) {
1036 ++ngenos;
1037 }
1038 }
1039
1040 loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
1041 }
1042
1043 gsc_delete_bidirectional_iter(&it);
1044
1045 } else {
1046 nmarkers = 0;
1047 ngenos = 0;
1048 }
1049
1050 printf("Changed allele %c to %c %u times across %u markers and %u genotypes\n", from, to, nalleles, nmarkers, ngenos);
1051}
1052
1058int gsc_get_integer_digits(const int i) {
1059 int digits = 0, ii = i;
1060 while (ii != 0) {
1061 ii = ii / 10;
1062 digits ++;
1063 }
1064 return digits;
1065}
1066
1074static int gsc_helper_descending_pdouble_comparer(const void* pp0, const void* pp1) {
1075 double d0 = **(double **)pp0;
1076 double d1 = **(double **)pp1;
1077 if (d0 > d1) {
1078 return -1;
1079 } else {
1080 return (d0 < d1); // 0 if equal, 1 if d0 is smaller
1081 }
1082}
1083
1090static int gsc_helper_ascending_double_comparer(const void* pp0, const void* pp1) {
1091 double d0 = *(double *)pp0;
1092 double d1 = *(double *)pp1;
1093 if (d0 < d1) {
1094 return -1;
1095 } else {
1096 return (d0 > d1); // 0 if equal, 1 if d0 is smaller
1097 }
1098}
1099
1107static int gsc_helper_ascending_pdouble_comparer(const void* pp0, const void* pp1) {
1108 double d0 = **(double **)pp0;
1109 double d1 = **(double **)pp1;
1110 if (d0 < d1) {
1111 return -1;
1112 } else {
1113 return (d0 > d1); // 0 if equal, 1 if d0 is smaller
1114 }
1115}
1116
1120static int gsc_helper_indirect_alphabetical_str_comparer(const void* p0, const void* p1) {
1121 char* str1 = **(char***)p0;
1122 char* str2 = **(char***)p1;
1123 return strcmp(str1,str2);
1124}
1125
1129static int gsc_helper_mapfileunit_ascending_chr_comparer(const void* p0, const void* p1) {
1130 struct gsc_MapfileUnit s0 = *(struct gsc_MapfileUnit*)p0;
1131 struct gsc_MapfileUnit s1 = *(struct gsc_MapfileUnit*)p1;
1132 //return s0.ul - s1.ul;
1133 return (s0.chr < s1.chr) ? -1 : (s0.chr > s1.chr);
1134}
1135
1139static int gsc_helper_mapfileunit_ascending_d_comparer(const void* p0, const void* p1) {
1140 struct gsc_MapfileUnit s0 = *(struct gsc_MapfileUnit*)p0;
1141 struct gsc_MapfileUnit s1 = *(struct gsc_MapfileUnit*)p1;
1142 return (s0.pos < s1.pos) ? -1 : (s0.pos > s1.pos);
1143}
1144
1160void gsc_move_genotype(gsc_GenoLocation from, gsc_GenoLocation to, int* label_defaults) {
1161 if (to.localAM == from.localAM && to.localPos == from.localPos) {
1162 return;
1163 }
1164 if (to.localAM->groups[to.localPos].num != GSC_NO_GROUP.num) {
1165 fprintf(stderr,"In moving a genotype from %p:%d to %p:%d, the genotype at %p:%d will be overwritten\n", from.localAM, from.localPos, to.localAM, to.localPos, to.localAM, to.localPos);
1166 --to.localAM->n_genotypes;
1167 }
1168 to.localAM->alleles[to.localPos] = from.localAM->alleles[from.localPos];
1169 from.localAM->alleles[from.localPos] = NULL;
1170
1171 to.localAM->names[to.localPos] = from.localAM->names[from.localPos];
1172 from.localAM->names[from.localPos] = NULL;
1173
1174 to.localAM->ids[to.localPos] = from.localAM->ids[from.localPos];
1175 from.localAM->ids[from.localPos] = GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
1176
1177 to.localAM->pedigrees[0][to.localPos] = from.localAM->pedigrees[0][from.localPos];
1178 from.localAM->pedigrees[0][from.localPos] = GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
1179 to.localAM->pedigrees[1][to.localPos] = from.localAM->pedigrees[1][from.localPos];
1180 from.localAM->pedigrees[1][from.localPos] = GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
1181
1182 to.localAM->groups[to.localPos] = from.localAM->groups[from.localPos];
1183 from.localAM->groups[from.localPos] = GSC_NO_GROUP;
1184
1185 if (to.localAM->n_labels != from.localAM->n_labels) {
1186 fprintf(stderr,"Origin and destination when copying genotype do not have the same number of custom labels (n_labels). The genotype now at %p:%d will have lost its label data.\n", to.localAM, to.localPos);
1187 } else {
1188 for (int i = 0; i < to.localAM->n_labels; ++i) {
1189 to.localAM->labels[i][to.localPos] = from.localAM->labels[i][from.localPos];
1190 from.localAM->labels[i][from.localPos] = label_defaults[i];
1191 }
1192 }
1193
1194 if (from.localAM != to.localAM) {
1195 --from.localAM->n_genotypes;
1196 ++to.localAM->n_genotypes;
1197 }
1198}
1199
1205static gsc_GenoLocation gsc_nextgappy_valid_pos(struct gsc_GappyIterator* it) {
1206 if (it->cursor.localAM == NULL) {
1207 it->cursor = GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1208 } else if (it->cursor.localPos >= CONTIG_WIDTH) {
1209 it->cursor.localPos = 0;
1210 it->cursor.localAM = it->cursor.localAM->next;
1211 ++it->cursorAMIndex;
1212 if (it->cursor.localAM == NULL) {
1213 it->cursor = GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1214 }
1215 }
1216 return it->cursor;
1217}
1218
1225static gsc_GenoLocation gsc_nextgappy_get_gap(struct gsc_GappyIterator* it) {
1226 if (!GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(gsc_nextgappy_valid_pos(it))) {
1227 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1228 }
1229
1230 while (it->cursor.localAM->groups[it->cursor.localPos].num != GSC_NO_GROUP.num) {
1231
1232 // Trusts that n_genotypes is correct.
1233 if (it->cursor.localAM->n_genotypes == CONTIG_WIDTH) { // work-saver: skip this gsc_AlleleMatrix if it is already known to be full.
1234 it->cursor.localAM = it->cursor.localAM->next;
1235 } else {
1236 ++it->cursor.localPos;
1237 }
1238
1239 if (!GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(gsc_nextgappy_valid_pos(it))) {
1240 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1241 }
1242 }
1243
1244 return it->cursor;
1245}
1246
1253static gsc_GenoLocation gsc_nextgappy_get_nongap(struct gsc_GappyIterator* it) {
1254 if (!GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(gsc_nextgappy_valid_pos(it))) {
1255 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1256 }
1257
1258 while (it->cursor.localAM->groups[it->cursor.localPos].num == GSC_NO_GROUP.num) {
1259 ++it->cursor.localPos;
1260 if (!GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(gsc_nextgappy_valid_pos(it))) {
1261 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1262 }
1263 }
1264
1265 return it->cursor;
1266}
1267
1268
1288void gsc_condense_allele_matrix( gsc_SimData* d) {
1289 // Find the first gap
1290 struct gsc_GappyIterator filler = {.cursor=(gsc_GenoLocation){.localAM=d->m, .localPos=0}, .cursorAMIndex=0};
1291 gsc_nextgappy_get_gap(&filler);
1292
1293 if (!GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(filler.cursor)) {
1294 return; // no gaps found
1295 }
1296
1297 struct gsc_GappyIterator checker = filler; // copy filler
1298 ++checker.cursor.localPos;
1299 gsc_nextgappy_get_nongap(&checker);
1300
1301 while (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(filler.cursor) && GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(checker.cursor)) {
1302 gsc_move_genotype(checker.cursor, filler.cursor, d->label_defaults);
1303
1304 ++filler.cursor.localPos;
1305 gsc_nextgappy_get_gap(&filler);
1306
1307 ++checker.cursor.localPos;
1308 gsc_nextgappy_get_nongap(&checker);
1309 }
1310
1311 if (filler.cursor.localAM->next != NULL && filler.cursor.localAM->next->n_genotypes == 0) {
1312 gsc_delete_allele_matrix(filler.cursor.localAM->next);
1313 filler.cursor.localAM->next = NULL;
1314 }
1315}
1316
1317
1318
1319/*----------------------------------Locators---------------------------------*/
1320
1321
1344gsc_BidirectionalIterator gsc_create_bidirectional_iter( gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group) {
1345 return gsc_create_bidirectional_iter_fromAM(d->m, group);
1346}
1347
1348gsc_BidirectionalIterator gsc_create_bidirectional_iter_fromAM( gsc_AlleleMatrix* am, const gsc_GroupNum group) {
1349 return (gsc_BidirectionalIterator) {
1350 .am = am,
1351 .group = group,
1352 .localPos = GSC_UNINIT,
1353
1354 .cachedAM = am,
1355 .cachedAMIndex = 0,
1356
1357 .atStart = GSC_FALSE,
1358 .atEnd = GSC_FALSE
1359 };
1360}
1361
1389gsc_RandomAccessIterator gsc_create_randomaccess_iter( gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group) {
1390 unsigned long first = 0;
1391 gsc_AlleleMatrix* firstAM = d->m;
1392 char anyExist = GSC_TRUE;
1393
1394 // Want to know:
1395 // - is this group empty? (randomAccess should know if group size is 0)
1396 // - what is the first genotype index in this group?
1397
1398 if (group.num == GSC_NO_GROUP.num) { // scanning all genotypes
1399 while (firstAM->n_genotypes == 0) {
1400 if (firstAM->next == NULL) {
1401 // gsc_SimData is empty. Nowhere to go.
1402 anyExist = GSC_FALSE;
1403
1404 } else { // Keep moving forwards through the list. Not polite enough to clean up the blank AM.
1405
1406 firstAM = firstAM->next;
1407 }
1408 }
1409
1410 } else { // scanning a specific group
1411
1412 char exitNow = GSC_FALSE;
1413 while (exitNow == GSC_FALSE) {
1414
1415 // Set first, firstAM, firstAMIndex if appropriate
1416 for (int i = 0; i < firstAM->n_genotypes; ++i) {
1417 if (firstAM->groups[i].num == group.num) {
1418 first = i;
1419 exitNow = GSC_TRUE;
1420 break;
1421 }
1422 }
1423
1424 // Move along and set anyExist if appropriate
1425 if (exitNow == GSC_FALSE) {
1426 firstAM = firstAM->next;
1427 if (firstAM == NULL) {
1428 anyExist = GSC_FALSE;
1429 exitNow = GSC_TRUE;
1430 }
1431 }
1432 }
1433
1434 }
1435
1436 gsc_GenoLocation* cache = NULL;
1437 unsigned int cacheSize = 0;
1438 if (anyExist) {
1439 cacheSize = 50;
1440 cache = gsc_malloc_wrap((sizeof(gsc_GenoLocation)*cacheSize),GSC_TRUE);
1441 cache[0] = (gsc_GenoLocation) {
1442 .localAM= firstAM,
1443 .localPos = first,
1444 };
1445 for (int i = 1; i < cacheSize; ++i) {
1446 cache[i] = GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1447 }
1448
1449 }
1450
1451 return (gsc_RandomAccessIterator) {
1452 .d = d,
1453 .group = group,
1454
1455 .largestCached = anyExist ? 0 : GSC_UNINIT,
1456 .groupSize = anyExist ? GSC_UNINIT : 0,
1457 .cacheSize = cacheSize,
1458 .cache = cache
1459 };
1460}
1461
1471gsc_AlleleMatrix* gsc_get_nth_AlleleMatrix(gsc_AlleleMatrix* listStart, const unsigned int n) {
1472 unsigned int currentIndex = 0;
1473 gsc_AlleleMatrix* am = listStart;
1474 while (currentIndex < n) {
1475 if (am->next == NULL) {
1476 return NULL;
1477 } else {
1478 am = am->next;
1479 currentIndex++;
1480 }
1481 }
1482 return am;
1483}
1484
1495gsc_GenoLocation gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_start(gsc_BidirectionalIterator* it) {
1496 unsigned int first = 0;
1497 gsc_AlleleMatrix* firstAM = it->am;
1498 unsigned int firstAMIndex = 0;
1499 char anyExist = GSC_TRUE;
1500
1501 // Want to know:
1502 // - is this group empty? (iterator should know if it is at the end as well as at the start)
1503 // - what is the first genotype index in this group?
1504
1505 if (it->group.num == GSC_NO_GROUP.num) {
1506 while (firstAM->n_genotypes == 0) {
1507 if (firstAM->next == NULL) {
1508 anyExist = GSC_FALSE; // gsc_SimData is empty.
1509
1510 } else { // (Not polite enough to clean up the blank AM.)
1511 firstAM = firstAM->next;
1512 firstAMIndex++;
1513 // first += 0;
1514 }
1515 }
1516
1517 // After this runs we have set firstAM, first, firstAMIndex, anyExist appropriately
1518
1519 } else { // scanning a specific group
1520
1521 char exitNow = GSC_FALSE;
1522 while (exitNow == GSC_FALSE) {
1523
1524 // Set first, firstAM, firstAMIndex if appropriate
1525 for (int i = 0; i < firstAM->n_genotypes; ++i) {
1526 if (firstAM->groups[i].num == it->group.num) {
1527 first = i;
1528 exitNow = GSC_TRUE;
1529 break;
1530 }
1531 }
1532
1533 // Move along and set anyExist if appropriate
1534 if (exitNow == GSC_FALSE) {
1535 firstAM = firstAM->next;
1536 firstAMIndex++;
1537 if (firstAM == NULL) {
1538 first = GSC_UNINIT;
1539 anyExist = GSC_FALSE;
1540 exitNow = GSC_TRUE;
1541 }
1542 }
1543 }
1544 }
1545
1546 it->localPos = first;
1547 it->atStart = GSC_TRUE;
1548 it->atEnd = !anyExist;
1549 it->cachedAM = firstAM;
1550 it->cachedAMIndex = firstAMIndex;
1551
1552 return (gsc_GenoLocation) {
1553 .localAM = firstAM,
1554 .localPos = first
1555 };
1556}
1557
1568gsc_GenoLocation gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_end(gsc_BidirectionalIterator* it) {
1569 unsigned long last = 0;
1570 gsc_AlleleMatrix* lastAM = it->am;
1571 unsigned int lastAMIndex = 0;
1572 char anyExist = GSC_TRUE;
1573
1574 // Want to know:
1575 // - is this group empty? (iterator should know if it is at the end as well as at the start)
1576 // - what is the first genotype index in this group?
1577
1578 if (it->group.num == GSC_NO_GROUP.num) {
1579 while (lastAM->next != NULL && lastAM->next->n_genotypes != 0) {
1580 lastAM = lastAM->next;
1581 lastAMIndex++;
1582 }
1583 if (lastAMIndex > 0 || lastAM->n_genotypes > 0) {
1584 last = lastAM->n_genotypes - 1;
1585 } else {
1586 anyExist = GSC_FALSE;
1587 }
1588
1589 } else { // scanning a specific group
1590
1591 // Find last AM
1592 while (lastAM->next != NULL && lastAM->next->n_genotypes != 0) {
1593 lastAM = lastAM->next;
1594 lastAMIndex++;
1595 }
1596
1597 char exitNow = GSC_FALSE;
1598 while (exitNow == GSC_FALSE) {
1599
1600 // Set first, firstAM, firstAMIndex if appropriate
1601 for (int i = lastAM->n_genotypes - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
1602 if (lastAM->groups[i].num == it->group.num) {
1603 last = i;
1604 exitNow = GSC_TRUE;
1605 break;
1606 }
1607 }
1608
1609 // Move along and set anyExist if appropriate
1610 if (exitNow == GSC_FALSE) {
1611 --lastAMIndex;
1612 lastAM = gsc_get_nth_AlleleMatrix(it->am, lastAMIndex);
1613 if (lastAM->n_genotypes == 0) {
1614 last = GSC_UNINIT;
1615 anyExist = GSC_FALSE;
1616 exitNow = GSC_TRUE;
1617 }
1618 }
1619 }
1620 }
1621
1622 it->localPos = last;
1623 it->atStart = !anyExist;
1624 it->atEnd = GSC_TRUE;
1625 it->cachedAM = lastAM;
1626 it->cachedAMIndex = lastAMIndex;
1627
1628 return (gsc_GenoLocation) {
1629 .localAM = lastAM,
1630 .localPos = last
1631 };
1632}
1633
1634
1654gsc_GenoLocation gsc_next_forwards(gsc_BidirectionalIterator* it) {
1655 if (it->localPos == GSC_UNINIT) {
1656 return gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_start(it);
1657 }
1658
1659 if (it->atEnd) { // || validate_bidirectional_cache(it) == GSC_FALSE) { // can't use this because what if our iterator user is modifying group allocations?
1660 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1661 }
1662
1663 if (it->group.num == GSC_NO_GROUP.num) {
1664
1665 // Search for the next value.
1666 if (it->localPos + 1 < it->cachedAM->n_genotypes) {
1667 // The next value is in the same gsc_AlleleMatrix
1668 it->localPos++;
1669 it->atStart = GSC_FALSE;
1670 return (gsc_GenoLocation) {
1671 .localAM = it->cachedAM,
1672 .localPos = it->localPos
1673 };
1674
1675 } else {
1676 // The next value is in the next gsc_AlleleMatrix
1677 gsc_AlleleMatrix* nextAM = it->cachedAM;
1678 int nextAMIndex = it->cachedAMIndex;
1679 do {
1680 nextAM = nextAM->next;
1681 nextAMIndex++;
1682 } while (nextAM != NULL && nextAM->n_genotypes == 0);
1683
1684 if (nextAM == NULL) {
1685 // There is no further gsc_AlleleMatrix; we are at the end of the iterator.
1686 it->atEnd = GSC_TRUE;
1687 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1688 } else {
1689 it->cachedAM = nextAM;
1690 it->cachedAMIndex = nextAMIndex;
1691 it->localPos = 0;
1692 it->atStart = GSC_FALSE;
1693 return (gsc_GenoLocation) {
1694 .localAM = it->cachedAM,
1695 .localPos = 0
1696 };
1697 }
1698 }
1699
1700 } else { // We are iterating through a specific group
1701
1702 // Search for the next value
1703 while(1) {
1704 if (it->localPos + 1 < it->cachedAM->n_genotypes) {
1705 for (++it->localPos; it->localPos < it->cachedAM->n_genotypes; ++it->localPos) {
1706 if (it->cachedAM->groups[it->localPos].num == it->group.num) {
1707 it->atStart = GSC_FALSE;
1708 return (gsc_GenoLocation) {
1709 .localAM = it->cachedAM,
1710 .localPos = it->localPos
1711 };
1712 }
1713 }
1714 }
1715
1716 gsc_AlleleMatrix* nextAM = it->cachedAM;
1717 int nextAMIndex = it->cachedAMIndex;
1718 do {
1719 nextAM = nextAM->next;
1720 nextAMIndex++;
1721 } while (nextAM != NULL && nextAM->n_genotypes == 0);
1722
1723 if (nextAM == NULL) {
1724 // There is no further gsc_AlleleMatrix; we are at the end of the iterator.
1725 it->atEnd = GSC_TRUE;
1726 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1727 } else {
1728 it->cachedAM = nextAM;
1729 it->cachedAMIndex = nextAMIndex;
1730 it->localPos = 0;
1731 if (it->cachedAM->groups[it->localPos].num == it->group.num) {
1732 it->atStart = GSC_FALSE;
1733 return (gsc_GenoLocation) {
1734 .localAM = it->cachedAM,
1735 .localPos = it->localPos
1736 };
1737 }
1738 }
1739 }
1740
1741 }
1742}
1743
1744
1768gsc_GenoLocation gsc_next_backwards(gsc_BidirectionalIterator* it) {
1769 if (it->localPos == GSC_UNINIT) {
1770 return gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_end(it);
1771 }
1772
1773 if (it->atStart) { //|| validate_bidirectional_cache(it) == GSC_FALSE) {
1774 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1775 }
1776
1777 if (it->group.num == GSC_NO_GROUP.num) {
1778
1779 // Search for the previous value.
1780 if (it->localPos > 0) {
1781 // The previous value is in the same gsc_AlleleMatrix
1782 it->localPos--;
1783 it->atEnd = GSC_FALSE;
1784 return (gsc_GenoLocation) {
1785 .localAM = it->cachedAM,
1786 .localPos = it->localPos
1787 };
1788
1789 } else {
1790 // The previous value is in the previous gsc_AlleleMatrix
1791 if (it->cachedAMIndex == 0) {
1792 it->atStart = GSC_TRUE;
1793 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1794 } else {
1795 gsc_AlleleMatrix* nextAM = it->cachedAM;
1796 int nextAMIndex = it->cachedAMIndex;
1797 do {
1798 nextAMIndex--;
1799 nextAM = gsc_get_nth_AlleleMatrix(it->am, nextAMIndex);
1800 } while (nextAM != NULL && nextAM->n_genotypes == 0);
1801
1802 if (nextAM == NULL) {
1803 it->atStart = GSC_TRUE;
1804 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1805 } else {
1806 it->cachedAM = nextAM;
1807 it->cachedAMIndex = nextAMIndex;
1808 it->localPos = it->cachedAM->n_genotypes - 1;
1809 it->atEnd = GSC_FALSE;
1810 return (gsc_GenoLocation) {
1811 .localAM = it->cachedAM,
1812 .localPos = it->localPos
1813 };
1814 }
1815 }
1816 }
1817
1818 } else { // We are iterating through a specific group
1819
1820 // Search for the next value
1821 while(1) {
1822 if (it->localPos > 0) {
1823 for (--it->localPos; it->localPos >= 0; --it->localPos) {
1824 if (it->cachedAM->groups[it->localPos].num == it->group.num) {
1825 it->atEnd = GSC_FALSE;
1826 return (gsc_GenoLocation) {
1827 .localAM = it->cachedAM,
1828 .localPos = it->localPos
1829 };
1830 }
1831 }
1832 }
1833
1834 if (it->cachedAMIndex == 0) {
1835 it->atStart = GSC_TRUE;
1836 it->localPos = 0;
1837 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1838 } else {
1839 gsc_AlleleMatrix* nextAM = it->cachedAM;
1840 int nextAMIndex = it->cachedAMIndex;
1841 do {
1842 nextAMIndex--;
1843 nextAM = gsc_get_nth_AlleleMatrix(it->am, nextAMIndex);
1844 } while (nextAM != NULL && nextAM->n_genotypes == 0);
1845
1846 if (nextAM == NULL) {
1847 it->atStart = GSC_TRUE;
1848 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1849 } else {
1850 it->cachedAM = nextAM;
1851 it->cachedAMIndex = nextAMIndex;
1852 it->localPos = it->cachedAM->n_genotypes - 1;
1853 if (it->cachedAM->groups[it->localPos].num == it->group.num) {
1854 it->atEnd = GSC_FALSE;
1855 return (gsc_GenoLocation) {
1856 .localAM = it->cachedAM,
1857 .localPos = it->localPos
1858 };
1859 }
1860 }
1861 }
1862 }
1863 }
1864}
1865
1866
1889gsc_GenoLocation gsc_next_get_nth(gsc_RandomAccessIterator* it, const size_t n) {
1890 // Step 0: First check n is in our group index range as far as we know it
1891 // (If it->groupSize is negative then we don't know the range)
1892 if (it->groupSize > 0 && it->groupSize <= n) {
1893 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1894 }
1895
1896 // Step 1: Check if we have it in the cache.
1897 if (n < it->cacheSize) {
1898 // 'n' is less than or equal to our current furthest cached group member.
1899
1900 if (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(it->cache[n])) {
1901 return it->cache[n];
1902 }
1903
1904 // Otherwise we do not have it cached, but we will enter it into the cache in the next section
1905
1906 } else {
1907 // We need to expand the cache to fit it.
1908 unsigned int newCacheSize = it->cacheSize;
1909 if (it->cacheSize == 0) {
1910 newCacheSize = 50;
1911 }
1912 while (newCacheSize < n+1) {
1913 newCacheSize = newCacheSize << 1;
1914 }
1915 gsc_GenoLocation* newCache = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_GenoLocation)*newCacheSize,GSC_TRUE);
1916 int i = 0;
1917 for (; i < it->cacheSize; ++i) {
1918 newCache[i] = it->cache[i];
1919 }
1920 for (; i < newCacheSize; ++i) {
1921 newCache[i] = GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1922 }
1923 GSC_FREE(it->cache);
1924 it->cacheSize = newCacheSize;
1925 it->cache = newCache;
1926 }
1927
1928 // Validity checks for a random access iterator: largestCached must exist,
1929 // is indeed cached and belongs to the same group
1930 if (it->largestCached < 0 || (!GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(it->cache[it->largestCached]) &&
1931 (it->group.num == GSC_NO_GROUP.num || it->group.num != gsc_get_group(it->cache[it->largestCached]).num))) {
1932 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1933 }
1934
1935 // Step 2: Actually finding the nth group member.
1936 if (it->group.num == GSC_NO_GROUP.num) {
1937 // Assuming all non-end gsc_AlleleMatrix are filled to CONTIG_WIDTH
1938 gsc_GenoLocation expectedLocation = {
1939 .localAM = gsc_get_nth_AlleleMatrix(it->d->m, n / CONTIG_WIDTH),
1940 .localPos = n % CONTIG_WIDTH
1941 };
1942 // Check n was not too large
1943 if (expectedLocation.localAM == NULL ||
1944 expectedLocation.localAM->n_genotypes <= expectedLocation.localPos) {
1945 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1946 }
1947 return expectedLocation;
1948
1949 } else { // searching for a particular group
1950
1951 gsc_AlleleMatrix* currentAM;
1952 int groupN;
1953 int localPos;
1954 if (it->largestCached < n) {
1955 // Search forwards from largestCached
1956 currentAM = it->cache[it->largestCached].localAM;
1957 groupN = it->largestCached;
1958 localPos = it->cache[it->largestCached].localPos + 1;
1959 while (1) {
1960 for (; localPos < currentAM->n_genotypes; ++localPos) {
1961 // If we found a group member, cache it and count upwards towards n
1962 if (currentAM->groups[localPos].num == it->group.num) {
1963 it->largestCached = ++groupN;
1964 it->cache[groupN] = (gsc_GenoLocation) {
1965 .localAM = currentAM,
1966 .localPos = localPos
1967 };
1968 if (groupN == n) {
1969 return it->cache[n];
1970 }
1971 }
1972 }
1973
1974 if (currentAM->next == NULL || currentAM->next->n_genotypes == 0) {
1975 // We are at the end of the iterator and have not found n
1976 it->groupSize = groupN + 1;
1977 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
1978 } else {
1979 currentAM = currentAM->next;
1980 localPos = 0;
1981 }
1982
1983 }
1984
1985 } else {
1986 // With current method of filling cache, this branch will never be taken
1987
1988 // Search backwards from largestCached for one gsc_AlleleMatrix, to take advantage of that pointer
1989 if (it->cache[it->largestCached].localAM != it->d->m) {
1990 currentAM = it->cache[it->largestCached].localAM;
1991 groupN = it->largestCached;
1992 localPos = it->cache[it->largestCached].localPos;
1993 for (; localPos >= 0; --localPos) {
1994 // If we found a group member, cache it and count down towards n
1995 if (currentAM->groups[localPos].num == it->group.num) {
1996 --groupN;
1997 it->cache[groupN] = (gsc_GenoLocation) {
1998 .localAM = currentAM,
1999 .localPos = localPos
2000 };
2001 if (groupN == n) {
2002 return it->cache[n];
2003 }
2004 }
2005 }
2006 }
2007
2008 // Then search forwards from start
2009 currentAM = it->d->m;
2010 localPos = 0;
2011 groupN = -1; // overwrite everything
2012 while (currentAM != it->cache[it->largestCached].localAM) {
2013 for (; localPos < currentAM->n_genotypes; ++localPos) {
2014 // If we found a group member, cache it and count upwards towards n
2015 if (currentAM->groups[localPos].num == it->group.num) {
2016 ++groupN;
2017 it->cache[groupN] = (gsc_GenoLocation) {
2018 .localAM = currentAM,
2019 .localPos = localPos
2020 };
2021 if (groupN == n) {
2022 return it->cache[n];
2023 }
2024 }
2025 }
2026
2027 if (currentAM->next == NULL || currentAM->next->n_genotypes == 0) {
2028 // We are at the end of the iterator and have not found n. Also we didn't reach
2029 // 'largestCached' yet. Something is wrong with the iterator
2030 it->groupSize = groupN + 1;
2031 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
2032 } else {
2033 currentAM = currentAM->next;
2034 localPos = 0;
2035 }
2036 }
2037
2038 // We were somehow unable to find the nth group member. Something is probably wrong
2039 // with the iterator
2040 return GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
2041
2042 }
2043 }
2044}
2045
2066char* gsc_get_name_of_id( const gsc_AlleleMatrix* start, const gsc_PedigreeID id) {
2067 if (id.id == GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
2068 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid ID %d\n", id.id);
2069 return NULL;
2070 }
2071 if (start == NULL) {
2072 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid nonexistent allelematrix\n"); exit(1);
2073 }
2074 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = start;
2075
2076 while (1) {
2077 // try to find our id. Does this AM potentially have the right range for it?
2078 // If we're not sure, because either of the endpoints does not have its ID tracked,
2079 // check anyway
2080 if (m->n_genotypes != 0 && (id.id >= m->ids[0].id || m->ids[0].id == GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) &&
2081 (id.id <= m->ids[m->n_genotypes - 1].id || m->ids[m->n_genotypes - 1].id == GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id)) {
2082
2083 int index = gsc_get_from_ordered_pedigree_list(id, m->n_genotypes, m->ids);
2084
2085 if (index < 0) {
2086 // search failed
2087 if (m->next == NULL) {
2088 fprintf(stderr, "Could not find the ID %d: did you prematurely delete this genotype?\n", id.id);
2089 return NULL;
2090 } else {
2091 m = m->next;
2092 continue;
2093 }
2094 }
2095
2096 return m->names[index];
2097
2098 }
2099
2100 if (m->next == NULL) {
2101 fprintf(stderr, "Could not find the ID %d: did you prematurely delete this genotype?\n", id.id);
2102 return NULL;
2103 } else {
2104 m = m->next;
2105 }
2106 }
2107}
2108
2132int gsc_get_parents_of_id( const gsc_AlleleMatrix* start, const gsc_PedigreeID id, gsc_PedigreeID output[static 2]) {
2133 if (id.id == GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
2134 return 1;
2135 }
2136 if (start == NULL) {
2137 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid nonexistent allelematrix\n"); exit(1);
2138 }
2139 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = start;
2140 while (1) {
2141 // try to find our id. Does this AM have the right range for it?
2142 if (m->n_genotypes != 0 && id.id >= m->ids[0].id && id.id <= m->ids[m->n_genotypes - 1].id) {
2143 // perform binary search to find the exact index.
2144 int index = gsc_get_from_ordered_pedigree_list(id, m->n_genotypes, m->ids);
2145
2146 if (index < 0) {
2147 // search failed
2148 /*if (m->next == NULL) {
2149 fprintf(stderr, "Unable to locate ID %d in simulation memory (genotype has likely been deleted): pedigree past this point cannot be determined.\n", id.id);
2150 return 2;
2151 } else {
2152 m = m->next;
2153 }*/
2154 continue;
2155 } else {
2156
2157 if (m->pedigrees[0][index].id != GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id || m->pedigrees[1][index].id != GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
2158 output[0] = m->pedigrees[0][index];
2159 output[1] = m->pedigrees[1][index];
2160 return 0;
2161 }
2162 return 1; // if neither parent's id is known
2163 }
2164
2165 }
2166
2167 if (m->next == NULL) {
2168 fprintf(stderr, "Unable to locate ID %d in simulation memory (genotype has likely been deleted): pedigree past this point cannot be determined.\n", id.id);
2169 return 2;
2170 } else {
2171 m = m->next;
2172 }
2173 }
2174}
2175
2191void gsc_get_ids_of_names( const gsc_AlleleMatrix* start, const int n_names, const char** names, gsc_PedigreeID* output) {
2192 if (start == NULL || (start->n_genotypes <= 0 && start->next == NULL)) {
2193 fprintf(stderr,"Invalid start parameter: gsc_AlleleMatrix* `start` must exist\n");
2194 return;
2195 }
2196 if (n_names < 1) {
2197 fprintf(stderr,"Invalid n_names parameter: Search list length must be positive\n");
2198 return;
2199 }
2200
2201 int found;
2202 //int ids = malloc(sizeof(int) * n_names);
2203 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m;
2204 int i, j;
2205
2206 for (i = 0; i < n_names; ++i) {
2207 found = GSC_FALSE;
2208 output[i] = GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
2209 m = start;
2210 while (1) {
2211 // try to identify the name in this AM
2212 for (j = 0; j < m->n_genotypes; ++j) {
2213 if (strcmp(m->names[j], names[i]) == 0) {
2214 found = GSC_TRUE;
2215 output[i] = m->ids[j];
2216 break;
2217 }
2218 }
2219
2220 if (found) {
2221 break;
2222 }
2223 if ((m = m->next) == NULL) {
2224 fprintf(stderr, "Didn't find the name %s\n", names[i]);
2225 }
2226 }
2227 }
2228}
2229
2243int gsc_get_index_of_child( const gsc_AlleleMatrix* start, const gsc_PedigreeID parent1id, const gsc_PedigreeID parent2id) {
2244 if (start == NULL || (start->n_genotypes <= 0 && start->next == NULL)) {
2245 fprintf(stderr,"Invalid start parameter: gsc_AlleleMatrix* `start` must exist\n");
2246 return GSC_UNINIT;
2247 }
2248 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = start;
2249 int j, total_j = 0;
2250
2251 while (1) {
2252 // try to identify the child in this AM
2253 for (j = 0; j < m->n_genotypes; ++j, ++total_j) {
2254 if ((parent1id.id == m->pedigrees[0][j].id && parent2id.id == m->pedigrees[1][j].id) ||
2255 (parent1id.id == m->pedigrees[1][j].id && parent2id.id == m->pedigrees[0][j].id)) {
2256 return total_j;
2257 }
2258 }
2259
2260 if ((m = m->next) == NULL) {
2261 fprintf(stderr, "Didn't find the child of %d & %d\n", parent1id.id, parent2id.id); exit(1);
2262 }
2263 }
2264}
2265
2278int gsc_get_index_of_name( const gsc_AlleleMatrix* start, const char* name) {
2279 if (start == NULL || (start->n_genotypes <= 0 && start->next == NULL)) {
2280 fprintf(stderr,"Invalid start parameter: gsc_AlleleMatrix* `start` must exist\n");
2281 return GSC_UNINIT;
2282 }
2283 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = start;
2284 int j, total_j = 0;
2285
2286 while (1) {
2287 // try to identify the child in this AM
2288 for (j = 0; j < m->n_genotypes; ++j, ++total_j) {
2289 if (strcmp(m->names[j], name) == 0) {
2290 return total_j;
2291 }
2292 }
2293
2294 if ((m = m->next) == NULL) {
2295 fprintf(stderr, "Didn't find the name %s\n", name); exit(1);
2296 }
2297 }
2298}
2299
2311gsc_PedigreeID gsc_get_id_of_index( const gsc_AlleleMatrix* start, const int index) {
2312 if (start == NULL) {
2313 fprintf(stderr,"Invalid start parameter: gsc_AlleleMatrix* `start` must exist\n");
2314 return GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
2315 }
2316 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = start;
2317 int total_j = 0;
2318
2319 while (1) {
2320 if (total_j == index) {
2321 return m->ids[0];
2322 } else if (total_j < index && total_j + m->n_genotypes > index) {
2323 return m->ids[index - total_j];
2324 }
2325 total_j += m->n_genotypes;
2326
2327 if ((m = m->next) == NULL) {
2328 fprintf(stderr, "Didn't find the index %d\n", index);
2329 return GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
2330 }
2331 }
2332}
2333
2348char* gsc_get_genes_of_index( const gsc_AlleleMatrix* start, const int index) {
2349 if (index < 0) {
2350 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid negative index %d\n", index);
2351 return NULL;
2352 }
2353 if (start == NULL) {
2354 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid nonexistent allelematrix\n"); exit(1);
2355 }
2356 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = start;
2357 int total_j = 0;
2358
2359 while (1) {
2360 if (total_j == index) {
2361 return m->alleles[0];
2362 } else if (total_j < index && total_j + m->n_genotypes > index) {
2363 return m->alleles[index - total_j];
2364 }
2365 total_j += m->n_genotypes;
2366
2367 if ((m = m->next) == NULL) {
2368 fprintf(stderr, "Didn't find the index %d\n", index);
2369 return NULL;
2370 }
2371 }
2372}
2373
2374
2375
2376/*-----------------------------------Groups----------------------------------*/
2377
2391gsc_GroupNum gsc_combine_groups( gsc_SimData* d, const int list_len, const gsc_GroupNum* grouplist) {
2392
2393 // Find the first group in the list that exists. In most use cases this will be the
2394 // first group in the list, so not too much of a performance penalty.
2395 gsc_GroupNum outGroup = GSC_NO_GROUP;
2396 int i = 0;
2397 for (; i < list_len; ++i) {
2398 gsc_GroupNum candidate = grouplist[i];
2399 gsc_BidirectionalIterator testit = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d,candidate);
2400 gsc_GenoLocation testloc = gsc_next_forwards(&testit);
2401 if (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(testloc)) {
2402 outGroup = candidate;
2403 break;
2404 }
2405 }
2406
2407 int remaininglistlen = list_len - i;
2408 if (remaininglistlen < 2) {
2409 return outGroup;
2410 } else if (remaininglistlen == 2) {
2411 if (grouplist[i].num == grouplist[i+1].num) {
2412 return outGroup;
2413 }
2414 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d,grouplist[i+1]);
2415 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
2416 int anyFound = GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc);
2417
2418 while (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
2419 gsc_set_group(loc,outGroup);
2420 loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
2421 }
2422
2423 if (anyFound) {
2424 d->n_groups--;
2425 }
2426 return outGroup;
2427
2428 } else {
2429 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(isDuplicate,int,remaininglistlen);
2430 memset(isDuplicate, GSC_FALSE, sizeof(int)*remaininglistlen);
2431 for (int ii = i; ii < list_len; ++ii) {
2432 for (int jj = ii+1; jj < list_len; ++jj) {
2433 if (grouplist[ii].num == grouplist[jj].num) {
2434 isDuplicate[jj-i] = GSC_TRUE;
2435 }
2436 }
2437 }
2438
2439 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(anyFound,int,remaininglistlen);
2440 memset(anyFound, GSC_FALSE, sizeof(int)*remaininglistlen);
2441
2442 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d,GSC_NO_GROUP);
2443 gsc_GroupNum cachedgroup = GSC_NO_GROUP; // just for speedier lookups. Groups tend to be stored contiguous in most simulations.
2444 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
2445
2446 while (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
2447 if (gsc_get_group(loc).num == cachedgroup.num) {
2448 gsc_set_group(loc,outGroup);
2449 } else {
2450 for (int k = i+1; k < list_len; ++k) {
2451 if (gsc_get_group(loc).num == grouplist[k].num) {
2452 gsc_set_group(loc,outGroup);
2453 cachedgroup = grouplist[k];
2454 anyFound[k-i] = GSC_TRUE;
2455 break;
2456 }
2457 }
2458 }
2459
2460 loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
2461 }
2462
2463 int groupsgone = 0;
2464 for (int j = 0; j < remaininglistlen; ++j) {
2465 if (!isDuplicate[j] && anyFound[j]) {
2466 groupsgone++;
2467 }
2468 }
2469 d->n_groups -= groupsgone;
2470 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(anyFound);
2471 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(isDuplicate);
2472 return outGroup;
2473 }
2474}
2475
2492gsc_GroupNum gsc_make_group_from( gsc_SimData* d, const int index_list_len, const size_t* genotype_indexes) {
2493 if (index_list_len < 1) {
2494 fprintf(stderr,"Invalid index_list_len value: length of allocation list must be positive.\n");
2495 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
2496 }
2497
2498 gsc_GroupNum newGroup = gsc_get_new_group_num(d);
2499 gsc_RandomAccessIterator it = gsc_create_randomaccess_iter(d, GSC_NO_GROUP);
2500 unsigned int invalidLocations = 0;
2501 for (int i = 0; i < index_list_len; ++i) {
2502 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_next_get_nth(&it, genotype_indexes[i]);
2503 if (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
2504 gsc_set_group(loc,newGroup);
2505 } else {
2506 invalidLocations++;
2507 }
2508 }
2509
2510 if (invalidLocations > 0) {
2511 fprintf(stderr,"%d indexes were invalid.\n",invalidLocations);
2512 }
2513 if (invalidLocations < index_list_len) {
2514 d->n_groups++;
2515 }
2516
2517 gsc_delete_randomaccess_iter(&it);
2518 return newGroup;
2519}
2520
2542gsc_GroupNum gsc_split_by_label_value( gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group, const gsc_LabelID whichLabel, const int valueToSplit) {
2543 int labelIndex;
2544 if (whichLabel.id == GSC_NO_LABEL.id || (labelIndex = gsc_get_index_of_label(d, whichLabel)) < 0) {
2545 fprintf(stderr, "Nonexistent label %d\n", whichLabel.id);
2546 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
2547 }
2548
2549 gsc_GroupNum newGroup = gsc_get_new_group_num(d);
2550 int anyFound = GSC_FALSE;
2551
2552 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d, group);
2553 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
2554 while (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
2555 if (gsc_get_label_value(loc,labelIndex) == valueToSplit) {
2556 gsc_set_group(loc,newGroup);
2557 anyFound = GSC_TRUE;
2558 }
2559
2560 loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
2561 }
2562
2563 if (anyFound) {
2564 d->n_groups++;
2565 return newGroup;
2566 } else {
2567 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
2568 }
2569
2570}
2571
2595gsc_GroupNum gsc_split_by_label_range( gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group, const gsc_LabelID whichLabel, const int valueLowBound, const int valueHighBound) {
2596 int labelIndex;
2597 if (whichLabel.id == GSC_NO_LABEL.id || (labelIndex = gsc_get_index_of_label(d, whichLabel)) < 0) {
2598 fprintf(stderr, "Nonexistent label %d\n", whichLabel.id);
2599 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
2600 }
2601 if (valueLowBound > valueHighBound) {
2602 fprintf(stderr, "Empty range %d to %d: no group created\n", valueLowBound, valueHighBound);
2603 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
2604 }
2605
2606 gsc_GroupNum newGroup = gsc_get_new_group_num(d);
2607 int anyFound = GSC_FALSE;
2608
2609 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d, group);
2610 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
2611 while (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
2612 if (gsc_get_label_value(loc,labelIndex) >= valueLowBound &&
2613 gsc_get_label_value(loc,labelIndex) <= valueHighBound) {
2614 gsc_set_group(loc,newGroup);
2615 anyFound = GSC_TRUE;
2616 }
2617
2618 loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
2619 }
2620
2621 if (anyFound) {
2622 d->n_groups++;
2623 return newGroup;
2624 } else {
2625 return GSC_NO_GROUP; // no values with that label
2626 }
2627}
2628
2629
2651unsigned int gsc_scaffold_split_by_somequality( gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group_id,
2652 void* somequality_data,
2653 gsc_GroupNum (*somequality_tester)(gsc_GenoLocation, void*, unsigned int, unsigned int, gsc_GroupNum*),
2654 size_t maxentries_results, gsc_GroupNum* results) {
2655
2656 // Access existing groups (to be used to find unused group numbers,
2657 // and to find maximum number of groups we'd be able to create)
2658 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(currentgroups,gsc_GroupNum,d->n_groups);
2659 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(currentsizes,size_t,d->n_groups);
2660 int n_groups = gsc_get_existing_group_counts(d, currentgroups, currentsizes);
2661 int bookmark = 0;
2662 gsc_GroupNum nextgroup = GSC_NO_GROUP;
2663
2664 size_t splitgroupsize = 0;
2665 for (int i = 0; i < n_groups; ++i) {
2666 if (currentgroups[i].num == group_id.num) {
2667 splitgroupsize = currentsizes[i];
2668 //GSC_FREE(currentsizes);
2669 break;
2670 }
2671 }
2672 if (splitgroupsize < 1) {
2673 return 0;
2674 }
2675
2676 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(currentsizes);
2677 unsigned int subgroupsfound = 0;
2678 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(outgroups,gsc_GroupNum,splitgroupsize);
2679
2680 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d,group_id);
2681 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
2682 while (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
2683 // Return group number if it should be assigned to an already-extant group. Otherwise return GSC_NO_GROUP and this generic caller function will allocated it one.
2684 gsc_GroupNum assignedgroup = somequality_tester(loc, somequality_data,splitgroupsize, subgroupsfound, outgroups);
2685
2686 if (assignedgroup.num == GSC_NO_GROUP.num) {
2687 nextgroup = gsc_get_next_free_group_num(n_groups,currentgroups,&bookmark,nextgroup);
2688 assignedgroup = nextgroup;
2689 outgroups[subgroupsfound] = nextgroup;
2690 subgroupsfound++;
2691 }
2692
2693 gsc_set_group(loc,assignedgroup);
2694
2695 loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
2696 }
2697
2698 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(currentgroups);
2699 d->n_groups += subgroupsfound - 1;
2700
2701 if (maxentries_results < subgroupsfound) {
2702 memcpy(results,outgroups,sizeof(gsc_GroupNum)*maxentries_results);
2703 fprintf(stderr,"Output vector size is not large enough to hold all created groups: "
2704 " output list of gsc_GroupNums has been truncated.\n");
2705 } else {
2706 memcpy(results,outgroups,sizeof(gsc_GroupNum)*subgroupsfound);
2707 }
2708 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(outgroups);
2709 return subgroupsfound;
2710}
2711
2712static gsc_GroupNum gsc_helper_split_by_quality_halfsibtemplate(gsc_GenoLocation loc, void* datastore, unsigned int maxgroups, unsigned int groupsfound, gsc_GroupNum* results, gsc_PedigreeID (*getparent)(gsc_GenoLocation)) {
2713 gsc_PedigreeID* familyidentities = (gsc_PedigreeID*) datastore;
2714
2715 for (int j = 0; j < groupsfound; ++j) {
2716 if (getparent(loc).id == familyidentities[j].id) {
2717 return results[j];
2718 }
2719 }
2720
2721 familyidentities[groupsfound] = getparent(loc);
2722 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
2723}
2724
2725static gsc_GroupNum gsc_helper_split_by_quality_halfsib1(gsc_GenoLocation loc, void* datastore, unsigned int maxgroups, unsigned int groupsfound, gsc_GroupNum* results) {
2726 return gsc_helper_split_by_quality_halfsibtemplate(loc,datastore,maxgroups,groupsfound,results,gsc_get_first_parent);
2727}
2728
2729static gsc_GroupNum gsc_helper_split_by_quality_halfsib2(gsc_GenoLocation loc, void* datastore, unsigned int maxgroups, unsigned int groupsfound, gsc_GroupNum* results) {
2730 return gsc_helper_split_by_quality_halfsibtemplate(loc,datastore,maxgroups,groupsfound,results,gsc_get_second_parent);
2731}
2732
2766unsigned int gsc_split_into_halfsib_families( gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group_id, const int parent, size_t maxentries_results, gsc_GroupNum* results) {
2767 if (!(parent == 1 || parent == 2)) {
2768 fprintf(stderr, "Value error: `parent` must be 1 or 2.");
2769 results = NULL;
2770 return 0;
2771 }
2772
2773 //gsc_PedigreeID* familyidentities = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_PedigreeID)*maxgroups);
2774 int maxgroups = gsc_get_group_size(d, group_id); // sadinefficient we have to do this
2775 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(familyidentities,gsc_PedigreeID,maxgroups);
2776
2777 unsigned int gcount;
2778 if (parent == 1) {
2779 gcount = gsc_scaffold_split_by_somequality(d, group_id, (void*)familyidentities,gsc_helper_split_by_quality_halfsib1, maxentries_results, results);
2780 } else {
2781 gcount = gsc_scaffold_split_by_somequality(d, group_id, (void*)familyidentities, gsc_helper_split_by_quality_halfsib2, maxentries_results, results);
2782 }
2783
2784 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(familyidentities);
2785 return gcount;
2786}
2787
2788static gsc_GroupNum gsc_helper_split_by_quality_family(gsc_GenoLocation loc, void* datastore, unsigned int maxgroups, unsigned int groupsfound, gsc_GroupNum* results) {
2789 gsc_PedigreeID** familyidentities = (gsc_PedigreeID**) datastore;
2790
2791 for (int j = 0; j < groupsfound; ++j) {
2792 if (gsc_get_first_parent(loc).id == familyidentities[0][j].id &&
2793 gsc_get_second_parent(loc).id == familyidentities[1][j].id) {
2794 return results[j];
2795 }
2796 }
2797
2798 familyidentities[0][groupsfound] = gsc_get_first_parent(loc);
2799 familyidentities[1][groupsfound] = gsc_get_second_parent(loc);
2800 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
2801}
2802
2830unsigned int gsc_split_into_families(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group_id, size_t maxentries_results, gsc_GroupNum* results) {
2831 gsc_PedigreeID* familyidentities[2];
2832 unsigned int maxgroups = gsc_get_group_size(d, group_id); // sadinefficient we have to do this
2833 if (maxgroups < 2) {
2834 return 0;
2835 }
2836
2837 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(p1identity,gsc_PedigreeID,maxgroups);
2838 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(p2identity,gsc_PedigreeID,maxgroups);
2839 familyidentities[0] = p1identity;
2840 familyidentities[1] = p2identity;
2841
2842 unsigned int out = gsc_scaffold_split_by_somequality(d, group_id, (void*)familyidentities, gsc_helper_split_by_quality_family, maxentries_results, results);
2843
2844 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(p1identity);
2845 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(p2identity);
2846
2847 return out;
2848}
2849
2850static gsc_GroupNum gsc_helper_split_by_quality_individuate(gsc_GenoLocation loc, void* datastore, unsigned int maxgroups, unsigned int groupsfound, gsc_GroupNum* results) {
2851 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
2852}
2853
2878unsigned int gsc_split_into_individuals( gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group_id, size_t maxentries_results, gsc_GroupNum* results) {
2879 // **individuate** (verb): to make individuals of.
2880 // yeah sorry.
2881 return gsc_scaffold_split_by_somequality(d, group_id, NULL, gsc_helper_split_by_quality_individuate, maxentries_results, results);
2882}
2883
2884
2907gsc_GroupNum gsc_split_evenly_into_two(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group_id) {
2908 // get the shuffle to be our even allocations
2909 size_t size = gsc_get_group_size(d, group_id);
2910 if (size < 2) {
2911 if (size < 1) {
2912 fprintf(stderr,"Group %d does not exist\n", group_id.num);
2913 } else {
2914 fprintf(stderr,"Group %d has only one member so can't be split\n", group_id.num);
2915 }
2916 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
2917 }
2918
2919 size_t even_half = size / 2;
2920 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(allocations,size_t,size);
2921 for (size_t i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
2922 allocations[i] = i;
2923 }
2924 gsc_shuffle_up_to(&d->rng, allocations, size, even_half);
2925
2926 gsc_GroupNum new_group = gsc_get_new_group_num(d);
2927 //int anyFound = GSC_FALSE;
2928
2929 gsc_RandomAccessIterator it = gsc_create_randomaccess_iter(d,group_id);
2930 for (size_t i = 0; i < even_half; ++i) {
2931 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_next_get_nth(&it,allocations[i]);
2932 if (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
2933 gsc_set_group(loc,new_group);
2934 //anyFound = GSC_TRUE;
2935 }
2936 }
2937
2938 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(allocations);
2939 gsc_delete_randomaccess_iter(&it);
2940
2941 //if (anyFound) {
2942 d->n_groups++;
2943 return new_group;
2944 //} else {
2945 // return GSC_NO_GROUP;
2946 //}
2947}
2948
2949
2967unsigned int gsc_scaffold_split_by_someallocation( gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group_id, void* someallocator_data,
2968 gsc_GroupNum (*someallocator)(gsc_GenoLocation, gsc_SimData*, void*, unsigned int, unsigned int*, gsc_GroupNum*),
2969 size_t n_outgroups, gsc_GroupNum* outgroups) {
2970
2971 // get the n group numbers
2972 gsc_get_n_new_group_nums(d, n_outgroups, outgroups);
2973
2974 unsigned int subgroupsfound = 0;
2975 unsigned int allocationfailures = 0;
2976
2977 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d,group_id);
2978 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
2979 while (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
2980 gsc_GroupNum assignedgroup = someallocator(loc, d, someallocator_data, n_outgroups, &subgroupsfound, outgroups);
2981 if (assignedgroup.num != GSC_NO_GROUP.num) {
2982 gsc_set_group(loc,assignedgroup);
2983 } else {
2984 allocationfailures++;
2985 }
2986
2987 loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
2988 }
2989
2990 if (subgroupsfound > 1) {
2991 d->n_groups += subgroupsfound - 1;
2992 }
2993 if (allocationfailures > 0) {
2994 fprintf(stderr,"While splitting group %i, %i allocations to new groups failed so they remain in the original group.\n",
2995 group_id.num, allocationfailures);
2996 }
2997 return subgroupsfound;
2998
2999}
3000
3001
3002static gsc_GroupNum gsc_helper_split_by_allocator_knowncounts(gsc_GenoLocation loc, gsc_SimData* d, void* datastore, unsigned int n_outgroups,
3003 unsigned int* subgroupsfound, gsc_GroupNum* outgroups) {
3004 unsigned int* cumulative_counts = (unsigned int*) datastore;
3005 *subgroupsfound = n_outgroups;
3006 unsigned int randpos = rnd_pcg_range(&d->rng,0,cumulative_counts[n_outgroups-1] - 1);
3007 gsc_GroupNum chosengroup = GSC_NO_GROUP;
3008 unsigned int j = 0;
3009 for (; j < n_outgroups; ++j) {
3010 if (randpos < cumulative_counts[j]) {
3011 chosengroup = outgroups[j];
3012 break;
3013 }
3014 }
3015 for (; j < n_outgroups; ++j) {
3016 cumulative_counts[j]--;
3017 }
3018 return chosengroup;
3019}
3020
3042unsigned int gsc_split_evenly_into_n(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group_id, const int n, gsc_GroupNum* results) {
3043 if (n <= 1) {
3044 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid n value: number of fractions into which to split group must be positive.\n");
3045 return 0;
3046 }
3047
3048 int size = gsc_get_group_size(d, group_id); // sadinefficient we have to do this.
3049
3050 // get the shuffle to be our even allocations
3051 int each_size = size / n;
3052 int extra = size % n;
3053 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(boxes,int,n);
3054 for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
3055 boxes[i] = each_size;
3056 if (i < extra) {
3057 boxes[i]++;
3058 }
3059 if (i > 0) {
3060 boxes[i] += boxes[i-1];
3061 }
3062 }
3063
3064 unsigned int out;
3065 if (results == NULL) {
3066 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(outgroups,gsc_GroupNum, n);
3067 out = gsc_scaffold_split_by_someallocation(d, group_id, (void*) boxes, gsc_helper_split_by_allocator_knowncounts, n, outgroups);
3068 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(outgroups);
3069 } else {
3070 out = gsc_scaffold_split_by_someallocation(d, group_id, (void*) boxes, gsc_helper_split_by_allocator_knowncounts, n, results);
3071 }
3072 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(boxes);
3073 return out;
3074}
3075
3112unsigned int gsc_split_into_buckets(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group_id, const int n, const int* counts, gsc_GroupNum* results) {
3113 if (n <= 1) {
3114 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid n value: number of fractions into which to split group must be positive.\n");
3115 return 0;
3116 }
3117
3118 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(cumulative_counts,int,n);
3119 cumulative_counts[n-1] = gsc_get_group_size(d, group_id);
3120 int sum = 0;
3121 for (int j = 0; j < n - 1; ++j) {
3122 sum += counts[j];
3123 cumulative_counts[j] = sum;
3124 }
3125 if (cumulative_counts[n-2] > cumulative_counts[n-1]) {
3126 fprintf(stderr, "Provided capacities are larger than actual group: some buckets will not be filled\n");
3127 }
3128
3129 unsigned int gcount;
3130 if (results == NULL) {
3131 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(outgroups,gsc_GroupNum,n);
3132 gcount = gsc_scaffold_split_by_someallocation(d, group_id, (void*) cumulative_counts, gsc_helper_split_by_allocator_knowncounts, n, outgroups);
3133 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(outgroups);
3134 } else {
3135 gcount = gsc_scaffold_split_by_someallocation(d, group_id, (void*) cumulative_counts, gsc_helper_split_by_allocator_knowncounts, n, results);
3136 }
3137
3138 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(cumulative_counts);
3139 return gcount;
3140}
3141
3163gsc_GroupNum gsc_split_randomly_into_two(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group_id) {
3164 gsc_GroupNum outGroup = gsc_get_new_group_num(d);
3165 int anyFound = GSC_FALSE;
3166
3167 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d, group_id);
3168 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
3169 while (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
3170 anyFound = GSC_TRUE;
3171 if (rnd_pcg_range(&d->rng,0,1)) {
3172 gsc_set_group(loc,outGroup);
3173 }
3174 loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
3175 }
3176
3177 if (anyFound) {
3178 d->n_groups++;
3179 return outGroup;
3180 } else {
3181 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
3182 }
3183}
3184
3185
3186static gsc_GroupNum gsc_helper_split_by_allocator_equalprob(gsc_GenoLocation loc, gsc_SimData* d, void* datastore, unsigned int n_outgroups,
3187 unsigned int* subgroupsfound, gsc_GroupNum* outgroups) {
3188 int randgroup = rnd_pcg_range(&d->rng,0,n_outgroups-1);
3189 if (randgroup < *subgroupsfound) {
3190 return outgroups[randgroup];
3191 } else {
3192 (*subgroupsfound)++;
3193 return outgroups[*subgroupsfound-1];
3194 }
3195}
3196
3221unsigned int gsc_split_randomly_into_n(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group_id, const int n, gsc_GroupNum* results) {
3222 if (n <= 1) {
3223 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid n value: number of fractions in which to split group must be positive.\n");
3224 return 0;
3225 }
3226
3227 unsigned int gcount;
3228 if (results == NULL) {
3229 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(outgroups,gsc_GroupNum,n);
3230 gcount = gsc_scaffold_split_by_someallocation(d, group_id, NULL, gsc_helper_split_by_allocator_equalprob, n, outgroups);
3231 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(outgroups);
3232 } else {
3233 gcount = gsc_scaffold_split_by_someallocation(d, group_id, NULL, gsc_helper_split_by_allocator_equalprob, n, results);
3234 }
3235 return gcount;
3236}
3237
3238
3239static gsc_GroupNum gsc_helper_split_by_allocator_unequalprob(gsc_GenoLocation loc, gsc_SimData* d, void* datastore, unsigned int n_outgroups,
3240 unsigned int* subgroupsfound, gsc_GroupNum* outgroups) {
3241 double* cumulative_probs = (double*) datastore;
3242 *subgroupsfound = n_outgroups;
3243 double randdraw = rnd_pcg_nextf(&d->rng);
3244 for (int j = 0; j < n_outgroups; ++j) {
3245 if (randdraw < cumulative_probs[j]) {
3246 return outgroups[j];
3247 }
3248 }
3249 // This should not happen if cumulative probs are valid
3250 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
3251}
3252
3285unsigned int gsc_split_by_probabilities(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group_id, const int n, const double* probs, gsc_GroupNum* results) {
3286 if (n <= 1) {
3287 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid n value: number of fractions in which to split group must be positive.\n");
3288 return 0;
3289 }
3290
3291 // Check the probabilities
3292 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(cumulative_probs,double,n);
3293 cumulative_probs[n-1] = 1.0;
3294 double sum = 0;
3295 for (int j = 0; j < n-1; ++j) {
3296 sum += probs[j];
3297 cumulative_probs[j] = sum;
3298 if (cumulative_probs[j] >= 1) {
3299 fprintf(stderr, "Provided probabilities add up to 1 or more: some buckets will not be filled\n");
3300 for (; j < n-1; ++j) {
3301 cumulative_probs[j] = 1;
3302 }
3303 //don't bother to calculate more
3304 break;
3305 }
3306 }
3307
3308 unsigned int gcount;
3309 if (results == NULL) {
3310 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(outgroups,gsc_GroupNum,n);
3311 gcount = gsc_scaffold_split_by_someallocation(d, group_id, (void*) cumulative_probs, gsc_helper_split_by_allocator_unequalprob, n, outgroups);
3312 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(outgroups);
3313 } else {
3314 gcount = gsc_scaffold_split_by_someallocation(d, group_id, (void*) cumulative_probs, gsc_helper_split_by_allocator_unequalprob, n, results);
3315 }
3316
3317 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(cumulative_probs);
3318 return gcount;
3319}
3320
3321
3343int gsc_get_existing_groups( gsc_SimData* d, gsc_GroupNum* output) {
3344 return gsc_get_existing_group_counts(d, output, NULL);
3345}
3346
3363int gsc_get_existing_group_counts( gsc_SimData* d, gsc_GroupNum* out_groups, size_t* out_sizes) {
3364 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(buckets,unsigned int,d->n_groups+1); // this also creates bucketscap, initalised to d->n_groups+1.
3365 memset(buckets,0,sizeof(unsigned int)*bucketscap);
3366 size_t filledbuckets = 0;
3367
3368 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d, GSC_NO_GROUP);
3369 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
3370 while (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
3371 gsc_GroupNum g = gsc_get_group(loc);
3372 // Unless all group numbers are consecutive starting at 1, the buckets array will need to be resized at some point.
3373 if (g.num >= bucketscap) {
3374 size_t oldcap = bucketscap;
3375 size_t newbucketcapacity = bucketscap;
3376 while (g.num >= newbucketcapacity) {
3377 newbucketcapacity *= 2;
3378 }
3379 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(buckets,newbucketcapacity);
3380 if (g.num >= bucketscap) {
3381 fprintf(stderr,"Memory allocation failed. Not all groups found.\n");
3382 break;
3383 }
3384 memset(buckets+oldcap,0,sizeof(unsigned int)*(bucketscap-oldcap));
3385
3386 }
3387
3388 buckets[g.num] += 1;
3389 if (buckets[g.num] == 1) {
3390 ++filledbuckets;
3391 }
3392
3393 loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
3394 }
3395
3396 // Now save to output and sort.
3397 size_t capacity = filledbuckets;
3398 if (capacity > d->n_groups) {
3399 fprintf(stderr,"Found more groups than expected - gsc_SimData.n_groups is outdated somewhere."
3400 " Trimming output of get_existing_group_ to avoid a crash: not all groups may be shown.\n");
3401 capacity = d->n_groups;
3402 }
3403 size_t g_index = 0;
3404 for (int i = 0; i < bucketscap; ++i) {
3405 if (buckets[i]) {
3406 /*if (g_index >= capacity) {
3407 fprintf(stderr,"Found more groups than just a moment ago.");
3408 --g_index;
3409 break;
3410 }*/
3411
3412 if (out_groups != NULL) {
3413 out_groups[g_index] = (gsc_GroupNum){.num=i};
3414 }
3415 if (out_sizes != NULL) {
3416 out_sizes[g_index] = buckets[i];
3417 }
3418 ++g_index;
3419 }
3420 }
3421
3422 //qsort(*out_groups, g_index, sizeof(gsc_GroupNum), gsc_helper_ascending_gsc_GroupNum_comparer);
3423 /*for (int i = 0; i < g_index; ++i) {
3424 (*out_sizes)[i] = buckets[(*out_groups)[i].num];
3425 }*/
3426 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(buckets);
3427 d->n_groups = g_index;
3428
3429 return g_index;
3430}
3431
3432
3456gsc_GroupNum gsc_get_next_free_group_num( const int n_existing_groups, const gsc_GroupNum* existing_groups, int* cursor, gsc_GroupNum previous) {
3457 if (existing_groups == NULL) return GSC_NO_GROUP;
3458
3459 if (*cursor == GSC_UNINIT) {
3460 *cursor = 0;
3461 }
3462
3463 gsc_GroupNum nextgroup = (gsc_GroupNum){.num=previous.num+1};
3464 // a check here in case previous seems invalid. We need previous so we don't get stuck in a loop
3465 // of giving the same next 'free' number, but we know what a lower bound on its number should be
3466 // based on where the cursor is.
3467 if (*cursor > 0 && nextgroup.num <= existing_groups[(*cursor) - 1].num) {
3468 nextgroup.num = existing_groups[(*cursor) - 1].num + 1;
3469 }
3470
3471 while (*cursor < n_existing_groups) {
3472 if (nextgroup.num < existing_groups[*cursor].num) {
3473 break;
3474 }
3475
3476 ++(*cursor);
3477 ++nextgroup.num;
3478 }
3479 return nextgroup;
3480}
3481
3495gsc_GroupNum gsc_get_new_group_num( gsc_SimData* d) {
3496 // Make sure we get all existing groups
3497 if (d->m == NULL || (d->m->n_genotypes == 0 && d->m->next == NULL)) {
3498 return (gsc_GroupNum){.num=1};
3499 }
3500
3501 int n_groups = (d->n_groups > 0) ? d->n_groups : 5;
3502 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(existing_groups,gsc_GroupNum,n_groups);
3503 n_groups = gsc_get_existing_groups(d, existing_groups);
3504
3505 int i = 0;
3506 int gn = 1;
3507
