3508 while (i < n_groups) {
3509 if (gn < existing_groups[i].num) {
3510 break;
3511 }
3512
3513 ++i;
3514 ++gn;
3515 }
3516 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(existing_groups);
3517 return (gsc_GroupNum){.num=gn};
3518}
3519
3520
3529void gsc_get_n_new_group_nums( gsc_SimData* d, const int n, gsc_GroupNum* result) {
3530 // Make sure we get all existing groups
3531 int n_groups;
3532 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(existing_groups,gsc_GroupNum,d->n_groups);
3533 n_groups = gsc_get_existing_groups(d, existing_groups);
3534
3535 int existingi = 0;
3536 int gn = 0;
3537
3538 // i: current index of `results` (the array of currently empty group numbers)
3539 // gn: group number being checked against existing_groups. if not in there is added to
3540 // the list of results
3541 // existingi: current index of existing_groups
3542 for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
3543 ++gn;
3544 while (existingi < n_groups) {
3545 if (gn < existing_groups[existingi].num) {
3546 break;
3547 }
3548
3549 ++existingi;
3550 ++gn;
3551 }
3552 result[i] = (gsc_GroupNum){.num=gn};
3553 }
3554 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(existing_groups);
3555}
3556
3564gsc_LabelID gsc_get_new_label_id( const gsc_SimData* d ) {
3565 // label_ids must be in sequential order
3566 gsc_LabelID new = {.id=1};
3567 int i = 0;
3568
3569 while (i < d->n_labels) {
3570 if (new.id < d->label_ids[i].id) {
3571 break;
3572 }
3573
3574 ++i;
3575 ++(new.id);
3576 }
3577
3578 return new;
3579}
3580
3588gsc_EffectID gsc_get_new_eff_set_id( const gsc_SimData* d ) {
3589 // label_ids must be in sequential order
3590 gsc_EffectID new = { .id=1 };
3591 int i = 0;
3592
3593 while (i < d->n_eff_sets) {
3594 if (new.id < d->eff_set_ids[i].id) {
3595 break;
3596 }
3597
3598 ++i;
3599 ++(new.id);
3600 }
3601
3602 return new;
3603}
3604
3612gsc_MapID gsc_get_new_map_id( const gsc_SimData* d) {
3613 // map IDs must be in sequential order
3614 gsc_MapID new = { .id=1 };
3615 int i = 0;
3616
3617 while (i < d->genome.n_maps) {
3618 if (new.id < d->genome.map_ids[i].id) {
3619 break;
3620 }
3621
3622 ++i;
3623 ++(new.id);
3624 }
3625
3626 return new;
3627}
3628
3629
3639int gsc_get_index_of_label( const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_LabelID label ) {
3640 if (d->n_labels <= 0) { return GSC_UNINIT; } // immediate fail
3641 if (d->n_labels == 1) { return (d->label_ids[0].id == label.id) ? 0 : GSC_UNINIT ; }
3642
3643 // If there's at least two labels then we binary search.
3644 int first = 0;
3645 int last = d->n_labels;
3646 int mid;
3647
3648 while (first <= last) {
3649 mid = (first + last) / 2;
3650
3651 if (d->label_ids[mid].id == label.id) {
3652 return mid;
3653 } else if (d->label_ids[mid].id < label.id) {
3654 first = mid + 1;
3655 } else {
3656 last = mid - 1;
3657 }
3658
3659 }
3660
3661 return GSC_UNINIT;
3662}
3663
3672int gsc_get_index_of_eff_set( const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_EffectID eff_set_id ) {
3673 if (d->n_eff_sets <= 0) { return GSC_UNINIT; } // immediate fail
3674 if (d->n_eff_sets == 1) { return (d->eff_set_ids[0].id == eff_set_id.id) ? 0 : GSC_UNINIT ; }
3675
3676 // If there's at least two labels then we binary search.
3677 int first = 0;
3678 int last = d->n_eff_sets;
3679 int mid;
3680
3681 while (first <= last) {
3682 mid = (first + last) / 2;
3683
3684 if (d->eff_set_ids[mid].id == eff_set_id.id) {
3685 return mid;
3686 } else if (d->eff_set_ids[mid].id < eff_set_id.id) {
3687 first = mid + 1;
3688 } else {
3689 last = mid - 1;
3690 }
3691
3692 }
3693
3694 return GSC_UNINIT;
3695}
3696
3705int gsc_get_index_of_map( const SimData* d, const gsc_MapID map ) {
3706 if (d->genome.n_maps <= 0) { return GSC_UNINIT; } // immediate fail
3707 if (d->genome.n_maps == 1) { return (d->genome.map_ids[0].id == map.id) ? 0 : GSC_UNINIT ; }
3708
3709 // If there's at least two labels then we binary search.
3710 int first = 0;
3711 int last = d->genome.n_maps;
3712 int mid;
3713
3714 while (first <= last) {
3715 mid = (first + last) / 2;
3716
3717 if (d->genome.map_ids[mid].id == map.id) {
3718 return mid;
3719 } else if (d->genome.map_ids[mid].id < map.id) {
3720 first = mid + 1;
3721 } else {
3722 last = mid - 1;
3723 }
3724
3725 }
3726
3727 return GSC_UNINIT;
3728}
3729
3730//-----------------------------------Data Access-----------------------------------
3731
3753int gsc_get_group_size( const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group_id) {
3754 if (group_id.num == GSC_NO_GROUP.num) {
3755 return 0; // it is not a group so it does not have a size
3756 }
3757 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
3758 int size = 0;
3759 int i;
3760 while (1) {
3761 for (i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
3762 if (m->groups[i].num == group_id.num) {
3763 ++size;
3764 }
3765 }
3766
3767 if (m->next == NULL) {
3768 return size;
3769 } else {
3770 m = m->next;
3771 }
3772 }
3773}
3774
3800int gsc_get_group_genes( const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group_id, int group_size, char** output) {
3801 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
3802 if (group_size <= 0) { // group_size == GSC_UNINIT
3803 group_size = gsc_get_group_size( d, group_id );
3804 if (group_size == 0) { return 0; }
3805 }
3806 int i, genes_i = 0;
3807 while (1) {
3808 for (i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
3809 if (m->groups[i].num == group_id.num) {
3810 output[genes_i] = m->alleles[i];
3811 ++genes_i;
3812 }
3813 }
3814
3815 if (m->next == NULL) {
3816 return group_size;
3817 } else {
3818 m = m->next;
3819 }
3820 }
3821}
3822
3847int gsc_get_group_names( const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group_id, int group_size, char** output) {
3848 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
3849 if (group_size <= 0) { // group_size == GSC_UNINIT
3850 group_size = gsc_get_group_size( d, group_id );
3851 if (group_size == 0) { return 0; }
3852 }
3853 int i, names_i = 0;
3854 while (1) {
3855 for (i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
3856 if (m->groups[i].num == group_id.num) {
3857 output[names_i] = m->names[i];
3858 ++names_i;
3859 }
3860 }
3861
3862 if (m->next == NULL) {
3863 return group_size;
3864 } else {
3865 m = m->next;
3866 }
3867 }
3868}
3869
3892int gsc_get_group_ids( const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group_id, int group_size, gsc_PedigreeID *output) {
3893 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
3894 if (group_size <= 0) { // group_size == GSC_UNINIT
3895 group_size = gsc_get_group_size( d, group_id );
3896 if (group_size == 0) { return 0; }
3897 }
3898 int i, ids_i = 0;
3899 while (1) {
3900 for (i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
3901 if (m->groups[i].num == group_id.num) {
3902 output[ids_i] = m->ids[i];
3903 ++ids_i;
3904 }
3905 }
3906
3907 if (m->next == NULL) {
3908 return group_size;
3909 } else {
3910 m = m->next;
3911 }
3912 }
3913}
3914
3938int gsc_get_group_indexes(const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group_id, int group_size, size_t* output) {
3939 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
3940 if (group_size <= 0) { // group_size == GSC_UNINIT
3941 group_size = gsc_get_group_size( d, group_id );
3942 if (group_size == 0) { return 0; }
3943 }
3944 int i, total_i = 0, ids_i = 0;
3945 while (1) {
3946 for (i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i, ++total_i) {
3947 if (m->groups[i].num == group_id.num) {
3948 output[ids_i] = total_i;
3949 ++ids_i;
3950 }
3951 }
3952
3953 if (m->next == NULL) {
3954 return group_size;
3955 } else {
3956 m = m->next;
3957 }
3958 }
3959}
3960
3984int gsc_get_group_bvs( const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group_id, const gsc_EffectID effID, int group_size, double* output) {
3985 if (group_size <= 0) { // group_size == GSC_UNINIT
3986 group_size = gsc_get_group_size( d, group_id );
3987 if (group_size == 0) { return 0; }
3988 }
3989
3990 gsc_DecimalMatrix dm_bvs = gsc_calculate_bvs(d, group_id, effID );
3991
3992 for (int i = 0; i < dm_bvs.cols; ++i) {
3993 output[i] = dm_bvs.matrix[0][i];
3994 }
3995
3996 gsc_delete_dmatrix(&dm_bvs);
3997
3998 return group_size;
3999}
4000
4027int gsc_get_group_parent_ids( const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group_id, int group_size, const int whichParent, gsc_PedigreeID* output) {
4028 if (!(whichParent == 1 || whichParent == 2)) {
4029 fprintf(stderr, "Value error: `parent` must be 1 or 2.");
4030 return GSC_UNINIT;
4031 }
4032 int parent = whichParent - 1;
4033
4034 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
4035 if (group_size <= 0) { // group_size == GSC_UNINIT
4036 group_size = gsc_get_group_size( d, group_id );
4037 if (group_size == 0) { return 0; }
4038 }
4039 int i, ids_i = 0;
4040 while (1) {
4041 for (i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
4042 if (m->groups[i].num == group_id.num) {
4043 output[ids_i] = m->pedigrees[parent][i];
4044 ++ids_i;
4045 }
4046 }
4047
4048 if (m->next == NULL) {
4049 return group_size;
4050 } else {
4051 m = m->next;
4052 }
4053 }
4054}
4055
4084int gsc_get_group_parent_names( const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group_id, int group_size, const int whichParent, char** output) {
4085 if (!(whichParent == 1 || whichParent == 2)) {
4086 fprintf(stderr, "Value error: `parent` must be 1 or 2.");
4087 return GSC_UNINIT;
4088 }
4089 int parent = whichParent - 1;
4090
4091 const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
4092 if (group_size <= 0) { // group_size == GSC_UNINIT
4093 group_size = gsc_get_group_size( d, group_id );
4094 if (group_size == 0) { return 0; }
4095 }
4096
4097 int i, ids_i = 0;
4098 while (1) {
4099 for (i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
4100 if (m->groups[i].num == group_id.num) {
4101 if (m->pedigrees[parent][i].id != GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
4102 output[ids_i] = gsc_get_name_of_id(d->m, m->pedigrees[parent][i]);
4103 } else {
4104 output[ids_i] = NULL;
4105 }
4106 ++ids_i;
4107 }
4108 }
4109
4110 if (m->next == NULL) {
4111 return group_size;
4112 } else {
4113 m = m->next;
4114 }
4115 }
4116}
4117
4161int gsc_get_group_pedigrees( const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group_id, int group_size, char** output) {
4162 char* fname = "gS_gpptmp";
4163 gsc_save_pedigrees(fname,d,group_id,GSC_TRUE);
4164
4165 FILE* fp2;
4166 if ((fp2 = fopen(fname, "r")) == NULL) {
4167 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to use temporary file.\n");
4168 return GSC_UNINIT;
4169 }
4170
4171 // Create the list that we will return
4172 if (group_size <= 0) { // group_size == GSC_UNINIT
4173 group_size = gsc_get_group_size( d, group_id );
4174 if (group_size == 0) { return 0; }
4175 }
4176
4177 // read one line at a time
4178 //size_t n;
4179 //int line_len;
4180 unsigned int size;
4181 unsigned int index;
4182 int nextc;
4183 for (int i = 0; i < group_size; ++i) {
4184 // getline is not available in MinGW it looks like (AUG 2021)
4185 /*gp_ped[i] = NULL;
4186 if ((line_len = getline(&(gp_ped[i]), &n, fp2)) == -1) {
4187 error("Failed to get %d th pedigree\n", i);
4188 }
4189 // remove the newline character
4190 if (gp_ped[i][line_len - 1] == '\n') {
4191 gp_ped[i][line_len - 1] = '\0';
4192 }*/
4193
4194 // a not-very-size-efficient, fgets-based line getter
4195 size = 50;
4196 index = 0;
4197 output[i] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char) * size,GSC_TRUE);
4198 while ((nextc = fgetc(fp2)) != '\n' && nextc != EOF) {
4199 output[i][index] = nextc;
4200 ++index;
4201
4202 if (index >= size) {
4203 size *= 2;
4204 char* temp = realloc(output[i], sizeof(char) * size);
4205 if (temp == NULL) {
4206 GSC_FREE(output[i]);
4207 fprintf(stderr, "Memory allocation of size %u failed.\n", size);
4208 output[i] = NULL;
4209 } else {
4210 output[i] = temp;
4211 }
4212 }
4213 }
4214 output[i][index] = '\0';
4215 }
4216
4217 fclose(fp2);
4218 remove(fname);
4219
4220 return group_size;
4221}
4222
4223/*---------------------- matrix-operations.c dregs -------------------*/
4224
4232gsc_DecimalMatrix gsc_generate_zero_dmatrix(const int r, const int c) {
4233 gsc_DecimalMatrix zeros;
4234 zeros.rows = r;
4235 zeros.cols = c;
4236
4237 zeros.matrix = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(double*) * r,GSC_TRUE);
4238 for (int i = 0; i < r; ++i) {
4239 zeros.matrix[i] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(double) * c,GSC_TRUE);
4240 for (int j = 0; j < c; ++j) {
4241 zeros.matrix[i][j] = 0.0;
4242 }
4243 }
4244 return zeros;
4245}
4246
4262int gsc_add_matrixvector_product_to_dmatrix(gsc_DecimalMatrix* result, const gsc_DecimalMatrix* a, const double* b) {
4263 /*if (a->cols != b->rows) {
4264 fprintf(stderr, "Dimensions invalid for matrix multiplication."); exit(1);
4265 }*/
4266
4267 //if (result->rows != a->rows || result->cols != b->cols) {
4268 if (result->cols != a->rows) { //these dimensions make it so result is one heap array, using only first row.
4269 fprintf(stderr, "Dimensions invalid for adding to result: %d does not fit in %d\n", a->rows, result->cols);
4270 return 1;
4271 }
4272
4273 double cell;
4274
4275 for (int i = 0; i < result->cols; ++i) {
4276 cell = 0;
4277 for (int j = 0; j < a->cols; ++j) {
4278 // for each cell, we loop through each of the pairs adjacent to it.
4279 cell += (a->matrix[i][j]) * b[j];
4280 }
4281
4282 result->matrix[0][i] += cell;
4283 }
4284
4285 return 0;
4286
4287}
4288
4312int gsc_add_doublematrixvector_product_to_dmatrix(gsc_DecimalMatrix* result, const gsc_DecimalMatrix* amat, const double* avec,
4313 const gsc_DecimalMatrix* bmat, const double* bvec) {
4314
4315 if (result->cols != amat->rows) { //these dimensions make it so result is one heap array, using only first row.
4316 fprintf(stderr, "Dimensions invalid for adding to result: %d does not fit in %d\n", amat->rows, result->cols);
4317 return 1;
4318 }
4319 if (result->cols != bmat->rows) {
4320 fprintf(stderr, "Dimensions invalid for adding to result: %d does not fit in %d\n", bmat->rows, result->cols);
4321 return 1;
4322 }
4323 if (amat->cols != bmat->cols) {
4324 fprintf(stderr, "Dimensions of the two products are uneven: length %d does not match length %d\n", amat->cols, bmat->cols);
4325 return 1;
4326 }
4327
4328 double cell;
4329
4330 for (int i = 0; i < result->cols; ++i) {
4331 cell = 0;
4332 for (int j = 0; j < amat->cols; ++j) {
4333 // for each cell, we loop through each of the pairs adjacent to it.
4334 cell += (amat->matrix[i][j]) * avec[j];
4335 cell += (bmat->matrix[i][j]) * bvec[j];
4336 }
4337
4338 result->matrix[0][i] += cell;
4339 }
4340
4341 return 0;
4342}
4343
4344
4350void gsc_delete_dmatrix(gsc_DecimalMatrix* m) {
4351 if (m->matrix != NULL) {
4352 for (int i = 0; i < m->rows; i++) {
4353 if (m->matrix[i] != NULL) {
4354 GSC_FREE(m->matrix[i]);
4355 }
4356 }
4357 GSC_FREE(m->matrix);
4358 m->matrix = NULL;
4359 }
4360 m->cols = 0;
4361 m->rows = 0;
4362}
4363
4364
4365/*--------------------------------Deleting-----------------------------------*/
4366
4380void gsc_delete_group(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group_id) {
4381 gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
4382 int i, deleted, total_deleted = 0;
4383 while (1) {
4384
4385 for (i = 0, deleted = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i) {
4386 if (m->groups[i].num == group_id.num) {
4387 // delete data
4388 if (m->names[i] != NULL) {
4389 GSC_FREE(m->names[i]);
4390 m->names[i] = NULL;
4391 }
4392 if (m->alleles[i] != NULL) {
4393 GSC_FREE(m->alleles[i]);
4394 m->alleles[i] = NULL;
4395 }
4396 m->ids[i] = GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
4397 m->pedigrees[0][i] = GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
4398 m->pedigrees[1][i] = GSC_NO_PEDIGREE;
4399 m->groups[i] = GSC_NO_GROUP;
4400 ++deleted;
4401 }
4402 }
4403 m->n_genotypes -= deleted;
4404 total_deleted += deleted;
4405
4406 if (m->next == NULL) {
4407 gsc_condense_allele_matrix( d );
4408 printf("%d genotypes were deleted\n", total_deleted);
4409 d->n_groups--;
4410 return;
4411 } else {
4412 m = m->next;
4413 }
4414 }
4415}
4416
4424void gsc_delete_eff_set(gsc_SimData* d, gsc_EffectID effID) {
4425 int which_ix = gsc_get_index_of_eff_set(d, effID);
4426 if (which_ix == GSC_UNINIT) {
4427 fprintf(stderr, "Nonexistent effect set %d\n", effID.id);
4428 return;
4429 }
4430
4431 if (d->n_eff_sets == 1) {
4432 gsc_delete_effect_matrix(d->e);
4433 d->n_eff_sets = 0;
4434 GSC_FREE(d->e);
4435 GSC_FREE(d->eff_set_ids);
4436 d->e = NULL;
4437 d->eff_set_ids = NULL;
4438 } else {
4439 d->n_eff_sets--;
4440
4441 gsc_delete_effect_matrix(d->e + which_ix);
4442 gsc_EffectMatrix* newE = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*d->e)*d->n_eff_sets,GSC_FALSE);
4443 if (newE == NULL) {
4444 gsc_EffectMatrix cleared = d->e[which_ix];
4445 for (int i = which_ix; i < d->n_eff_sets-1; ++i) {
4446 d->e[i] = d->e[i+1];
4447 }
4448 d->e[d->n_eff_sets] = cleared;
4449 } else {
4450 memcpy(newE, d->e, sizeof(*d->e)*which_ix);
4451 memcpy(newE + which_ix, d->e + which_ix + 1, sizeof(*d->e)*(d->n_eff_sets - which_ix));
4452 GSC_FREE(d->e);
4453 d->e = newE;
4454 }
4455
4456 gsc_EffectID* newIDs = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*d->eff_set_ids)*d->n_eff_sets,GSC_FALSE);
4457 if (newIDs == NULL) {
4458 for (int i = which_ix; i < d->n_eff_sets-1; ++i) {
4459 d->eff_set_ids[i] = d->eff_set_ids[i+1];
4460 }
4461 d->eff_set_ids[d->n_eff_sets] = NO_EFFECTSET;
4462 } else {
4463 memcpy(newIDs, d->eff_set_ids, sizeof(*d->eff_set_ids)*which_ix);
4464 memcpy(newIDs + which_ix, d->eff_set_ids + which_ix + 1, sizeof(*d->eff_set_ids)*(d->n_eff_sets - which_ix));
4465 GSC_FREE(d->eff_set_ids);
4466 d->eff_set_ids = newIDs;
4467 }
4468 }
4469}
4470
4478void gsc_delete_label(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_LabelID which_label) {
4479 int label_ix;
4480 if (which_label.id == GSC_NO_LABEL.id || (label_ix = gsc_get_index_of_label(d, which_label)) < 0) {
4481 fprintf(stderr, "Nonexistent label %d\n", which_label.id);
4482 return;
4483 }
4484
4485 if (d->n_labels == 1) {
4486 // Delete 'em all
4487 d->n_labels = 0;
4488 GSC_FREE(d->label_ids);
4489 d->label_ids = NULL;
4490 GSC_FREE(d->label_defaults);
4491 d->label_defaults = NULL;
4492
4493 gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
4494 do {
4495
4496 GSC_FREE(m->labels[0]);
4497 GSC_FREE(m->labels);
4498 m->labels = NULL;
4499
4500 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
4501
4502 } else {
4503 // Reduce the list of labels in the gsc_SimData
4504 gsc_LabelID* new_label_ids = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_LabelID) * (d->n_labels - 1),GSC_FALSE);
4505 if (new_label_ids == NULL) {
4506 for (int i = label_ix; i < d->n_labels - 1; ++i) {
4507 d->label_ids[i] = d->label_ids[i+1];
4508 }
4509 d->label_ids[d->n_labels] = GSC_NO_LABEL;
4510 } else {
4511 memcpy(new_label_ids,d->label_ids,sizeof(*d->label_ids)*label_ix);
4512 memcpy(new_label_ids + label_ix,d->label_ids + label_ix + 1, sizeof(*d->label_ids)*(d->n_labels - 1 - label_ix));
4513 GSC_FREE(d->label_ids);
4514 d->label_ids = new_label_ids;
4515 }
4516
4517 int* new_label_defaults = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int) * (d->n_labels - 1),GSC_FALSE);
4518 if (new_label_defaults == NULL) {
4519 for (int i = label_ix; i < d->n_labels - 1; ++i) {
4520 d->label_defaults[i] = d->label_defaults[i+1];
4521 }
4522 // no need to overwrite default
4523 } else {
4524 memcpy(new_label_defaults,d->label_defaults,sizeof(*d->label_defaults)*label_ix);
4525 memcpy(new_label_defaults + label_ix,d->label_defaults + label_ix + 1, sizeof(*d->label_defaults)*(d->n_labels - 1 - label_ix));
4526 GSC_FREE(d->label_defaults);
4527 d->label_defaults = new_label_defaults;
4528 }
4529 d->n_labels --;
4530
4531 // Remove the label from the gsc_AlleleMatrix linked list
4532 gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
4533 do {
4534 GSC_FREE(m->labels[label_ix]);
4535
4536 m->n_labels = d->n_labels;
4537 int** new_label_lookups = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int*) * (m->n_labels),GSC_FALSE);
4538 if (new_label_lookups == NULL) {
4539 for (int i = label_ix; i < m->n_labels; ++i) {
4540 m->labels[i] = m->labels[i+1];
4541 }
4542 m->labels[m->n_labels + 1] = NULL;
4543 } else {
4544 memcpy(new_label_lookups, m->labels, sizeof(*m->labels)*label_ix);
4545 memcpy(new_label_lookups + label_ix, m->labels + label_ix + 1, sizeof(*m->labels)*(m->n_labels - label_ix));
4546 GSC_FREE(m->labels);
4547 m->labels = new_label_lookups;
4548 }
4549 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
4550 }
4551}
4552
4559void gsc_delete_genome(gsc_KnownGenome* g) {
4560 if (g->marker_names != NULL) {
4561 for (int i = 0; i < g->n_markers; i++) {
4562 if (g->marker_names[i] != NULL) {
4563 GSC_FREE(g->marker_names[i]);
4564 }
4565 }
4566 GSC_FREE(g->marker_names);
4567 g->marker_names = NULL;
4568 }
4569 if (g->names_alphabetical != NULL) {
4570 GSC_FREE(g->names_alphabetical);
4571 g->names_alphabetical = NULL;
4572 }
4573 g->n_markers = 0;
4574
4575 if (g->map_ids != NULL) {
4576 GSC_FREE(g->map_ids);
4577 g->map_ids = NULL;
4578 }
4579
4580 if (g->maps != NULL) {
4581 for (int i = 0; i < g->n_maps; ++i) {
4582 gsc_delete_recombination_map_nointegrity(g->maps + i);
4583 }
4584 GSC_FREE(g->maps);
4585 g->maps = NULL;
4586 }
4587 g->n_maps = 0;
4588}
4589
4597void gsc_delete_recombination_map(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_MapID which_map) {
4598 int map_ix;
4599 if (which_map.id == GSC_NO_LABEL.id || (map_ix = gsc_get_index_of_map(d, which_map)) < 0) {
4600 fprintf(stderr, "Nonexistent recombination map %d\n", which_map.id);
4601 return;
4602 }
4603
4604 if (d->genome.n_maps == 1) {
4605 GSC_FREE(d->genome.map_ids);
4606 d->genome.map_ids = NULL;
4607 gsc_delete_recombination_map_nointegrity(&d->genome.maps[0]);
4608 GSC_FREE(d->genome.maps);
4609 d->genome.maps = NULL;
4610 d->genome.n_maps = 0;
4611 } else {
4612 d->genome.n_maps--;
4613 gsc_delete_recombination_map_nointegrity(&d->genome.maps[map_ix]);
4614 gsc_RecombinationMap* tmplist = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*d->genome.maps)*d->genome.n_maps, GSC_FALSE);
4615 if (tmplist == NULL) {
4616 gsc_RecombinationMap clearedmap = d->genome.maps[map_ix];
4617 for (int i = map_ix; i < d->genome.n_maps - 1; ++i) {
4618 d->genome.maps[i] = d->genome.maps[i+1];
4619 }
4620 d->genome.maps[d->genome.n_maps] = clearedmap;
4621 } else {
4622 memcpy(tmplist, d->genome.maps, sizeof(*d->genome.maps)*map_ix);
4623 memcpy(tmplist + map_ix, d->genome.maps + map_ix + 1, sizeof(*d->genome.maps)*(d->genome.n_maps - map_ix));
4624 GSC_FREE(d->genome.maps);
4625 d->genome.maps = tmplist;
4626 }
4627
4628 gsc_MapID* tmpids = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*d->genome.map_ids)*d->genome.n_maps, GSC_FALSE);
4629 if (tmpids == NULL) {
4630 for (int i = map_ix; i < d->genome.n_maps - 1; ++i) {
4631 d->genome.map_ids[i] = d->genome.map_ids[i+1];
4632 }
4633 d->genome.map_ids[d->genome.n_maps] = NO_MAP;
4634 } else {
4635 memcpy(tmpids, d->genome.map_ids, sizeof(*d->genome.map_ids)*map_ix);
4636 memcpy(tmpids + map_ix, d->genome.map_ids + map_ix + 1, sizeof(*d->genome.map_ids)*(d->genome.n_maps - map_ix));
4637 GSC_FREE(d->genome.map_ids);
4638 d->genome.map_ids = tmpids;
4639 }
4640 }
4641}
4642
4652void gsc_delete_recombination_map_nointegrity(gsc_RecombinationMap* m) {
4653 if (m->chrs != NULL) {
4654 for (int i = 0; i < m->n_chr; ++i) {
4655 switch (m->chrs[i].type) {
4656 case GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_SIMPLE:
4657 m->chrs[i].map.simple.expected_n_crossovers = 0;
4658 m->chrs[i].map.simple.first_marker_index = 0;
4659 m->chrs[i].map.simple.n_markers = 0;
4660 if (m->chrs[i].map.simple.dists != NULL) {
4661 GSC_FREE(m->chrs[i].map.simple.dists);
4662 m->chrs[i].map.simple.dists = NULL;
4663 }
4664 break;
4665 case GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_REORDER:
4666 m->chrs[i].map.reorder.expected_n_crossovers = 0;
4667 m->chrs[i].map.reorder.n_markers = 0;
4668 if (m->chrs[i].map.reorder.dists != NULL) {
4669 GSC_FREE(m->chrs[i].map.reorder.dists);
4670 m->chrs[i].map.reorder.dists = NULL;
4671 }
4672 if (m->chrs[i].map.reorder.marker_indexes != NULL) {
4673 GSC_FREE(m->chrs[i].map.reorder.marker_indexes);
4674 m->chrs[i].map.reorder.marker_indexes = NULL;
4675 }
4676 break;
4677 }
4678 }
4679 GSC_FREE(m->chrs);
4680 m->chrs = NULL;
4681 }
4682}
4683
4692void gsc_delete_allele_matrix(gsc_AlleleMatrix* m) {
4693 if (m == NULL) {
4694 return;
4695 }
4696 gsc_AlleleMatrix* next;
4697 do {
4698 /* free the big data matrix */
4699 for (int i = 0; i < CONTIG_WIDTH; i++) {
4700 if (m->alleles[i] != NULL) {
4701 GSC_FREE(m->alleles[i]);
4702 }
4703
4704 }
4705
4706 // free names
4707 for (int i = 0; i < CONTIG_WIDTH; i++) {
4708 if (m->names[i] != NULL) {
4709 GSC_FREE(m->names[i]);
4710 }
4711 }
4712
4713 // free labels
4714 for (int i = 0; i < m->n_labels; ++i) {
4715 if (m->labels[i] != NULL) {
4716 GSC_FREE(m->labels[i]);
4717 }
4718 }
4719 GSC_FREE(m->labels);
4720
4721 next = m->next;
4722 GSC_FREE(m);
4723 } while ((m = next) != NULL);
4724}
4725
4733void gsc_delete_effect_matrix(gsc_EffectMatrix* m) {
4734 gsc_delete_dmatrix(&(m->effects));
4735 if (m->effect_names != NULL) {
4736 GSC_FREE(m->effect_names);
4737 }
4738 m->effect_names = NULL;
4739}
4740
4747void gsc_delete_simdata(gsc_SimData* m) {
4748 if (m == NULL) {
4749 return;
4750 }
4751
4752 gsc_delete_genome(&(m->genome));
4753
4754 if (m->n_eff_sets > 0) {
4755 GSC_FREE(m->eff_set_ids);
4756 for (int i = 0; i < m->n_eff_sets; ++i) {
4757 gsc_delete_effect_matrix(&(m->e[i]));
4758 }
4759 GSC_FREE(m->e);
4760 }
4761
4762 gsc_delete_allele_matrix(m->m);
4763
4764 if (m->n_labels > 0) {
4765 if (m->label_ids != NULL) {
4766 GSC_FREE(m->label_ids);
4767 }
4768 if (m->label_defaults != NULL) {
4769 GSC_FREE(m->label_defaults);
4770 }
4771 }
4772
4773 if (m != NULL) {
4774 GSC_FREE(m);
4775 }
4776}
4777
4787void gsc_delete_markerblocks(gsc_MarkerBlocks* b) {
4788 for (int i = 0; i < b->num_blocks; ++i) {
4789 GSC_FREE(b->markers_in_block[i]);
4790 }
4791 GSC_FREE(b->markers_in_block);
4792 b->markers_in_block = NULL;
4793 GSC_FREE(b->num_markers_in_block);
4794 b->num_markers_in_block = NULL;
4795 b->num_blocks = 0;
4796
4797 return;
4798}
4799
4800
4814void gsc_delete_bidirectional_iter(gsc_BidirectionalIterator* it) {
4815 it->am = NULL;
4816 //it->group = GSC_NO_GROUP;
4817 it->localPos = GSC_UNINIT;
4818 it->cachedAM = NULL;
4819 it->cachedAMIndex = GSC_UNINIT;
4820 it->atEnd = GSC_TRUE;
4821 it->atStart = GSC_TRUE;
4822}
4823
4835void gsc_delete_randomaccess_iter(gsc_RandomAccessIterator* it) {
4836 it->d = NULL;
4837 //it->group = GSC_NO_GROUP;
4838 if (it->cacheSize > 0) {
4839 GSC_FREE(it->cache);
4840 }
4841 it->cache = NULL;
4842 it->cacheSize = 0;
4843 it->largestCached = GSC_UNINIT;
4844 it->groupSize = 0;
4845}
4846
4847/*-------------------------------gsc_SimData loaders-----------------------------*/
4848
4853gsc_TableFileReader gsc_tablefilereader_create(const char* filename) {
4854 FILE* fp;
4855 if ((fp = fopen(filename, "r")) == NULL) {
4856 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open file %s.\n", filename);
4857 }
4858
4859 gsc_TableFileReader tfr = { .fp = fp,
4860 .buf = { 0 },
4861 .buf_fill = 0,
4862 .cursor = 0,
4863 };
4864
4865 if (fp != NULL) {
4866 tfr.buf_fill = fread(tfr.buf,1,sizeof(tfr.buf),fp);
4867 }
4868 return tfr;
4869}
4870
4873void gsc_tablefilereader_close(gsc_TableFileReader* tbl) {
4874 if (tbl->fp != NULL) { fclose(tbl->fp); }
4875 tbl->fp = NULL;
4876}
4877
4885void gsc_helper_tablefilereader_refill_buffer(gsc_TableFileReader* tbl) {
4886 tbl->cursor = 0;
4887 if (tbl->fp != NULL) {
4888 tbl->buf_fill = fread(tbl->buf,1,sizeof(tbl->buf),tbl->fp);
4889 } else {
4890 tbl->buf_fill = 0;
4891 }
4892}
4893
4899enum gsc_TableFileCurrentStatus gsc_helper_tablefilereader_classify_char(gsc_TableFileReader* tbl) {
4900 if (tbl->buf_fill <= tbl->cursor) {
4901 if (tbl->buf_fill < sizeof(tbl->buf)) { // last read did not fill the entire buffer
4902 return GSC_TABLEFILE_ERROR_EOF;
4903 }
4904 return GSC_TABLEFILE_ERROR_EOBUF;
4905 }
4906
4907 switch (tbl->buf[tbl->cursor]) {
4908 case '\r': // allow '\r' or '\r\n' as end of lines. also allow '\n' as end of line (see following case)
4909 case '\n':
4910 return GSC_TABLEFILE_NEWLINE;
4911 case '\t':
4912 case ' ':
4913 case ',':
4914 return GSC_TABLEFILE_COLUMNGAP;
4915 default:
4916 return GSC_TABLEFILE_CONTENTS;
4917 }
4918}
4919
4928void gsc_tablefilecell_deep_copy(gsc_TableFileCell* c) {
4929 if (c->cell_len > 0 && c->isCellShallow) {
4930 char* deepcell = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char)*(c->cell_len+1), GSC_TRUE);
4931 memcpy(deepcell,c->cell,sizeof(char)*c->cell_len);
4932 deepcell[c->cell_len] = '\0';
4933 c->cell = deepcell;
4934 c->isCellShallow = GSC_FALSE;
4935 }
4936}
4937
4943gsc_TableFileCell gsc_tablefilereader_get_next_cell(gsc_TableFileReader* tbl) {
4944 gsc_TableFileCell cur = { .isCellShallow = GSC_TRUE, .cell = NULL, .cell_len = 0,
4945 .predCol = 0, .predNewline = 0, .eof = GSC_FALSE };
4946
4947 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(tmpcell,char,1);
4948 size_t tmpix = 0;
4949 size_t tblbuf_offset = 0;
4950 size_t tblbuf_len = 0;
4951 int predCarriageReturn = 0; // for detecting /r/n as a single "newline"
4952 int warned = GSC_FALSE;
4953
4954 while (1) {
4955 enum gsc_TableFileCurrentStatus type = gsc_helper_tablefilereader_classify_char(tbl);
4956 if (0 < predCarriageReturn) { --predCarriageReturn; } // decremented each time step
4957
4958 if (0 == cur.cell_len) {
4959 switch (type) {
4960 case GSC_TABLEFILE_NEWLINE:
4961 if (tbl->buf[tbl->cursor] == '\r') {
4962 predCarriageReturn = 2; // will have value 1 at next loop iteration, then will fall back to 0
4963 }
4964 if (!(predCarriageReturn && tbl->buf[tbl->cursor] == '\n')) {
4965 ++cur.predNewline;
4966 }
4967 cur.predCol = 0;
4968 ++tbl->cursor;
4969 break;
4970
4971 case GSC_TABLEFILE_COLUMNGAP:
4972 ++tbl->cursor;
4973 ++cur.predCol;
4974 break;
4975
4976 case GSC_TABLEFILE_ERROR_EOBUF:
4977 // just refill as we have no contents we need to save yet
4978 gsc_helper_tablefilereader_refill_buffer(tbl);
4979 if (0 < predCarriageReturn) { ++predCarriageReturn; } // should not tick down the counter this loop iteration
4980 break;
4981
4982 case GSC_TABLEFILE_CONTENTS:
4983 tblbuf_offset = tbl->cursor; tblbuf_len = 1; // in case we need to make a deep copy later.
4984 cur.cell = tbl->buf + tbl->cursor;
4985 ++cur.cell_len;
4986 ++tbl->cursor;
4987 break;
4988
4989 default:
4990 ++tbl->cursor;
4991 cur.eof = GSC_TRUE;
4992 return cur;
4993 }
4994
4995 } else { // have found the cell, just need to read the rest of it
4996 switch (type) {
4997 case GSC_TABLEFILE_CONTENTS:
4998 ++tbl->cursor;
4999 ++tblbuf_len;
5000 ++cur.cell_len;
5001 break;
5002
5003 case GSC_TABLEFILE_ERROR_EOBUF:
5004 cur.isCellShallow = GSC_FALSE;
5005
5006 if (!warned && tblbuf_len > 8192) {
5007 warned = GSC_TRUE;
5008 fprintf(stderr,"Warning: very long cell identified beginning %c%c%c%c%c%c. Column separators may have failed to be recognised\n",
5009 tmpcell[0],tmpcell[1],tmpcell[2],tmpcell[3],tmpcell[4],tmpcell[5]);
5010 }
5011
5012 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(tmpcell,tmpix + tblbuf_len + 1);
5013 memcpy(tmpcell+tmpix,tbl->buf+tblbuf_offset,sizeof(char)*tblbuf_len);
5014 tmpix += tblbuf_len;
5015 tmpcell[tmpix] = '\0';
5016
5017 tblbuf_offset = 0; tblbuf_len = 0;
5018 gsc_helper_tablefilereader_refill_buffer(tbl);
5019 break;
5020
5021 case GSC_TABLEFILE_ERROR_EOF:
5022 ++tbl->cursor;
5023 cur.eof = GSC_TRUE;
5024 // fall through
5025 default: // newline or column gap or end of file discovered: save and return.
5026 if (!cur.isCellShallow) {
5027 cur.cell = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char)*(cur.cell_len + 1),GSC_TRUE);
5028 memcpy(cur.cell,tmpcell,sizeof(char)*tmpix);
5029 if (0 < tblbuf_len) {
5030 memcpy(cur.cell+tmpix,tbl->buf+tblbuf_offset,sizeof(char)*tblbuf_len);
5031 }
5032 cur.cell[cur.cell_len] = '\0';
5033 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(tmpcell);
5034 }
5035 return cur;
5036 }
5037 }
5038 }
5039}
5040
5050int gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(const char* target, gsc_KnownGenome g, size_t* out) {
5051 unsigned int first = 0, last = g.n_markers - 1;
5052 int index = (first + last) / 2;
5053 int comparison = strcmp(target,*(g.names_alphabetical[index]));
5054 while (comparison != 0 && first <= last) {
5055 if (comparison == 0) {
5056 if (out != NULL) *out = g.names_alphabetical[index] - g.marker_names;
5057 return GSC_TRUE;
5058 } else if (comparison > 0) {
5059 first = index + 1;
5060 if (first >= g.n_markers) { return GSC_FALSE; }
5061 } else {
5062 if (index == 0) { return GSC_FALSE; }
5063 last = index - 1;
5064 }
5065
5066 // index has been updated, no matter the branch.
5067 index = (first + last) / 2;
5068 comparison = strcmp(target, *(g.names_alphabetical[index]));
5069 }
5070
5071 if (first > last) {
5072 return GSC_FALSE;
5073 }
5074 if (out != NULL) *out = g.names_alphabetical[index] - g.marker_names;
5075 return GSC_TRUE;
5076}
5077
5087static gsc_TableFileCell gsc_helper_tablefilereader_get_next_cell_wqueue(gsc_TableFileReader* tf, gsc_TableFileCell** queue, size_t* queuesize) {
5088 gsc_TableFileCell ncell;
5089 if (*queuesize > 0) {
5090 ncell = *queue[0];
5091 /*for (int i = 1; i < *queuesize; ++i) { *queue[i-1] = *queue[i]; }*/
5092 ++*queue;
5093 --*queuesize;
5094 } else {
5095 ncell = gsc_tablefilereader_get_next_cell(tf);
5096 }
5097 return ncell;
5098}
5099
5130static int gsc_helper_parse_3cell_header(gsc_TableFileReader* tf, const char** canonical_titles, int* col_order,
5131 gsc_TableFileCell* unprocessedqueue, size_t* queuesize) {
5132 const int ncells = 3;
5133 const int INVALID_COLS = -1;
5134
5135 // assume unprocessedqueue has at least 4 spaces, titles has 3 entries and so does col_order
5136 size_t newest = 0;
5137 size_t onelinefile = GSC_FALSE;
5138 for (; newest < ncells; ++newest) {
5139 unprocessedqueue[newest] = gsc_tablefilereader_get_next_cell(tf);
5140 if ((unprocessedqueue[newest]).eof) {
5141 if (newest + 1 < ncells) {
5142 if (!((unprocessedqueue[newest]).isCellShallow)) { GSC_FREE((unprocessedqueue[newest]).cell); }
5143 *queuesize = newest; // newest does not exist in return group
5144 return INVALID_COLS;
5145 } else { // column 3 has eof at the end of it. That's okay.
5146 onelinefile = GSC_TRUE;
5147 *queuesize = newest + 1;
5148 }
5149 } else if ((unprocessedqueue[newest]).predNewline) {
5150 *queuesize = newest+1; // newest index included in return group
5151 return INVALID_COLS;
5152 }
5153 gsc_tablefilecell_deep_copy(unprocessedqueue + newest);
5154 }
5155 if (!onelinefile) {
5156 unprocessedqueue[newest] = gsc_tablefilereader_get_next_cell(tf); // four cell
5157 *queuesize = newest + 1;
5158 }
5159
5160 // Check which ordering of the three titles it is.
5161 for (int i1 = 0; i1 < ncells; ++i1) {
5162 if (strcmp((unprocessedqueue[i1]).cell,canonical_titles[0]) == 0) {
5163 for (int inc = 1; inc < ncells; ++inc) {
5164 int i2 = (i1 + inc) % ncells;
5165 int i3 = (i1 + (ncells - inc)) % ncells;
5166 if (strcmp((unprocessedqueue[i2]).cell,canonical_titles[1]) == 0 &&
5167 strcmp((unprocessedqueue[i3]).cell,canonical_titles[2]) == 0) {
5168 col_order[0] = i1 + 1;
5169 col_order[1] = i2 + 1;
5170 col_order[2] = i3 + 1;
5171 GSC_FREE((unprocessedqueue[0]).cell);
5172 GSC_FREE((unprocessedqueue[1]).cell);
5173 GSC_FREE((unprocessedqueue[2]).cell);
5174 unprocessedqueue[0] = unprocessedqueue[3];
5175 *queuesize = 1;
5176 return GSC_TRUE;
5177 }
5178 }
5179 }
5180 }
5181
5182 return GSC_FALSE;
5183}
5184
5218static size_t gsc_helper_parse_mapfile(const char* filename, struct gsc_MapfileUnit** out) {
5219 if (filename == NULL) return 0;
5220
5221 gsc_TableFileReader tf = gsc_tablefilereader_create(filename);
5222
5223 size_t row = 1;
5224 size_t col = 1;
5225
5226 gsc_TableFileCell cellsread[4] = { 0 };
5227 gsc_TableFileCell* cellqueue = cellsread;
5228 size_t queue_size;
5229 const char* titles[] = { "marker", "chr", "pos"};
5230 int colnums[] = { 1, 2, 3 };
5231 int header = gsc_helper_parse_3cell_header(&tf, titles, colnums, cellqueue, &queue_size);
5232 if (header == GSC_TRUE) {
5233 printf("(Loading %s) Format: map file with header\n", filename);
5234 } else if (header == GSC_FALSE) {
5235 printf("(Loading %s) Format: map file without header\n", filename);
5236 } else {
5237 printf("(Loading %s) Failure: Cannot identify the expected 3 columns of the map file\n", filename);
5238 gsc_tablefilereader_close(&tf);
5239 return 0;
5240 }
5241 int marker_colnum = colnums[0], chr_colnum = colnums[1], pos_colnum = colnums[2];
5242
5243 int goodrow = (header) ? GSC_FALSE : GSC_TRUE; // discard first row if it's a header, keep if it's not.
5244 size_t goodrow_counter = 0;
5245
5246 char* marker = NULL;
5247 unsigned long chr = 0;
5248 double pos = 0;
5249 char* conversionflag;
5250
5251 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(buffer,struct gsc_MapfileUnit,CONTIG_WIDTH);
5252
5253 gsc_TableFileCell ncell;
5254 do {
5255 ncell = gsc_helper_tablefilereader_get_next_cell_wqueue(&tf, &cellqueue, &queue_size);
5256
5257 // Update row/col position and save predecessor row
5258 if (ncell.cell != NULL) {
5259 if (ncell.predNewline) {
5260 if (goodrow) { // save predecessor row
5261 buffer[goodrow_counter].name = marker;
5262 buffer[goodrow_counter].chr = chr;
5263 buffer[goodrow_counter].pos = pos;
5264
5265 ++goodrow_counter;
5266 if (goodrow_counter >= buffercap) {
5267 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(buffer,2*row);
5268 }
5269 marker = NULL;
5270 } else if (marker != NULL) {
5271 GSC_FREE(marker);
5272 }
5273 row += ncell.predNewline;
5274 goodrow = GSC_TRUE;
5275 col = 1;
5276 }
5277 col += (ncell.predCol > 0) ? GSC_TRUE : GSC_FALSE;
5278
5279 // Parse this cell
5280 if (ncell.cell_len == 0) {
5281 goodrow = GSC_FALSE;
5282 } if (col == marker_colnum) {
5283 gsc_tablefilecell_deep_copy(&ncell);
5284 marker = ncell.cell;
5285 ncell.isCellShallow = GSC_TRUE; // so it isn't freed.
5286
5287 } else if (col == chr_colnum) {
5288 char tmp = ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len]; ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len] = '\0';
5289 chr = strtoul(ncell.cell,&conversionflag,36);
5290 ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len] = tmp;
5291 if (conversionflag != ncell.cell + ncell.cell_len) { // unsuccessful read
5292 //fprintf(stderr,"Entry at row %i column %i of file %s could not be parsed as an integer or alphanumeric string\n", row, chr_colnum, filename);
5293 goodrow = GSC_FALSE;
5294 }
5295
5296 } else if (col == pos_colnum) {
5297 char tmp = ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len]; ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len] = '\0';
5298 pos = strtod(ncell.cell,&conversionflag);
5299 ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len] = tmp;
5300 if (conversionflag != ncell.cell + ncell.cell_len) { // unsuccessful read
5301 goodrow = GSC_FALSE;
5302 //fprintf(stderr,"Entry at row %i column %i of file %s could not be parsed as a numeric value\n", row, pos_colnum, filename);
5303 }
5304
5305 } else {
5306 goodrow = GSC_FALSE;
5307 }
5308
5309 // Reset to get next cell.
5310 if (!ncell.isCellShallow) { GSC_FREE(ncell.cell); }
5311 }
5312 } while (!ncell.eof);
5313
5314 if (col == 3) {
5315 if (goodrow) { // save predecessor row
5316 buffer[goodrow_counter].name = marker;
5317 buffer[goodrow_counter].chr = chr;
5318 buffer[goodrow_counter].pos = pos;
5319
5320 ++goodrow_counter;
5321 marker = NULL;
5322 } else if (marker != NULL) {
5323 GSC_FREE(marker);
5324 }
5325 }
5326 //row -= ncell.predNewline; // don't count trailing newlines in stats.
5327
5328 printf("(Loading %s) %u marker(s) with map positions were loaded. Failed to parse %u line(s).\n", filename, (unsigned int) goodrow_counter, (unsigned int) (row - header - goodrow_counter));
5329 gsc_tablefilereader_close(&tf);
5330
5331 // Check outputs. We don't delete the buffers because we want to leave them alive with our callers holding the handles.
5332 GSC_FINALISE_BUFFER(buffer,*out,goodrow_counter);
5333 return goodrow_counter;
5334}
5335
5336
5353static size_t gsc_helper_str_markerlist_leftjoin( gsc_KnownGenome g, size_t n_markers_in_list, struct gsc_MapfileUnit** markerlist ) {
5354 struct gsc_MapfileUnit* rlist = *markerlist;
5355 size_t n_joined = 0;
5356 /*size_t consecutivity_bias; // we cache the index of the last name we found and pre-check whether the next marker
5357 // in the list is the next marker in the genome. For the case where people organise their genotype file and genetic
5358 // map file in the same order. Edit: decided this is not likely enough a situation to build this in.*/
5359
5360 for (size_t i = 0; i < n_markers_in_list; ++i) {
5361 if (rlist[i].name != NULL) {
5362 size_t nameix;
5363 if (gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(rlist[i].name, g, &nameix)) {
5364 if (n_joined != i) {
5365 rlist[n_joined] = rlist[i];
5366 }
5367 n_joined++;
5368
5369 } else { // discard this marker. n_joined lags behind i by one more step.
5370 GSC_FREE(rlist[i].name);
5371
5372 }
5373 }
5374 }
5375
5376 return n_joined;
5377}
5378
5379
5382static gsc_MapID gsc_helper_insert_recombmap_into_simdata(gsc_SimData* d, gsc_RecombinationMap map) {
5383 int newmapindex = 0;
5384 if (d->genome.n_maps > 0) {
5385 newmapindex = d->genome.n_maps;
5386
5387 gsc_MapID* tmpMapIDs = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_MapID)*(newmapindex+1),GSC_TRUE);
5388 memcpy(tmpMapIDs,d->genome.map_ids,sizeof(gsc_MapID)*newmapindex);
5389 GSC_FREE(d->genome.map_ids);
5390 d->genome.map_ids = tmpMapIDs;
5391
5392 gsc_RecombinationMap* tmpMaps = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_RecombinationMap)*(newmapindex+1),GSC_TRUE);
5393 memcpy(tmpMaps,d->genome.maps,sizeof(gsc_RecombinationMap)*newmapindex);
5394 GSC_FREE(d->genome.maps);
5395 d->genome.maps = tmpMaps;
5396
5397 } else {
5398 d->genome.map_ids = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_MapID)*1,GSC_TRUE);
5399 d->genome.maps = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_RecombinationMap)*1,GSC_TRUE);
5400 }
5401 d->genome.map_ids[newmapindex] = gsc_get_new_map_id(d);
5402 d->genome.n_maps++;
5403 d->genome.maps[newmapindex] = map;
5404
5405 return d->genome.map_ids[newmapindex];
5406}
5407
5410static gsc_EffectID gsc_helper_insert_eff_set_into_simdata(gsc_SimData* d, gsc_EffectMatrix effset) {
5411 int neweffsetindex = 0;
5412 if (d->n_eff_sets > 0) {
5413 neweffsetindex = d->n_eff_sets;
5414
5415 gsc_EffectID* tmpIDs = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_EffectID)*(neweffsetindex+1),GSC_TRUE);
5416 memcpy(tmpIDs,d->eff_set_ids,sizeof(gsc_EffectID)*neweffsetindex);
5417 GSC_FREE(d->eff_set_ids);
5418 d->eff_set_ids = tmpIDs;
5419
5420 gsc_EffectMatrix* tmpMats = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_EffectMatrix)*(neweffsetindex+1),GSC_TRUE);
5421 memcpy(tmpMats,d->e,sizeof(gsc_EffectMatrix)*neweffsetindex);
5422 GSC_FREE(d->e);
5423 d->e = tmpMats;
5424
5425 } else {
5426 d->eff_set_ids = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_EffectID)*1,GSC_TRUE);
5427 d->e = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_EffectMatrix)*1,GSC_TRUE);
5428 }
5429 d->eff_set_ids[neweffsetindex] = gsc_get_new_eff_set_id(d);
5430 d->n_eff_sets++;
5431 d->e[neweffsetindex] = effset;
5432
5433 return d->eff_set_ids[neweffsetindex];
5434}
5435
5442static void gsc_helper_sort_markerlist(size_t n_markers, struct gsc_MapfileUnit* markerlist) {
5443 if (n_markers < 2) { return; }
5444
5445 // sort by linkage group
5446 qsort(markerlist,n_markers,sizeof(*markerlist),gsc_helper_mapfileunit_ascending_chr_comparer);
5447
5448 // sort each linkage group by pos
5449 //int n_chr = 1;
5450 size_t chr_start = 0;
5451 unsigned long current_chr = markerlist[0].chr;
5452
5453 for (size_t i = 1; i < n_markers; ++i) {
5454 if (markerlist[i].chr != current_chr) { // found end of current chr
5455 //n_chr++;
5456 qsort(markerlist + chr_start, i - chr_start,
5457 sizeof(*markerlist), gsc_helper_mapfileunit_ascending_d_comparer);
5458
5459 chr_start = i;
5460 current_chr = markerlist[i].chr;
5461 }
5462 }
5463
5464 qsort(markerlist + chr_start, n_markers - chr_start,
5465 sizeof(*markerlist), gsc_helper_mapfileunit_ascending_d_comparer);
5466 //return n_chr;
5467}
5468
5482gsc_MapID gsc_create_recombmap_from_markerlist(gsc_SimData* d, size_t n_markers, struct gsc_MapfileUnit* markerlist) {
5483 if (n_markers == 0) return NO_MAP;
5484
5485 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(chr_nmembers,size_t,40);
5486 memset(chr_nmembers,0,sizeof(*chr_nmembers)*40);
5487 chr_nmembers[0] = 1;
5488 size_t n_chr = 1;
5489 unsigned long current_chr = markerlist[0].chr;
5490 for (size_t i = 1; i < n_markers; ++i) {
5491 while (i < n_markers && markerlist[i].name == NULL) {
5492 ++i;
5493 }
5494 if (current_chr != markerlist[i].chr) {
5495 // First of next
5496 if (n_chr >= chr_nmemberscap) {
5497 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(chr_nmembers,2*n_chr);
5498 memset(chr_nmembers+n_chr,0,sizeof(*chr_nmembers)*n_chr);
5499 }
5500 ++n_chr;
5501 current_chr = markerlist[i].chr;
5502 chr_nmembers[n_chr-1] = 1;
5503 } else {
5504 ++(chr_nmembers[n_chr-1]);
5505 }
5506 }
5507
5508 gsc_RecombinationMap map = {.n_chr=n_chr, .chrs=gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_LinkageGroup) * n_chr, GSC_TRUE) };
5509
5510 // Populate the map. Each chr/linkage group may be "Simple" or "Reordered"
5511 size_t could_not_match = 0;
5512 size_t current_marker = 0;
5513 size_t first_marker;
5514 int n_bad_chr = 0;
5515 for (int chr_ix = 0; chr_ix < map.n_chr; ++chr_ix) {
5516 first_marker = current_marker;
5517 double chrdist = markerlist[first_marker + chr_nmembers[chr_ix] - 1].pos - markerlist[first_marker].pos;
5518 double* lgdists = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(double)*(chr_nmembers[chr_ix]),GSC_TRUE);
5519
5520 char found_first = GSC_FALSE;
5521 // n_goodmembers == 0 is a guard on firsts_coord_in_genome, but we
5522 // still initialise it here (to a value too high to be reasonable)
5523 // because the compiler can't tell that.
5524 size_t firsts_coord_in_genome = d->genome.n_markers;
5525 size_t n_goodmembers = 0;
5526 size_t* marker_coords = NULL;
5527
5528 size_t endpt = first_marker + chr_nmembers[chr_ix];
5529 for (; current_marker < endpt; ++current_marker) { // simple recombination map, if possible
5530 if (markerlist[current_marker].name == NULL) {
5531 continue;
5532 }
5533
5534 if (!found_first) {
5535 size_t coord;
5536 if (!gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(markerlist[current_marker].name, d->genome, &coord)) {
5537 could_not_match++;
5538 } else {
5539 found_first = GSC_TRUE;
5540 first_marker = current_marker;
5541 firsts_coord_in_genome = coord;
5542 lgdists[n_goodmembers] = (markerlist[current_marker].pos - markerlist[first_marker].pos) / chrdist;
5543 n_goodmembers++;
5544 }
5545 } else if (firsts_coord_in_genome + n_goodmembers < d->genome.n_markers &&
5546 strcmp(markerlist[current_marker].name, d->genome.marker_names[firsts_coord_in_genome + n_goodmembers]) == 0) {
5547 // we are a simple linkage group still so far.
5548 lgdists[n_goodmembers] = (markerlist[current_marker].pos - markerlist[first_marker].pos) / chrdist;
5549 n_goodmembers++;
5550 } else {
5551 // Just discovered we are a reordered linkage group. Copy over the marker indexes that were as expected.
5552 marker_coords = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*marker_coords)*(chr_nmembers[chr_ix]),GSC_TRUE);
5553 for (size_t backfill = 0; backfill < n_goodmembers; ++backfill) {
5554 marker_coords[backfill] = firsts_coord_in_genome + backfill;
5555 }
5556 break;
5557 }
5558
5559 }
5560 for (; current_marker < endpt; ++current_marker) { // reordered recombination map, if previous failed.
5561 if (markerlist[current_marker].name == NULL) {
5562 continue;
5563 }
5564
5565 size_t coord;
5566 if (!gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(markerlist[current_marker].name, d->genome, &coord)) {
5567 ++could_not_match;
5568 } else {
5569 marker_coords[n_goodmembers] = coord;
5570 lgdists[n_goodmembers] = (markerlist[current_marker].pos - markerlist[first_marker].pos) / chrdist;
5571 ++n_goodmembers;
5572 }
5573 }
5574
5575 if (n_goodmembers == 0) { // || firsts_coord_in_genome >= d->genome.n_markers) {
5576 n_bad_chr++;
5577 } else if (marker_coords == NULL) {
5578 int chr_ix_actual = chr_ix-n_bad_chr;
5579 map.chrs[chr_ix_actual].type = GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_SIMPLE;
5580 map.chrs[chr_ix_actual].map.simple.expected_n_crossovers = chrdist / 100;
5581 map.chrs[chr_ix_actual].map.simple.n_markers = n_goodmembers;
5582 map.chrs[chr_ix_actual].map.simple.first_marker_index = firsts_coord_in_genome;
5583 map.chrs[chr_ix_actual].map.simple.dists = lgdists;
5584 } else {
5585 int chr_ix_actual = chr_ix-n_bad_chr;
5586 map.chrs[chr_ix_actual].type = GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_REORDER;
5587 map.chrs[chr_ix_actual].map.reorder.expected_n_crossovers = chrdist / 100;
5588 map.chrs[chr_ix_actual].map.reorder.n_markers = n_goodmembers;
5589 map.chrs[chr_ix_actual].map.reorder.marker_indexes = marker_coords;
5590 map.chrs[chr_ix_actual].map.reorder.dists = lgdists;
5591 }
5592 }
5593 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(chr_nmembers);
5594 map.n_chr = map.n_chr-n_bad_chr;
5595 if (map.n_chr == 0) {
5596 GSC_FREE(map.chrs);
5597 return NO_MAP;
5598 }
5599 return gsc_helper_insert_recombmap_into_simdata(d, map);
5600}
5601
5602
5618gsc_MapID gsc_create_uniformspaced_recombmap(gsc_SimData* d, size_t n_markers, char** markernames, double expected_n_recombinations) {
5619 gsc_RecombinationMap map = {.n_chr=1, .chrs=gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(gsc_LinkageGroup)*1, GSC_TRUE) };
5620
5621 if (markernames == NULL) {
5622 if (d->genome.n_markers == 0) return NO_MAP;
5623
5624 double* lgdists = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(double)*d->genome.n_markers,GSC_TRUE);
5625 double lgdist = 1./d->genome.n_markers;
5626 for (size_t i = 0; i < d->genome.n_markers; ++i) { lgdists[i] = lgdist; }
5627
5628 map.chrs[0].type = GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_SIMPLE;
5629 map.chrs[0].map.simple.expected_n_crossovers = expected_n_recombinations;
5630 map.chrs[0].map.simple.n_markers = d->genome.n_markers;
5631 map.chrs[0].map.simple.first_marker_index = 0;
5632 map.chrs[0].map.simple.dists = lgdists;
5633 } else {
5634 if (n_markers == 0) return NO_MAP;
5635
5636 // markernames could still be simple or reordered compared to the d->genome, so need to check that first.
5637 char found_first = GSC_FALSE;
5638 size_t could_not_match;
5639 size_t firsts_coord_in_genome = d->genome.n_markers;
5640 size_t chrmarker_ix = 0;
5641
5642 size_t* marker_coords = NULL;
5643 for (size_t i = 0; i < n_markers; ++i) {
5644 if (!found_first || marker_coords != NULL) {
5645 // We are first or we are a reordered linkage group. Find what index in the genome the next marker is stored at.
5646 size_t coord;
5647
5648 if (markernames[i] == NULL) {
5649 could_not_match++;
5650 } else if (!gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(markernames[i], d->genome, &coord )) {
5651 could_not_match++;
5652 } else if (!found_first) {
5653 found_first = GSC_TRUE;
5654 firsts_coord_in_genome = coord;
5655 chrmarker_ix++;
5656 } else { // must be the case that we have marker_coords != NULL and are a reordered linkage group
5657 marker_coords[chrmarker_ix] = coord;
5658 chrmarker_ix++;
5659 }
5660
5661 } else if (firsts_coord_in_genome < d->genome.n_markers &&
5662 strcmp(markernames[i], d->genome.marker_names[firsts_coord_in_genome + i]) == 0) {
5663 // are a simple linkage group still so far.
5664 chrmarker_ix++;
5665
5666 } else {
5667 // Just discovered we are a reordered linkage group. Copy over the marker indexes that were as expected.
5668 marker_coords = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*marker_coords)*n_markers,GSC_TRUE);
5669 for (size_t backfill = 0; backfill < chrmarker_ix; ++backfill) {
5670 marker_coords[backfill] = firsts_coord_in_genome + backfill;
5671 }
5672
5673 if (markernames[i] == NULL) {
5674 could_not_match++;
5675 } else if (!gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(markernames[i], d->genome, &(marker_coords[chrmarker_ix]) )) {
5676 could_not_match++;
5677 } else {
5678 chrmarker_ix++;
5679 }
5680 }
5681 }
5682
5683 double* lgdists = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(double)*chrmarker_ix,GSC_TRUE);
5684 double lgdist = 1./n_markers;
5685 for (size_t i = 0; i < chrmarker_ix; ++i) { lgdists[i] = lgdist; }
5686
5687 if (marker_coords == NULL) {
5688 map.chrs[0].type = GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_SIMPLE;
5689 map.chrs[0].map.simple.expected_n_crossovers = expected_n_recombinations;
5690 map.chrs[0].map.simple.n_markers = chrmarker_ix;
5691 map.chrs[0].map.simple.first_marker_index = firsts_coord_in_genome;
5692 map.chrs[0].map.simple.dists = lgdists;
5693 } else {
5694 map.chrs[0].type = GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_REORDER;
5695 map.chrs[0].map.reorder.expected_n_crossovers = expected_n_recombinations;
5696 map.chrs[0].map.reorder.n_markers = chrmarker_ix;
5697 map.chrs[0].map.reorder.marker_indexes = marker_coords;
5698 map.chrs[0].map.reorder.dists = lgdists;
5699 }
5700 }
5701
5702 return gsc_helper_insert_recombmap_into_simdata(d,map);
5703}
5704
5742gsc_MapID gsc_load_mapfile(SimData* d, const char* filename) {
5743 if (filename == NULL) return NO_MAP;
5744
5745 struct gsc_MapfileUnit* mapcontents = NULL;
5746 size_t nrows = gsc_helper_parse_mapfile(filename,&mapcontents);
5747 if (nrows == 0 || mapcontents == NULL) {
5748 if (mapcontents != NULL) {
5749 GSC_FREE(mapcontents);
5750 }
5751 return NO_MAP;
5752 }
5753
5754 char freeMapNames = GSC_TRUE;
5755 if (d->genome.n_markers > 0) {
5756 // if genome is already set, leftjoin on those markers.
5757 size_t new_nrows = gsc_helper_str_markerlist_leftjoin(d->genome, nrows, &mapcontents);
5758 if (new_nrows < nrows) {
5759 printf("Discarded %u markers when loading map %s because they do not appear in the primary map.\n", (unsigned int) (nrows - new_nrows), filename);
5760 }
5761 nrows = new_nrows;
5762 gsc_helper_sort_markerlist(nrows,mapcontents);
5763 } else {
5764 // else set up the list of markers tracked by the simulation
5765 gsc_helper_sort_markerlist(nrows,mapcontents);
5766 d->genome = (gsc_KnownGenome){
5767 .n_markers = nrows,
5768 .marker_names = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char**)*nrows,GSC_TRUE),
5769 .names_alphabetical = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char**)*nrows,GSC_TRUE),
5770 .n_maps = 0,
5771 .map_ids = NULL,
5772 .maps = NULL
5773 };
5774 for (int i = 0; i < d->genome.n_markers; ++i) {
5775 d->genome.marker_names[i] = mapcontents[i].name;
5776 d->genome.names_alphabetical[i] = &(d->genome.marker_names[i]);
5777 }
5778 qsort(d->genome.names_alphabetical,d->genome.n_markers,sizeof(*d->genome.names_alphabetical),gsc_helper_indirect_alphabetical_str_comparer);
5779
5780 freeMapNames = GSC_FALSE;
5781 //printf( "Warning: loading genetic map before loading any founder genotypes. Many simulation operations will not yet run.\n");
5782 }
5783
5784 gsc_MapID map = gsc_create_recombmap_from_markerlist(d, nrows, mapcontents);
5785 if (freeMapNames) {
5786 for (int i = 0; i < nrows; ++i) {
5787 GSC_FREE(mapcontents[i].name);
5788 }
5789 }
5790 GSC_FREE(mapcontents);
5791
5792 return map;
5793}
5794
5795
5831gsc_EffectID gsc_load_effectfile(gsc_SimData* d, const char* filename) {
5832 if (filename == NULL) return GSC_NO_EFFECTSET;
5833 if (d->genome.n_markers == 0) return GSC_NO_EFFECTSET;
5834
5835 gsc_TableFileReader tf = gsc_tablefilereader_create(filename);
5836
5837 size_t row = 1;
5838 size_t col = 1;
5839
5840 gsc_TableFileCell cellsread[4] = { 0 };
5841 gsc_TableFileCell* cellqueue = cellsread;
5842 const char* titles[] = { "marker", "allele", "eff"};
5843 int colnums[] = { 1, 2, 3 };
5844 size_t queuesize;
5845 int header = gsc_helper_parse_3cell_header(&tf, titles, colnums, cellqueue, &queuesize);
5846 if (header == GSC_TRUE) {
5847 printf("(Loading %s) Format: effect file with header\n", filename);
5848 } else if (header == GSC_FALSE) {
5849 printf("(Loading %s) Format: effect file without header\n", filename);
5850 } else {
5851 printf("(Loading %s) Failure: Cannot identify the expected 3 columns of the effect file\n", filename);
5852 gsc_tablefilereader_close(&tf);
5853 return NO_EFFECTSET;
5854 }
5855 int marker_colnum = colnums[0], allele_colnum = colnums[1], eff_colnum = colnums[2];
5856
5857
5858 int goodrow = (header) ? GSC_FALSE : GSC_TRUE; // discard first row if it's a header, keep if it's not.
5859 size_t goodrow_counter = 0;
5860 size_t allele_counter = 0;
5861
5862 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(effset_alleles,char,2);
5863 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(effset_rows,double*,2);
5864 size_t n_effset_rows = 0;
5865
5866 size_t markerix;
5867 char allele = '\0';
5868 size_t alleleix = n_effset_rows + 1; // invalid value.
5869 double effect = 0;
5870 char* conversionflag;
5871
5872 gsc_TableFileCell ncell;
5873
5874 do {
5875 ncell = gsc_helper_tablefilereader_get_next_cell_wqueue(&tf, &cellqueue, &queuesize);
5876
5877 if (ncell.cell != NULL) { // so that we can cope with missing final newline
5878 // Update row/col position and save predecessor row
5879 if (ncell.predNewline) {
5880 if (goodrow && col >= 3) { // save predecessor row.
5881 if (alleleix == n_effset_rows) {
5882 ++allele_counter;
5883 ++n_effset_rows;
5884 if (effset_allelescap < n_effset_rows) {
5885 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(effset_alleles,2*n_effset_rows);
5886 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(effset_rows,2*n_effset_rows);
5887 }
5888 effset_alleles[alleleix] = allele;
5889 effset_rows[alleleix] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(double)*d->genome.n_markers,GSC_TRUE);
5890 memset(effset_rows[alleleix],0,sizeof(double)*d->genome.n_markers);
5891 }
5892 if (alleleix < n_effset_rows) { // this is specifically not an "else if"
5893 effset_rows[alleleix][markerix] = effect;
5894 ++goodrow_counter;
5895 }
5896 }
5897 row += ncell.predNewline;
5898 goodrow = GSC_TRUE;
5899 col = 1;
5900 }
5901 col += (ncell.predCol > 0) ? 1 : 0; // multiple column spacers treated as one
5902
5903 // Parse this cell
5904 if (ncell.cell_len == 0) {
5905 goodrow = GSC_FALSE;
5906 } else if (col == marker_colnum) {
5907 char tmp = ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len]; ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len] = '\0';
5908 int validmarker = gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(ncell.cell,d->genome,&markerix);
5909 ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len] = tmp;
5910 if (!validmarker) {
5911 goodrow = GSC_FALSE;
5912 //fprintf(stderr,"Entry at row %i column %i of file %s does not match the name of a tracked marker\n", row, marker_colnum, filename);
5913 }
5914
5915 } else if (col == allele_colnum) {
5916 if (ncell.cell_len > 1) {
5917 goodrow = GSC_FALSE;
5918 //fprintf(stderr,"Entry at row %i column %i of file %s was too long to represent a single allele\n", row, allele_colnum, filename);
5919 }
5920 allele = ncell.cell[0];
5921 for (alleleix = 0; alleleix < n_effset_rows; ++alleleix) {
5922 if (effset_alleles[alleleix] == allele) {
5923 break;
5924 }
5925 } // leave this loop with alleleix set to match the allele, or equal to n_effset_rows if it's a new allele.
5926
5927 } else if (col == eff_colnum) {
5928 char tmp = ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len]; ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len] = '\0';
5929 effect = strtod(ncell.cell,&conversionflag);
5930 ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len] = tmp;
5931 if (conversionflag != ncell.cell + ncell.cell_len) { // unsuccessful read
5932 goodrow = GSC_FALSE;
5933 //fprintf(stderr,"Entry at row %i column %i of file %s could not be parsed as a numeric value\n", row, eff_colnum, filename);
5934 }
5935
5936 } else {
5937 goodrow = GSC_FALSE;
5938 }
5939
5940 // Reset
5941 if (!ncell.isCellShallow) { GSC_FREE(ncell.cell); }
5942 }
5943 } while (!ncell.eof);
5944
5945 if (col == 3 && goodrow) { // save predecessor row
5946 ++goodrow_counter;
5947 if (alleleix == n_effset_rows) {
5948 ++allele_counter;
5949 ++n_effset_rows;
5950 if (effset_allelescap < n_effset_rows) {
5951 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(effset_alleles,2*n_effset_rows);
5952 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(effset_rows,2*n_effset_rows);
5953 }
5954 effset_alleles[alleleix] = allele;
5955 effset_rows[alleleix] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(double)*d->genome.n_markers,GSC_TRUE);
5956 memset(effset_rows[alleleix],0,sizeof(double)*d->genome.n_markers);
5957 }
5958 effset_rows[alleleix][markerix] = effect;
5959 }
5960
5961 printf("(Loading %s) %u effect value(s) spanning %u allele(s) were loaded. Failed to parse %u line(s).\n", filename, (unsigned int) goodrow_counter, (unsigned int) allele_counter, (unsigned int) (row - header - goodrow_counter));
5962 gsc_tablefilereader_close(&tf);
5963
5964 if (n_effset_rows > 0) {
5965 gsc_EffectMatrix effset = { 0 };
5966 GSC_FINALISE_BUFFER(effset_alleles, effset.effect_names, n_effset_rows);
5967 GSC_FINALISE_BUFFER(effset_rows, effset.effects.matrix, n_effset_rows);
5968 effset.effects.rows = n_effset_rows;
5969 effset.effects.cols = d->genome.n_markers;
5970 return gsc_helper_insert_eff_set_into_simdata(d, effset);
5971 } else {
5972 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(effset_alleles);
5973 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(effset_rows);
5974 return GSC_NO_EFFECTSET;
5975 }
5976}
5977
5984static enum gsc_GenotypeFileCellStyle gsc_helper_genotype_matrix_identify_cell_style(gsc_TableFileCell c) {
5985 switch (c.cell_len) {
5986 case 1:
5987 switch (c.cell[0]) {
5988 case '0':
5989 case '1':
5990 case '2':
5991 return GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_COUNT;
5992 case 'G': // G
5993 case 'A': // A
5994 case 'T': // T
5995 case 'C': // C
5996 case 'R': // G/A
5997 case 'Y': // T/C
5998 case 'M': // A/C
5999 case 'K': // G/T
6000 case 'S': // G/C
6001 case 'W': // A/T
6002 case 'N': // any
6003 return GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_ENCODED;
6004 default:
6005 break;
6006 }
6007 break;
6008 case 2:
6009 if (c.cell[0] == 'm') { // m[numeric] case, which is probably a marker not an allele pair
6010 switch (c.cell[1]) {
6011 case '0':
6012 case '1':
6013 case '2':
6014 case '3':
6015 case '4':
6016 case '5':
6017 case '6':
6018 case '7':
6019 case '8':
6020 case '9':
6021 return GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_UNKNOWN;
6022 default:
6023 break;
6024 }
6025 }
6026 return GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_PAIR;
6027 case 3:
6028 if (c.cell[1] == '/') {
6029 return GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_SLASHPAIR;
6030 }
6031 break;
6032 default:
6033 break;
6034 }
6035 return GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_UNKNOWN;
6036}
6037
6043static void gsc_helper_genotypecell_to_allelematrix(GenoLocation loc, size_t markerix,
6044 enum gsc_GenotypeFileCellStyle style, char* cell, gsc_SimData* forrng) {
6045 char* pos = loc.localAM->alleles[loc.localPos] + 2*markerix;
6046 int phase = 0;
6047 switch (style) {
6048 case GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_PAIR:
6049 pos[0] = cell[0];
6050 pos[1] = cell[1];
6051 break;
6052 case GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_SLASHPAIR:
6053 pos[0] = cell[0];
6054 pos[1] = cell[2];
6055 break;
6056 case GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_COUNT:
6057 switch (cell[0]) {
6058 case '0':
6059 pos[0] = 'T';
6060 pos[1] = 'T';
6061 break;
6062 case '1':
6063 phase = rnd_pcg_range(&forrng->rng,0,1);
6064 pos[phase] = 'A';
6065 pos[1-phase] = 'T';
6066 break;
6067 case '2':
6068 pos[0] = 'A';
6069 pos[1] = 'A';
6070 break;
6071 }
6072 break;
6073 case GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_ENCODED:
6074 switch (cell[0]) {
6075 case 'G': // G
6076 pos[0] = 'G';
6077 pos[1] = 'G';
6078 break;
6079 case 'A': // A
6080 pos[0] = 'A';
6081 pos[1] = 'A';
6082 break;
6083 case 'T': // T
6084 pos[0] = 'T';
6085 pos[1] = 'T';
6086 break;
6087 case 'C': // C
6088 pos[0] = 'C';
6089 pos[1] = 'C';
6090 break;
6091 case 'R': // G/A
6092 phase = rnd_pcg_range(&forrng->rng,0,1);
6093 pos[phase] = 'G';
6094 pos[1-phase] = 'A';
6095 break;
6096 case 'Y': // T/C
6097 phase = rnd_pcg_range(&forrng->rng,0,1);
6098 pos[phase] = 'T';
6099 pos[1-phase] = 'C';
6100 break;
6101 case 'M': // A/C
6102 phase = rnd_pcg_range(&forrng->rng,0,1);
6103 pos[phase] = 'A';
6104 pos[1-phase] = 'C';
6105 break;
6106 case 'K': // G/T
6107 phase = rnd_pcg_range(&forrng->rng,0,1);
6108 pos[phase] = 'G';
6109 pos[1-phase] = 'T';
6110 break;
6111 case 'S': // G/C
6112 phase = rnd_pcg_range(&forrng->rng,0,1);
6113 pos[phase] = 'G';
6114 pos[1-phase] = 'C';
6115 break;
6116 case 'W': // A/T
6117 phase = rnd_pcg_range(&forrng->rng,0,1);
6118 pos[phase] = 'A';
6119 pos[1-phase] = 'T';
6120 break;
6121 default:
6122 break;
6123 }
6124 break;
6125 default: break;
6126 }
6127}
6128
6132static struct gsc_EmptyListNavigator gsc_create_emptylistnavigator(gsc_SimData* d, gsc_GroupNum allocation_group) {
6133 struct gsc_EmptyListNavigator me = { .d=d, .localPos = 0, .alloctogroup = allocation_group, .currentid = d->current_id };
6134 me.firstAM = gsc_create_empty_allelematrix(me.d->genome.n_markers, me.d->n_labels, me.d->label_defaults, 0);
6135 me.localAM = me.firstAM;
6136 return me;
6137}
6138
6143static gsc_GenoLocation gsc_emptylistnavigator_get_first(struct gsc_EmptyListNavigator* it) {
6144 it->localAM = it->firstAM;
6145 it->localPos = 0;
6146 if (1 > it->localAM->n_genotypes) {
6147 it->localAM->n_genotypes = 1;
6148 it->localAM->alleles[0] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char) * (it->localAM->n_markers<<1),GSC_TRUE);
6149 memset(it->localAM->alleles[0], 0, sizeof(char) * (it->localAM->n_markers<<1));
6150 it->localAM->names[0] = NULL;
6151 it->localAM->groups[0] = it->alloctogroup;
6152 ++(it->currentid.id);
6153 it->localAM->ids[0] = it->currentid;
6154 }
6155 return (gsc_GenoLocation){.localAM=it->localAM, .localPos =it->localPos};
6156}
6157
6162static gsc_GenoLocation gsc_emptylistnavigator_get_next(struct gsc_EmptyListNavigator* it) {
6163 if (CONTIG_WIDTH - 1 == it->localPos) {
6164 if (NULL == it->localAM->next) {
6165 gsc_AlleleMatrix* next = gsc_create_empty_allelematrix(it->d->genome.n_markers, it->d->n_labels, it->d->label_defaults, 0);
6166 it->localAM->next = next;
6167 it->localAM = next;
6168 it->localPos = 0;
6169 } else {
6170 it->localAM = it->localAM->next;
6171 it->localPos = 0;
6172 }
6173 } else {
6174 ++(it->localPos);
6175 }
6176
6177 if (it->localAM->n_genotypes <= it->localPos) {
6178 if (1 < it->localPos - it->localAM->n_genotypes) {
6179 fprintf(stderr,"EmptyListNavigator invalid\n");
6180 return INVALID_GENO_LOCATION;
6181 }
6182 ++(it->localAM->n_genotypes);
6183
6184 it->localAM->alleles[it->localPos] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char) * (it->localAM->n_markers<<1),GSC_TRUE);
6185 memset(it->localAM->alleles[it->localPos], 0, sizeof(char) * (it->localAM->n_markers<<1));
6186 it->localAM->names[it->localPos] = NULL;
6187 it->localAM->groups[it->localPos] = it->alloctogroup;
6188 ++(it->currentid.id);
6189 it->localAM->ids[it->localPos] = it->currentid;
6190 }
6191
6192 return (gsc_GenoLocation){.localAM=it->localAM, .localPos =it->localPos};
6193}
6194
6199static void gsc_emptylistnavigator_finaliselist(struct gsc_EmptyListNavigator* it) {
6200 if (NULL == it->d->m) {
6201 it->d->m = it->firstAM;
6202 } else {
6203 gsc_AlleleMatrix* listend = it->d->m;
6204 while (NULL != listend->next) {
6205 listend = listend->next;
6206 }
6207 listend->next = it->firstAM;
6208 gsc_condense_allele_matrix(it->d);
6209 }
6210 it->d->current_id = it->currentid;
6211}
6212
6239static struct gsc_GenotypeFile_MatrixFormat gsc_helper_genotypefile_matrix_detect_orientation(const SimData* d,
6240 const gsc_TableFileCell* cellqueue, const size_t firstrowlen, const size_t queuelen,
6241 struct gsc_GenotypeFile_MatrixFormat format, const char* filenameforlog) {
6242
6243 if (format.markers_as_rows == GSC_TRUE || format.markers_as_rows == GSC_FALSE) {
6244 // pass
6245 } else if (d->genome.n_maps == 0) {
6246 // If there is no genetic map, we cannot check the row/column headers to see if any of them match the marker names..
6247 // Default to markers being rows
6248
6249 printf("(Loading %s) Format axis: genetic markers are -rows-, founder lines are |columns| (by assumption when no genetic map is loaded)\n", filenameforlog);
6250 printf("(Loading %s) No genetic map is loaded, will invent a map with equal spacing of these genetic markers (1cM apart)\n", filenameforlog);
6251 format.markers_as_rows = GSC_TRUE;
6252
6253 } else if (format.has_header == GSC_FALSE) {
6254 printf("(Loading %s) Format axis: genetic markers are -rows-, founder lines are |columns| "
6255 "(by assumption when matrix has no header row)\n", filenameforlog);
6256 format.markers_as_rows = GSC_TRUE;
6257
6258 } else {
6259 // Note: by here, either the user has told us there is a header row, or we get to detect whether there is one. So will investigate it by comparing names to what's in our map
6260 // taken from older function gsc_helper_genotypefile_matrix_check_markers_are_rows
6261 int firstsafeheaderindex = -1;
6262 if (firstrowlen > 1) {
6263 firstsafeheaderindex = 1;
6264 } else if (firstrowlen == 1 && queuelen > firstrowlen + 1) { // second row has more than one cell read.
6265 firstsafeheaderindex = 0; // assume there's no corner cell
6266 format.has_header = GSC_TRUE;
6267 }
6268
6269 if (firstsafeheaderindex >= 0) {
6270 // Don't check the "first" cell. It might be a corner cell between the two headers, whose value should be ignored
6271 // Check the next cell in the first row.
6272 if (gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(cellqueue[firstsafeheaderindex].cell, d->genome, NULL)) {
6273 printf("(Loading %s) Format axis: genetic markers are |columns|, founder lines are -rows-\n", filenameforlog);
6274 format.markers_as_rows = GSC_FALSE;
6275 format.has_header = GSC_TRUE;
6276 return format;
6277 }
6278
6279 // If that wasn't a match, check the first row header, if it exists:
6280 if (queuelen > firstrowlen && !cellqueue[firstrowlen].eof &&
6281 gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(cellqueue[firstrowlen].cell, d->genome, NULL)) {
6282 printf("(Loading %s) Format axis: genetic markers are -rows-, founder lines are |columns|\n", filenameforlog);
6283 format.markers_as_rows = GSC_TRUE;
6284 return format;
6285 }
6286
6287 // Check remaining column headers
6288 for (size_t i = firstsafeheaderindex + 1; i < firstrowlen; ++i) {
6289 if (gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(cellqueue[i].cell, d->genome, NULL)) {
6290 printf("(Loading %s) Format axis: genetic markers are |columns|, founder lines are -rows-\n", filenameforlog);
6291 format.markers_as_rows = GSC_FALSE;
6292 format.has_header = GSC_TRUE;
6293 return format;
6294 }
6295 }
6296
6297 }
6298 printf("(Loading %s) Format axis: genetic markers are -rows-, founder lines are |columns| (by default file format)\n", filenameforlog);
6299 format.markers_as_rows = GSC_TRUE;
6300 }
6301 return format;
6302
6303}
6304
6316static struct gsc_GenotypeFile_MatrixFormat gsc_helper_genotypefile_matrix_detect_cellstyle(const gsc_TableFileCell* cellqueue,
6317 const size_t firstrowlen, const size_t queuelen, struct gsc_GenotypeFile_MatrixFormat format, const char* filenameforlog) {
6318
6319 int style_detected = GSC_FALSE;
6320 int single_col_file = GSC_FALSE;
6321 // 1. Detect format if not yet provided.
6322 if (format.cell_style == GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_UNKNOWN) {
6323 style_detected = GSC_TRUE;
6324
6325 if (firstrowlen == queuelen || cellqueue[firstrowlen].eof) { // There is only one row. Short-circuiting necessary
6326 // if there is also only one column, we have no body cells to detect the style of
6327 if (firstrowlen > 1) {
6328 // Detection path for a single-line file. If it has a header, then this value might end up ignored
6329 format.cell_style = gsc_helper_genotype_matrix_identify_cell_style(cellqueue[1]);
6330 } else {
6331 single_col_file = GSC_TRUE; // one-cell file. needs the warning.
6332 }
6333 } else { // there is more than one row
6334 // If there is only one column, there are no body cells with style to detect
6335 if (firstrowlen + 1 < queuelen && cellqueue[firstrowlen+1].predNewline < 1) {
6336 // Detection path. There exists a second cell on the second line that we can read
6337 format.cell_style = gsc_helper_genotype_matrix_identify_cell_style(cellqueue[firstrowlen+1]);
6338 } else {
6339 single_col_file = GSC_TRUE;
6340 }
6341 }
6342 }
6343
6344 // 2. Print cell style detection logs
6345 if (style_detected) {
6346 switch(format.cell_style) {
6347 case GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_PAIR: printf("(Loading %s) Allele format: phased allele pairs\n", filenameforlog); break;
6348 case GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_SLASHPAIR: printf("(Loading %s) Allele format: phased allele pairs (slash-separated)\n", filenameforlog); break;
6349 case GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_COUNT: printf("(Loading %s) Allele format: reference allele counts (phase will be randomised)\n", filenameforlog); break;
6350 case GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_ENCODED: printf("(Loading %s) Allele format: IUPAC encoded pair (phase will be randomised)\n", filenameforlog); break;
6351 case GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_UNKNOWN:
6352 if (single_col_file || firstrowlen == queuelen ||
6353 (firstrowlen + 1 == queuelen && cellqueue[firstrowlen].eof && cellqueue[firstrowlen].cell_len == 0)) {
6354 printf("(Loading %s) Warning: empty genotype matrix. No genotypes will be loaded.\n", filenameforlog);
6355 } else {
6356 fprintf(stderr,"(Loading %s) Failure: Unable to determine the formatting of pairs of alleles."
6357 " Check genomicSimulation manual for accepted allele pair encodings\n", filenameforlog);
6358 }
6359 }
6360 }
6361
6362 return format;
6363}
6364
6392static struct gsc_GenotypeFile_MatrixFormat gsc_helper_genotypefile_matrix_detect_header(const gsc_TableFileCell* cellqueue,
6393 const size_t firstrowlen, const size_t queuelen, struct gsc_GenotypeFile_MatrixFormat format, const char* filenameforlog) {
6394 // Validity check: if genetic markers are columns, header row is mandatory
6395 if (format.has_header == GSC_FALSE && format.markers_as_rows == GSC_FALSE) {
6396 printf("(Loading %s) Failure: genetic markers cannot be represented by columns when matrix has no header row\n", filenameforlog);
6397 format.has_header = GSC_UNINIT;
6398 return format;
6399 }
6400
6401 // Detect header if we need to detect it.
6402 if (format.has_header != GSC_FALSE && format.has_header != GSC_TRUE) {
6403 if (firstrowlen == 1) {
6404 // we could have a single-column file (no header assumed), or
6405 // we could be a two-column file with no corner cell (must have a header)
6406 if (queuelen > 2) {
6407 if (cellqueue[2].eof || cellqueue[2].predNewline) {
6408 format.has_header = GSC_FALSE; // single column file
6409 } else {
6410 format.has_header = GSC_TRUE;
6411 }
6412 } // else can't draw any conclusions.
6413
6414 } else if (format.cell_style != GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_UNKNOWN) {
6415 // Idea: if we find a cell in the first row that doesn't match the expected cell style, then that first row is probably a header
6416 format.has_header = GSC_FALSE;
6417 for (size_t i = 1; i < firstrowlen; ++i) { // ignore first cell in row, it could be a corner cell or row header
6418 if (gsc_helper_genotype_matrix_identify_cell_style(cellqueue[i]) != format.cell_style) {
6419 format.has_header = GSC_TRUE;
6420 break;
6421 }
6422 }
6423 } // else don't know how to detect.
6424
6425 switch (format.has_header) {
6426 case GSC_FALSE: printf("(Loading %s) Format: genotype matrix without header row\n", filenameforlog); break;
6427 case GSC_TRUE: printf("(Loading %s) Format: genotype matrix with header row\n", filenameforlog); break;
6428 default: fprintf(stderr,"(Loading %s) Failure: Unable to determine whether file has header row\n", filenameforlog); break;
6429 }
6430 }
6431
6432 return format;
6433}
6434
6450static int gsc_helper_genotypefile_matrix_detect_cornercell_presence(const size_t ncellsfirstrow, const size_t ncellssecondrow, const int secondrowheaderisempty) {
6451 if (ncellssecondrow == ncellsfirstrow + 1) {
6452 return GSC_FALSE;
6453 } else if (ncellssecondrow == ncellsfirstrow) {
6454 if (secondrowheaderisempty) {
6455 return GSC_FALSE; //genotype name is simply empty, making the second row look one column shorter than reality
6456 } else {
6457 return GSC_TRUE;
6458 }
6459 } else if (ncellssecondrow == ncellsfirstrow - 1 && secondrowheaderisempty) {
6460 return GSC_TRUE; // genotype name on row 2 is empty but corner cell is not
6461 } else {
6462 return GSC_UNINIT;
6463 }
6464}
6465
6491gsc_FileFormatSpec gsc_define_matrix_format_details(const int has_header, const int markers_as_rows, const enum gsc_GenotypeFileCellStyle cell_style) {
6492 return (FileFormatSpec){.filetype=GSC_GENOTYPEFILE_MATRIX,
6493 .spec={(struct gsc_GenotypeFile_MatrixFormat){.cell_style=cell_style,
6494 .has_header=has_header,
6495 .markers_as_rows=markers_as_rows}}};
6496}
6497
6513static gsc_GroupNum gsc_load_genotypefile_matrix(gsc_SimData* d, const char* filename, const gsc_FileFormatSpec format) {
6514 if (filename == NULL) return NO_GROUP;
6515 if (format.filetype != GSC_GENOTYPEFILE_MATRIX && format.filetype != GSC_GENOTYPEFILE_UNKNOWN) {
6516 fprintf(stderr,"Non-genotype-matrix format specification provided to genotype matrix file loader function\n");
6517 return NO_GROUP;
6518 }
6519
6520 // Part 1: Detect file formatting details
6521 struct gsc_GenotypeFile_MatrixFormat format_detected =
6522 { .has_header = GSC_UNINIT, .markers_as_rows = GSC_UNINIT, .cell_style = GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_UNKNOWN };
6523 if (format.filetype == GSC_GENOTYPEFILE_MATRIX) {
6524 format_detected = format.spec.matrix;
6525 }
6526 size_t queuesize = 0;
6527
6528 gsc_TableFileReader tbl = gsc_tablefilereader_create(filename);
6529 // Read one row + 2 cells (if possible)
6530 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(cellsread,gsc_TableFileCell,100);
6531 size_t ncellsread = 0;
6532 do {
6533 cellsread[ncellsread] = gsc_tablefilereader_get_next_cell(&tbl);
6534 gsc_tablefilecell_deep_copy(&cellsread[ncellsread]);
6535 ++ncellsread;
6536 if (ncellsread >= cellsreadcap) {
6537 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(cellsread,2*ncellsread);
6538 }
6539 } while (!cellsread[ncellsread-1].eof && (ncellsread <= 1 || !cellsread[ncellsread-1].predNewline));
6540 size_t ncellsfirstrow = (cellsread[ncellsread-1].eof && cellsread[ncellsread-1].cell_len > 0) ? ncellsread : ncellsread - 1;
6541 if (!cellsread[ncellsread-1].eof) { // read one more cell if possible
6542 cellsread[ncellsread] = gsc_tablefilereader_get_next_cell(&tbl);
6543 gsc_tablefilecell_deep_copy(&cellsread[ncellsread]);
6544 ++ncellsread;
6545 if (ncellsread >= cellsreadcap) {
6546 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(cellsread,2*ncellsread);
6547 }
6548 }
6549 queuesize = ncellsread; // so that we know how many to free if we failure_exit
6550 if (ncellsread <= 1) { // file is an EOF only
6551 goto failure_exit;
6552 }
6553 //int is_onecol_file = cellsread[ncellsfirstrow + 1].predNewline > 0 || ncellsread == 2; // ncellsread == 2 means we read one cell, then an EOF
6554 int is_onerow_file = ncellsread == ncellsfirstrow || cellsread[ncellsfirstrow].eof; // short-circuiting essential!
6555
6556 format_detected = gsc_helper_genotypefile_matrix_detect_orientation(d, cellsread, ncellsfirstrow, ncellsread, format_detected, filename);
6557 format_detected = gsc_helper_genotypefile_matrix_detect_cellstyle(cellsread, ncellsfirstrow, ncellsread, format_detected, filename);
6558 format_detected = gsc_helper_genotypefile_matrix_detect_header(cellsread, ncellsfirstrow, ncellsread, format_detected, filename);
6559 if ((format_detected.has_header != GSC_FALSE && format_detected.has_header != GSC_TRUE) ||
6560 (format_detected.markers_as_rows != GSC_FALSE && format_detected.markers_as_rows != GSC_TRUE) ||
6561 format_detected.cell_style == GSC_GENOTYPECELLSTYLE_UNKNOWN) {
6562 goto failure_exit;
6563 }
6564
6565 int format_has_corner_cell = GSC_UNINIT;
6566 // If markers as columns, we do need to know how many cells are in the second row in order to detect a corner cell
6567 if (!format_detected.markers_as_rows && !is_onerow_file) {
6568 // Read rest of second row
6569 while (!cellsread[ncellsread-1].eof && !cellsread[ncellsread-1].predNewline) {
6570 cellsread[ncellsread] = gsc_tablefilereader_get_next_cell(&tbl);
6571 gsc_tablefilecell_deep_copy(&cellsread[ncellsread]);
6572 ++ncellsread;
6573 if (ncellsread >= cellsreadcap) {
6574 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(cellsread,2*ncellsread);
6575 }
6576 }
6577 // Detect corner cell
6578 queuesize = ncellsread; // so that we know how many to free if we failure_exit
6579 size_t ncellssecondrow = ncellsread - ncellsfirstrow - 1;
6580 format_has_corner_cell = gsc_helper_genotypefile_matrix_detect_cornercell_presence(ncellsfirstrow, ncellssecondrow, cellsread[ncellsfirstrow].predCol > 0);
6581 if (format_has_corner_cell == GSC_UNINIT) {
6582 fprintf(stderr, "(Loading %s) Failure: Header row length and second row length do not align\n", filename);
6583 goto failure_exit;
6584 }
6585 }
6586
6587 // Create the queue of cells to parse (exclude header from this queue, because it needs to be dealt with differently)
6588 gsc_TableFileCell* cellqueue = cellsread;
6589 //queuesize = ncellsread; (already done above)
6590 if (format_detected.has_header) {
6591 cellqueue = cellsread + ncellsfirstrow;
6592 queuesize = ncellsread - ncellsfirstrow;
6593 }
6594
6595 // PART 2: Create uniform-spaced map, if we have no map currently
6596 int build_map_from_rows = GSC_FALSE;
6597 if (d->genome.n_markers == 0) {
6598 if (format_detected.markers_as_rows) {
6599 build_map_from_rows = GSC_TRUE;
6600 // We're going to have to do an independent read of the file to extract these. Will be a bit slower.
6601 gsc_TableFileReader tbl2 = gsc_tablefilereader_create(filename);
6602 gsc_TableFileCell cell = gsc_tablefilereader_get_next_cell(&tbl2);
6603 size_t nmarkersread = format_detected.has_header ? 0 : 1;
6604 do {
6605 cell = gsc_tablefilereader_get_next_cell(&tbl2);
6606 if (cell.predNewline) { ++nmarkersread; }
6607 } while (!cell.eof);
6608 gsc_tablefilereader_close(&tbl2);
6609 if (cell.predNewline) { // there's a newline before eof, so no real actual last row
6610 --nmarkersread;
6611 }
6612
6613 d->genome.n_markers = nmarkersread;
6614 d->genome.marker_names = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*d->genome.marker_names)*d->genome.n_markers, GSC_TRUE);
