6615 d->genome.names_alphabetical = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*d->genome.names_alphabetical)*d->genome.n_markers, GSC_TRUE);
6616 gsc_create_uniformspaced_recombmap(d,0,NULL,d->genome.n_markers);
6617
6618 } else { // markers as columns
6619 if (!format_detected.has_header) { // you should not be able to get here. // assert(format_detected.has_header == GSC_TRUE);
6620 fprintf(stderr, "(Loading %s) Failure: Genotype matrix with markers as columns but no header row is an unsupported file type (there is no way to tell which column is which marker)\n", filename);
6621 goto failure_exit;
6622 }
6623
6624 size_t i = format_has_corner_cell ? 1 : 0; // starting index for iterating through names
6625 d->genome.n_markers = ncellsfirstrow - i;
6626 d->genome.marker_names = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*d->genome.marker_names)*d->genome.n_markers, GSC_TRUE);
6627 d->genome.names_alphabetical = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*d->genome.names_alphabetical)*d->genome.n_markers, GSC_TRUE);
6628 for (size_t j = 0; j < d->genome.n_markers; ++i, ++j) {
6629 //gsc_tablefilecell_deep_copy(&cellqueue[i]); // already deep copied
6630 d->genome.marker_names[j] = cellsread[i].cell;
6631 cellsread[i].isCellShallow = GSC_TRUE; // prevent deletion
6632 d->genome.names_alphabetical[j] = &d->genome.marker_names[j];
6633 }
6634 qsort(d->genome.names_alphabetical,d->genome.n_markers,sizeof(*d->genome.names_alphabetical),gsc_helper_indirect_alphabetical_str_comparer);
6635 gsc_create_uniformspaced_recombmap(d,0,NULL,d->genome.n_markers); // create based on the markers we've saved in 'genome'
6636 }
6637 }
6638
6639 // PART 3: Parse file into an AlleleMatrix
6640
6641 gsc_GroupNum group = gsc_get_new_group_num(d);
6642 struct gsc_EmptyListNavigator it = gsc_create_emptylistnavigator(d, group);
6643 size_t nvalidmarker = 0;
6644 unsigned int n_cols = 0;
6645 if (format_detected.markers_as_rows) {
6646
6647 gsc_GenoLocation loc;
6648 gsc_TableFileCell ncell;
6649 n_cols = (format_detected.has_header) ? ncellsfirstrow + 1 : ncellsfirstrow; // assume first row has no corner cell for now
6650 int first = GSC_TRUE;
6651 int have_valid_marker = GSC_FALSE; size_t markerix;
6652 unsigned int column = 0;
6653 unsigned int row = 0;
6654 do {
6655 ncell = gsc_helper_tablefilereader_get_next_cell_wqueue(&tbl,&cellqueue,&queuesize);
6656
6657 if (ncell.cell != NULL) {
6658 if (ncell.predNewline || first) {
6659 char tmp = ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len]; ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len] = '\0';
6660
6661 if (build_map_from_rows) {
6662 have_valid_marker = GSC_TRUE;
6663 if (first) {
6664 markerix = 0;
6665 } else {
6666 markerix++;
6667 }
6668 gsc_tablefilecell_deep_copy(&ncell);
6669 d->genome.marker_names[markerix] = ncell.cell;
6670 ncell.isCellShallow = GSC_TRUE; // prevent deletion
6671 } else {
6672 have_valid_marker = gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(ncell.cell, d->genome, &markerix);
6673 }
6674
6675 nvalidmarker += have_valid_marker;
6676 ncell.cell[ncell.cell_len] = tmp;
6677 // Then, after reading first row, detect what our expected row length is, if defaults don't suit.
6678 if (row == 1 && format_detected.has_header) {
6679 if (column + 1 != ncellsfirstrow && column + 1 != ncellsfirstrow + 1) {
6680 fprintf(stderr, "(Loading %s) Failure: Header row length and second row length do not align\n", filename);
6681 goto failure_exit;
6682 } else {
6683 n_cols = column + 1;
6684 }
6685 }
6686 first = GSC_FALSE;
6687 column = 0;
6688 ++row;
6689
6690 } else if (ncell.predCol) { // any number of column spacers treated as one column gap when reading a genotype matrix
6691 ++column;
6692 if (have_valid_marker && column < n_cols) {
6693 loc = (1 == column) ? gsc_emptylistnavigator_get_first(&it) : gsc_emptylistnavigator_get_next(&it);
6694 gsc_helper_genotypecell_to_allelematrix(loc,markerix,format_detected.cell_style,ncell.cell,d);
6695 } // Note we ignore all extra cells in all rows
6696 }
6697 }
6698
6699 if (!ncell.isCellShallow) { GSC_FREE(ncell.cell); }
6700 } while (!ncell.eof);
6701 if (row == 1 && format_detected.has_header) {
6702 if (column + 1 != ncellsfirstrow && column + 1 != ncellsfirstrow + 1) {
6703 fprintf(stderr, "(Loading %s) Failure: Header row length and second row length do not align\n", filename);
6704 goto failure_exit;
6705 } else {
6706 n_cols = column + 1;
6707 }
6708 }
6709
6710 // Then save the genotype names
6711 if (format_detected.has_header) {
6712 format_has_corner_cell = gsc_helper_genotypefile_matrix_detect_cornercell_presence(ncellsfirstrow, n_cols, cellsread[ncellsfirstrow].predCol > 0);
6713 size_t i = format_has_corner_cell ? 1 : 0;
6714 gsc_GenoLocation loc;
6715 for (size_t j = 0; i < ncellsfirstrow; ++i, ++j) {
6716 loc = (j == 0) ? gsc_emptylistnavigator_get_first(&it) : gsc_emptylistnavigator_get_next(&it);
6717 // assert(!cellsread[i].isShallowCopy);
6718 gsc_set_name(loc,cellsread[i].cell); // using names here so no need to free them. Since they're in cellsread
6719 cellsread[i].isCellShallow = GSC_TRUE; // prevent deletion
6720 }
6721 }
6722
6723 // Then finalise the map, if we're creating one:
6724 if (build_map_from_rows) {
6725 for (size_t i = 0; i < d->genome.n_markers; ++i) {
6726 d->genome.names_alphabetical[i] = &d->genome.marker_names[i];
6727 }
6728 qsort(d->genome.names_alphabetical,d->genome.n_markers,sizeof(*d->genome.names_alphabetical),gsc_helper_indirect_alphabetical_str_comparer);
6729 }
6730
6731 } else { // markers as columns
6732 if (!format_detected.has_header) { // you should not be able to get here.
6733 fprintf(stderr, "(Loading %s) Failure: Genotype matrix with markers as columns but no header row is an unsupported file type (there is no way to tell which column is which marker)\n", filename);
6734 goto failure_exit;
6735 }
6736
6737 // Identify the marker corresponding to each column
6738 size_t i = format_has_corner_cell ? 1 : 0;
6739 unsigned int n_col = ncellsfirstrow + (1-i);
6740 size_t* markerixs = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*markerixs)*ncellsfirstrow,GSC_TRUE);
6741 for (size_t j = 0; i < ncellsfirstrow; ++i, ++j) {
6742 markerixs[j] = d->genome.n_markers;
6743 nvalidmarker += gsc_get_index_of_genetic_marker(cellsread[i].cell, d->genome, &markerixs[j]);
6744 }
6745
6746 // Read the table
6747 int first = GSC_TRUE;
6748 unsigned int row = 0;
6749 unsigned int column = 0; // we count column numbers from 1 for the first body cell. sorry for the inconsistency with the branch of the if statement above.
6750 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_emptylistnavigator_get_first(&it);
6751 gsc_TableFileCell ncell;
6752 do {
6753 ncell = gsc_helper_tablefilereader_get_next_cell_wqueue(&tbl,&cellqueue,&queuesize);
6754
6755 if (ncell.cell != NULL) {
6756 if (ncell.predNewline) {
6757 loc = (first) ? gsc_emptylistnavigator_get_first(&it) : gsc_emptylistnavigator_get_next(&it);
6758 first = GSC_FALSE;
6759
6760 ++row;
6761 column = 0;
6762 if (ncell.predCol) { // missing name.
6763 gsc_set_name(loc,NULL);
6764 } else {
6765 gsc_tablefilecell_deep_copy(&ncell);
6766 gsc_set_name(loc,ncell.cell);
6767 ncell.isCellShallow = GSC_TRUE; // so it does not get deleted
6768 }
6769 }
6770
6771 if (ncell.predCol) {
6772 ++column;
6773 if (column < n_col && markerixs[column-1] < d->genome.n_markers) {
6774 gsc_helper_genotypecell_to_allelematrix(loc,markerixs[column-1],format_detected.cell_style,ncell.cell,d);
6775 }
6776 }
6777 }
6778
6779 if (!ncell.isCellShallow) { GSC_FREE(ncell.cell); }
6780 } while (!ncell.eof);
6781
6782 GSC_FREE(markerixs);
6783
6784 }
6785
6786 // PART 4: Tidy and clean and exit
6787 unsigned int ngenos = 0;
6788 AlleleMatrix* tmpam = it.firstAM;
6789 do {
6790 ngenos += tmpam->n_genotypes;
6791 } while ((tmpam = tmpam->next) != NULL);
6792 printf("(Loading %s) %u genotype(s) of %u marker(s) were loaded.\n", filename, (unsigned int) ngenos, (unsigned int) nvalidmarker);
6793 if (ngenos == 0) {
6794 gsc_delete_allele_matrix(it.firstAM);
6795 goto failure_exit;
6796 }
6797 gsc_emptylistnavigator_finaliselist(&it);
6798 ++d->n_groups;
6799
6800 // ... cleaning up the header row
6801 if (format_detected.has_header) {
6802 for (int j = 0; j < ncellsfirstrow; ++j) {
6803 if (!cellsread[j].isCellShallow) { GSC_FREE(cellsread[j].cell); }
6804 }
6805 }
6806 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(cellsread);
6807 gsc_tablefilereader_close(&tbl);
6808 return group;
6809
6810 failure_exit:
6811 // Clean up structures and return, having loaded no genotypes
6812 // ... cleaning up unprocessed cells in the queue
6813 for (int i = 1; i <= queuesize; ++i) {
6814 if (!cellsread[ncellsread-i].isCellShallow) {
6815 GSC_FREE(cellsread[ncellsread-i].cell);
6816 cellsread[ncellsread-i].isCellShallow = GSC_TRUE;
6817 }
6818 }
6819 // ... cleaning up the header row
6820 if (format_detected.has_header) {
6821 for (int j = 0; j < ncellsfirstrow; ++j) {
6822 if (!cellsread[j].isCellShallow) { GSC_FREE(cellsread[j].cell); }
6823 }
6824 }
6825 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(cellsread);
6826 gsc_tablefilereader_close(&tbl);
6827 return NO_GROUP;
6828}
6829
6847gsc_GroupNum gsc_load_genotypefile(SimData* d, const char* filename, const gsc_FileFormatSpec format) {
6848 return gsc_load_data_files(d,filename,NULL,NULL,format).group;
6849}
6850
6869struct gsc_MultiIDSet gsc_load_data_files(gsc_SimData* d, const char* genotype_file,
6870 const char* map_file, const char* effect_file, const gsc_FileFormatSpec format) {
6871 // Parse file suffix for file type, if it was not already provided
6872 enum gsc_GenotypeFileType type = format.filetype;
6873
6874 if (type == GSC_GENOTYPEFILE_UNKNOWN) {
6875 type = GSC_GENOTYPEFILE_MATRIX;
6876 char* suffix = strrchr(genotype_file,'.');
6877 if (suffix != NULL) {
6878 if (strcmp(suffix,".bed") == 0) {
6879 type = GSC_GENOTYPEFILE_BED;
6880 } else if (strcmp(suffix,".ped") == 0) {
6881 type = GSC_GENOTYPEFILE_PED;
6882 } else if (strcmp(suffix,".vcf") == 0) {
6883 type = GSC_GENOTYPEFILE_VCF;
6884 }
6885 }
6886 }
6887
6888 struct gsc_MultiIDSet out = { .group=NO_GROUP, .map=NO_MAP, .effSet=NO_EFFECTSET };
6889
6890 switch (type) {
6891 case GSC_GENOTYPEFILE_BED:
6892 //if (detectedtype) { printf("Will attempt to parse %s as a plink .bed file\n", filename); }
6893 fprintf(stderr,"plink .bed file parsing not yet implemented\n");
6894 break;
6895 case GSC_GENOTYPEFILE_PED:
6896 fprintf(stderr,"plink .ped file parsing not yet implemented\n");
6897 break;
6898 case GSC_GENOTYPEFILE_VCF:
6899 fprintf(stderr,"vcf file parsing not yet implemented\n");
6900 break;
6901 default:
6902 //printf("(Loading files) Will treat %s as a genotype matrix (see genomicSimulation's default input file types)\n", genotype_file);
6903 out.map = gsc_load_mapfile(d, map_file);
6904 out.group = gsc_load_genotypefile_matrix(d, genotype_file, format);
6905 out.effSet = gsc_load_effectfile(d, effect_file);
6906 }
6907
6908 return out;
6909}
6910
6911/*--------------------------Recombination counts-----------------------------*/
6912
6947int* gsc_calculate_min_recombinations_fw1(gsc_SimData* d, gsc_MapID mapid, char* parent1, unsigned int p1num, char* parent2,
6948 unsigned int p2num, char* offspring, int certain) {
6949 if (d->genome.n_maps < 1) {
6950 fprintf(stderr,"Need at least one recombination map loaded to estimate recombinations\n");
6951 return NULL;
6952 }
6953 int mapix = 0;
6954 if (mapid.id != NO_MAP.id) { mapix = gsc_get_index_of_map(d, mapid); }
6955 if (mapix >= d->genome.n_maps) {
6956 fprintf(stderr,"We don't have that recombination maps loaded\n");
6957 return NULL;
6958 }
6959 gsc_RecombinationMap map = d->genome.maps[mapix];
6960
6961 int* origins = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int) * d->genome.n_markers,GSC_TRUE);
6962 memset(origins,0,sizeof(*origins)*d->genome.n_markers);
6963 int p1match, p2match;
6964 int previous = 0;
6965
6966
6967 for (int chr = 0; chr < map.n_chr; ++chr) {
6968 //RPACKINSERT R_CheckUserInterrupt();
6969
6970 switch (map.chrs[chr].type) {
6971 case GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_SIMPLE:
6972 for (int i = 0; i < map.chrs[chr].map.simple.n_markers; ++i) {
6973 p1match = gsc_has_same_alleles(parent1, offspring, i);
6974 p2match = gsc_has_same_alleles(parent2, offspring, i);
6975 if (p1match && !p2match) {
6976 origins[map.chrs[chr].map.simple.first_marker_index + i] = p1num;
6977 previous = p1num;
6978 } else if (p2match && !p1match) {
6979 origins[map.chrs[chr].map.simple.first_marker_index + i] = p2num;
6980 previous = p2num;
6981 } else {
6982 if (certain) {
6983 origins[map.chrs[chr].map.simple.first_marker_index + i] = 0;
6984 } else {
6985 origins[map.chrs[chr].map.simple.first_marker_index + i] = previous;
6986 }
6987 }
6988 }
6989 break;
6990
6991 case GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_REORDER:
6992 for (int i = 0; i < map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.n_markers; ++i) {
6993 p1match = gsc_has_same_alleles(parent1, offspring, i);
6994 p2match = gsc_has_same_alleles(parent2, offspring, i);
6995 if (p1match && !p2match) {
6996 origins[map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.marker_indexes[i]] = p1num;
6997 previous = p1num;
6998 } else if (p2match && !p1match) {
6999 origins[map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.marker_indexes[i]] = p2num;
7000 previous = p2num;
7001 } else {
7002 if (certain) {
7003 origins[map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.marker_indexes[i]] = 0;
7004 } else {
7005 origins[map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.marker_indexes[i]] = previous;
7006 }
7007 }
7008 }
7009 break;
7010 }
7011
7012 }
7013 return origins;
7014}
7015
7056int* gsc_calculate_min_recombinations_fwn(gsc_SimData* d, gsc_MapID mapid, char* parent1, unsigned int p1num, char* parent2,
7057 unsigned int p2num, char* offspring, int window_size, int certain) {
7058 if (d->genome.n_maps < 1) {
7059 fprintf(stderr,"Need at least one recombination map loaded to estimate recombinations\n");
7060 return NULL;
7061 }
7062 int mapix = 0;
7063 if (mapid.id != NO_MAP.id) { mapix = gsc_get_index_of_map(d, mapid); }
7064 if (mapix >= d->genome.n_maps) {
7065 fprintf(stderr,"We don't have that recombination maps loaded\n");
7066 return NULL;
7067 }
7068 gsc_RecombinationMap map = d->genome.maps[mapix];
7069
7070
7071 int* origins = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int) * d->genome.n_markers,GSC_TRUE);
7072 memset(origins,0,sizeof(*origins)*d->genome.n_markers);
7073 int p1match, p2match;
7074 int previous = 0, window_range = (window_size - 1)/2, i;
7075
7076 for (int chr = 0; chr < map.n_chr; ++chr) {
7077 //RPACKINSERT R_CheckUserInterrupt();
7078
7079 switch (map.chrs[chr].type) {
7080 case GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_SIMPLE:
7081 for (i = 0; i < window_range; ++i) {
7082 origins[map.chrs[chr].map.simple.first_marker_index + i] = 0;
7083 }
7084 for (; i < map.chrs[chr].map.simple.n_markers - window_range; ++i) {
7085 p1match = gsc_has_same_alleles_window(parent1, offspring, i, window_size);
7086 p2match = gsc_has_same_alleles_window(parent2, offspring, i, window_size);
7087 if (p1match && !p2match) {
7088 origins[map.chrs[chr].map.simple.first_marker_index + i] = p1num;
7089 previous = p1num;
7090 } else if (p2match && !p1match) {
7091 origins[map.chrs[chr].map.simple.first_marker_index + i] = p2num;
7092 previous = p2num;
7093 } else {
7094 if (certain) {
7095 origins[map.chrs[chr].map.simple.first_marker_index + i] = 0;
7096 } else {
7097 origins[map.chrs[chr].map.simple.first_marker_index + i] = previous;
7098 }
7099 }
7100 }
7101 for (; i < map.chrs[chr].map.simple.n_markers; ++i) {
7102 origins[map.chrs[chr].map.simple.first_marker_index + i] = 0;
7103 }
7104 break;
7105
7106 case GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_REORDER:
7107 for (i = 0; i < window_range; ++i) {
7108 origins[map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.marker_indexes[i]] = 0;
7109 }
7110 for (; i < map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.n_markers - window_range; ++i) {
7111 p1match = gsc_has_same_alleles_window(parent1, offspring, i, window_size);
7112 p2match = gsc_has_same_alleles_window(parent2, offspring, i, window_size);
7113 if (p1match && !p2match) {
7114 origins[map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.marker_indexes[i]] = p1num;
7115 previous = p1num;
7116 } else if (p2match && !p1match) {
7117 origins[map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.marker_indexes[i]] = p2num;
7118 previous = p2num;
7119 } else {
7120 if (certain) {
7121 origins[map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.marker_indexes[i]] = 0;
7122 } else {
7123 origins[map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.marker_indexes[i]] = previous;
7124 }
7125 }
7126 }
7127 for (; i < map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.n_markers; ++i) {
7128 origins[map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.marker_indexes[i]] = 0;
7129 }
7130 break;
7131 }
7132
7133 }
7134 return origins;
7135}
7136
7173int gsc_calculate_recombinations_from_file(gsc_SimData* d, const char* input_file, const char* output_file,
7174 int window_len, int certain) {
7175 struct gsc_TableSize t = gsc_get_file_dimensions(input_file, '\t');
7176 //open file
7177 FILE* fp;
7178 if ((fp = fopen(input_file, "r")) == NULL) {
7179 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open file %s.\n", input_file); exit(1);
7180 }
7181 FILE* fpo;
7182 if ((fpo = fopen(output_file, "w")) == NULL) {
7183 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open file %s.\n", output_file); exit(1);
7184 }
7185
7186 // print header.
7187 for (int j = 0; j < d->genome.n_markers; ++j) {
7188 fprintf(fpo, "\t%s", d->genome.marker_names[j]);
7189 }
7190
7191 int combin_i[3];
7192 char* combin_genes[3];
7193 char buffer[3][50];
7194 int* r;
7195 // for each row in file
7196 for (int i = 0; i < t.num_rows; ++i) {
7197 // load the four grandparents
7198 fscanf(fp, "%s %s %s \n", buffer[0], buffer[1], buffer[2]);
7199 combin_i[0] = gsc_get_index_of_name(d->m, buffer[0]);
7200 combin_i[1] = gsc_get_index_of_name(d->m, buffer[1]);
7201 combin_i[2] = gsc_get_index_of_name(d->m, buffer[2]);
7202 combin_genes[0] = gsc_get_genes_of_index(d->m, combin_i[0]);
7203 combin_genes[1] = gsc_get_genes_of_index(d->m, combin_i[1]);
7204 combin_genes[2] = gsc_get_genes_of_index(d->m, combin_i[2]);
7205
7206 if (window_len == 1) {
7207 r = gsc_calculate_min_recombinations_fw1(d, NO_MAP, combin_genes[1],
7208 gsc_get_id_of_index(d->m, combin_i[1]).id, combin_genes[2],
7209 gsc_get_id_of_index(d->m, combin_i[2]).id, combin_genes[0], certain);
7210 } else {
7211 r = gsc_calculate_min_recombinations_fwn(d, NO_MAP, combin_genes[1],
7212 gsc_get_id_of_index(d->m, combin_i[1]).id, combin_genes[2],
7213 gsc_get_id_of_index(d->m, combin_i[2]).id, combin_genes[0], window_len, certain);
7214 }
7215 fprintf(fpo, "\n%s", buffer[0]);
7216 for (int j = 0; j < d->genome.n_markers; ++j) {
7217 fprintf(fpo, "\t%d", r[j]);
7218 }
7219 GSC_FREE(r);
7220 }
7221
7222 fclose(fp);
7223 fwrite("\n", sizeof(char), 1, fpo);
7224 fflush(fpo);
7225 fclose(fpo);
7226 return 0;
7227}
7228
7229
7230/*--------------------------------Crossing-----------------------------------*/
7231
7259void gsc_generate_gamete(gsc_SimData* d, const char* parent_genome, char* output, const unsigned int map_index) {
7260 // assumes rand is already seeded
7261 if (parent_genome == NULL) {
7262 fprintf(stderr, "Could not generate this gamete: no parent provided\n");
7263 return;
7264 }
7265 if (map_index >= d->genome.n_maps) {
7266 fprintf(stderr, "Could not generate this gamete: invalid map provided\n");
7267 return;
7268 }
7269 gsc_RecombinationMap map = d->genome.maps[map_index];
7270
7271 // treat each chromosome separately.
7272 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(crossover_where, double, 100);
7273 for (int chr = 0; chr < d->genome.maps[map_index].n_chr; ++chr) {
7274
7275 // Task 1: How many crossovers
7276 int num_crossovers;
7277 switch (map.chrs[chr].type) {
7278 case GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_SIMPLE:
7279 num_crossovers = gsc_randpoi(&d->rng, map.chrs[chr].map.simple.expected_n_crossovers);
7280 break;
7281 case GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_REORDER:
7282 num_crossovers = gsc_randpoi(&d->rng, map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.expected_n_crossovers);
7283 break;
7284 default:
7285 fprintf(stderr, "Linkage group type of group with index %i of map with index %ui is corrupted.\n", chr, map_index);
7286 num_crossovers = 0;
7287 }
7288
7289 // Task 2: Find positions of all crossovers
7290 if (num_crossovers > crossover_wherecap) {
7291 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(crossover_where,num_crossovers);
7292 }
7293 for (int i = 0; i < num_crossovers; ++i) {
7294 crossover_where[i] = ((double)rand() / (double)RAND_MAX);
7295 }
7296 if (num_crossovers > 1) {
7297 qsort(crossover_where, num_crossovers, sizeof(double), gsc_helper_ascending_double_comparer);
7298 }
7299
7300 // Task 3: Read off the gamete that those crossovers produce.
7301 int which = rnd_pcg_range(&d->rng,0,1); // if this is 0, we start with the left haplotype
7302 int up_to_crossover = 0;
7303 switch (map.chrs[chr].type) {
7304 case GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_SIMPLE:
7305 for (int i = 0; i < map.chrs[chr].map.simple.n_markers; ++i) {
7306 // is it time to invert which parent haplotype we're reading?
7307 while (up_to_crossover < num_crossovers &&
7308 map.chrs[chr].map.simple.dists[i] > crossover_where[up_to_crossover]) {
7309 which = 1 - which;
7310 up_to_crossover++;
7311 }
7312 output[2*(i + map.chrs[chr].map.simple.first_marker_index)] =
7313 parent_genome[2*(i + map.chrs[chr].map.simple.first_marker_index) + which];
7314 }
7315 break;
7316 case GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_REORDER:
7317 for (int i = 0; i < map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.n_markers; ++i) {
7318 // is it time to invert which parent haplotype we're reading?
7319 while (up_to_crossover < num_crossovers &&
7320 map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.dists[i] > crossover_where[up_to_crossover]) {
7321 which = 1 - which;
7322 up_to_crossover++;
7323 }
7324 output[2*map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.marker_indexes[i]] =
7325 parent_genome[2*map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.marker_indexes[i] + which];
7326 }
7327 break;
7328 default:
7329 break;
7330 }
7331 }
7332 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(crossover_where);
7333}
7334
7354void gsc_generate_doubled_haploid(gsc_SimData* d, const char* parent_genome, char* output, const unsigned int map_index) {
7355 /* For cache reasons it'll be better to copy-paste gsc_generate_gamete with
7356 * one extra line added to the inner loop, than to generate a single gamete
7357 * and then scan over `output` again to copy it. */
7358
7359 // assumes rand is already seeded
7360 if (parent_genome == NULL) {
7361 fprintf(stderr, "Could not make this doubled haploid\n");
7362 return;
7363 }
7364 if (map_index >= d->genome.n_maps) {
7365 fprintf(stderr, "Could not generate this gamete: invalid map provided\n");
7366 return;
7367 }
7368 gsc_RecombinationMap map = d->genome.maps[map_index];
7369
7370 // treat each chromosome separately.
7371 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(crossover_where, double, 100);
7372 for (int chr = 0; chr < d->genome.maps[map_index].n_chr; ++chr) {
7373
7374 // Task 1: How many crossovers
7375 int num_crossovers;
7376 switch (map.chrs[chr].type) {
7377 case GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_SIMPLE:
7378 num_crossovers = gsc_randpoi(&d->rng, map.chrs[chr].map.simple.expected_n_crossovers);
7379 break;
7380 case GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_REORDER:
7381 num_crossovers = gsc_randpoi(&d->rng, map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.expected_n_crossovers);
7382 break;
7383 default:
7384 fprintf(stderr, "Linkage group type of group with index %i of map with index %ui is corrupted.\n", chr, map_index);
7385 num_crossovers = 0;
7386 }
7387
7388 // Task 2: Find positions of all crossovers
7389 if (num_crossovers > crossover_wherecap) {
7390 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(crossover_where,num_crossovers);
7391 }
7392 for (int i = 0; i < num_crossovers; ++i) {
7393 crossover_where[i] = ((double)rand() / (double)RAND_MAX);
7394 }
7395 if (num_crossovers > 1) {
7396 qsort(crossover_where, num_crossovers, sizeof(double), gsc_helper_ascending_double_comparer);
7397 }
7398
7399 // Task 3: Read off the gamete that those crossovers produce.
7400 int which = rnd_pcg_range(&d->rng,0,1); // if this is 0, we start with the left haplotype
7401 int up_to_crossover = 0;
7402 switch (map.chrs[chr].type) {
7403 case GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_SIMPLE:
7404 for (int i = 0; i < map.chrs[chr].map.simple.n_markers; ++i) {
7405 // is it time to invert which parent haplotype we're reading?
7406 while (up_to_crossover < num_crossovers &&
7407 map.chrs[chr].map.simple.dists[i] > crossover_where[up_to_crossover]) {
7408 which = 1 - which;
7409 up_to_crossover++;
7410 }
7411 int pos = i + map.chrs[chr].map.simple.first_marker_index;
7412 output[2*pos] = parent_genome[2*pos + which];
7413 output[2*pos + 1] = output[2*pos]; // haploid doubling happens here
7414 }
7415 break;
7416 case GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_REORDER:
7417 for (int i = 0; i < map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.n_markers; ++i) {
7418 // is it time to invert which parent haplotype we're reading?
7419 while (up_to_crossover < num_crossovers &&
7420 map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.dists[i] > crossover_where[up_to_crossover]) {
7421 which = 1 - which;
7422 up_to_crossover++;
7423 }
7424 int pos = map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.marker_indexes[i];
7425 output[2*pos] = parent_genome[2*pos + which];
7426 output[2*pos + 1] = output[2*pos]; // haploid doubling happens here
7427 }
7428 break;
7429 default:
7430 break;
7431 }
7432 }
7433 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(crossover_where);
7434}
7435
7436
7448void gsc_generate_clone(gsc_SimData* d, const char* parent_genome, char* output) {
7449 for (int j = 0; j < d->genome.n_markers; ++j) {
7450 output[2*j] = parent_genome[2*j];
7451 output[2*j + 1] = parent_genome[2*j + 1];
7452 }
7453 return;
7454}
7455
7456
7458static FILE* gsc_helper_genoptions_save_pedigrees_setup(const gsc_GenOptions g) {
7459 FILE* fp = NULL;
7460 if (g.will_save_pedigree_to_file) {
7461 char tmpname_p[NAME_LENGTH];
7462 if (g.filename_prefix != NULL) {
7463 strncpy(tmpname_p, g.filename_prefix,
7464 sizeof(char)*(NAME_LENGTH-13));
7465 } else {
7466 strcpy(tmpname_p, "out");
7467 }
7468 strcat(tmpname_p, "-pedigree.txt");
7469 fp = fopen(tmpname_p, "w");
7470 }
7471 return fp;
7472}
7478static FILE* gsc_helper_genoptions_save_bvs_setup(const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GenOptions g, int* effIndexp) {
7479 FILE* fe = NULL;
7480 if (g.will_save_bvs_to_file.id != GSC_NO_EFFECTSET.id) {
7481 *effIndexp = gsc_get_index_of_eff_set(d,g.will_save_bvs_to_file);
7482 if (*effIndexp != GSC_UNINIT) {
7483 char tmpname_b[NAME_LENGTH];
7484 if (g.filename_prefix != NULL) {
7485 strncpy(tmpname_b, g.filename_prefix,
7486 sizeof(char)*(NAME_LENGTH-7));
7487 } else {
7488 strcpy(tmpname_b, "out");
7489 }
7490 strcat(tmpname_b, "-bv.txt");
7491 fe = fopen(tmpname_b, "w");
7492 }
7493 }
7494 return fe;
7495}
7497static FILE* gsc_helper_genoptions_save_genotypes_setup(const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GenOptions g) {
7498 FILE* fg = NULL;
7499 if (g.will_save_alleles_to_file) {
7500 char tmpname_g[NAME_LENGTH];
7501 if (g.filename_prefix != NULL) {
7502 strncpy(tmpname_g, g.filename_prefix,
7503 sizeof(char)*(NAME_LENGTH-13));
7504 } else {
7505 strcpy(tmpname_g, "out");
7506 }
7507 strcat(tmpname_g, "-genotype.txt");
7508 fg = fopen(tmpname_g, "w");
7509 // Save genetic markers as header row.
7510 gsc_save_utility_genotypes(fg, NULL, d->genome.n_markers, d->genome.marker_names, GSC_FALSE);
7511 }
7512 return fg;
7513}
7519static void gsc_helper_genoptions_save_pedigrees(FILE* fp, gsc_SimData* d, gsc_AlleleMatrix* tosave) {
7520 if (fp) {
7521 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter_fromAM(tosave, NO_GROUP);
7522 gsc_save_utility_pedigrees(fp, &it, GSC_TRUE, d->m);
7523 gsc_delete_bidirectional_iter(&it);
7524 }
7525}
7532static void gsc_helper_genoptions_save_bvs(FILE* fe, gsc_EffectMatrix* effMatrices, int effIndex, gsc_AlleleMatrix* tosave) {
7533 if (fe && effIndex != GSC_UNINIT) {
7534 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter_fromAM(tosave, NO_GROUP);
7535 gsc_save_utility_bvs(fe, &it, effMatrices + effIndex);
7536 gsc_delete_bidirectional_iter(&it);
7537 }
7538}
7544static void gsc_helper_genoptions_save_genotypes(FILE* fg, gsc_AlleleMatrix* tosave) {
7545 if (fg) {
7546 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter_fromAM(tosave, NO_GROUP);
7547 gsc_save_utility_genotypes(fg, &it, tosave->n_markers, NULL, GSC_FALSE);
7548 gsc_delete_bidirectional_iter(&it);
7549 }
7550}
7554static void gsc_helper_genoptions_give_names_and_ids(gsc_AlleleMatrix* am, gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GenOptions g) {
7555 if (g.will_name_offspring) {
7556 gsc_set_names(am, g.offspring_name_prefix, d->current_id.id, 0);
7557 }
7558 if (g.will_allocate_ids) {
7559 for (int j = 0; j < am->n_genotypes; ++j) {
7560 ++(d->current_id.id);
7561 am->ids[j] = d->current_id;
7562 }
7563 }
7564}
7599gsc_GroupNum gsc_scaffold_make_new_genotypes(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GenOptions g,
7600 void* parentIterator, void* datastore,
7601 int (*parentChooser)(void*, void*, unsigned int*, gsc_ParentChoice[static 2]),
7602 void (*offspringGenerator)(gsc_SimData*, void*, gsc_ParentChoice[static 2], gsc_GenoLocation) ) {
7603 if (g.family_size < 1 || d == NULL ||
7604 parentChooser == NULL || offspringGenerator == NULL) {
7605 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
7606 }
7607
7608 // create the buffer we'll use to save the output crosses before they're printed.
7609 gsc_AlleleMatrix* offspring = gsc_create_empty_allelematrix(d->genome.n_markers, d->n_labels, d->label_defaults, CONTIG_WIDTH);
7610 unsigned int fullness = 0;
7611 unsigned int counter = 0;
7612 gsc_ParentChoice parents[2] = { { GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION, GSC_UNINIT }, { GSC_INVALID_GENO_LOCATION, GSC_UNINIT } };
7613
7614 gsc_AlleleMatrix* last = NULL;
7615 gsc_GroupNum output_group = GSC_NO_GROUP;
7616 if (g.will_save_to_simdata) {
7617 last = d->m; // for saving to simdata
7618 while (last->next != NULL) {
7619 last = last->next;
7620 }
7621 output_group = gsc_get_new_group_num( d );
7622 }
7623
7624 // open the output files, if applicable
7625 FILE* fp = gsc_helper_genoptions_save_pedigrees_setup(g);
7626 int effIndex = GSC_UNINIT;
7627 FILE* fe = gsc_helper_genoptions_save_bvs_setup(d,g,&effIndex);
7628 FILE* fg = gsc_helper_genoptions_save_genotypes_setup(d,g);
7629
7630 //RPACKINSERT GetRNGstate();
7631 // loop through each combination
7632 while (parentChooser(parentIterator, datastore, &counter, parents)) {
7633 ++counter;
7634 for (int f = 0; f < g.family_size; ++f, ++fullness) {
7635 //RPACKINSERT R_CheckUserInterrupt();
7636
7637 // when offspring buffer is full, save these outcomes to the file.
7638 if (fullness >= CONTIG_WIDTH) {
7639 offspring->n_genotypes = CONTIG_WIDTH;
7640 gsc_helper_genoptions_give_names_and_ids(offspring, d, g);
7641 gsc_helper_genoptions_save_pedigrees(fp, d, offspring);
7642 gsc_helper_genoptions_save_bvs(fe, d->e, effIndex, offspring);
7643 gsc_helper_genoptions_save_genotypes(fg, offspring);
7644
7645 if (g.will_save_to_simdata) {
7646 last->next = offspring;
7647 last = last->next;
7648 offspring = gsc_create_empty_allelematrix(d->genome.n_markers, d->n_labels, d->label_defaults, CONTIG_WIDTH);
7649 }
7650 fullness = 0; //reset the count and start refilling the matrix
7651 }
7652
7653 // do the cross.
7654 gsc_GenoLocation offspringPos = { .localAM=offspring, .localPos=fullness };
7655 offspringGenerator(d, datastore, parents, offspringPos);
7656 offspring->groups[fullness] = output_group;
7657 if (g.will_track_pedigree) {
7658 offspring->pedigrees[0][fullness] = gsc_get_id(parents[0].loc);
7659 offspring->pedigrees[1][fullness] = gsc_get_id(parents[1].loc);
7660 }
7661 }
7662 }
7663 //RPACKINSERT PutRNGstate();
7664
7665 offspring->n_genotypes = fullness;
7666 gsc_helper_genoptions_give_names_and_ids(offspring, d, g);
7667 gsc_helper_genoptions_save_pedigrees(fp, d, offspring);
7668 gsc_helper_genoptions_save_bvs(fe, d->e, effIndex, offspring);
7669 gsc_helper_genoptions_save_genotypes(fg, offspring);
7670
7671 if (fp) fclose(fp);
7672 if (fe) fclose(fe);
7673 if (fg) fclose(fg);
7674
7675 if (counter > 0 && g.will_save_to_simdata) {
7676 last->next = offspring;
7677 d->n_groups++;
7678 gsc_condense_allele_matrix( d );
7679 return output_group;
7680 } else {
7681 gsc_delete_allele_matrix( offspring );
7682 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
7683 }
7684}
7685
7695static int gsc_helper_parentchooser_cross_randomly(void* parentIterator, void* datastore, unsigned int* counter,
7696 gsc_ParentChoice parents[static 2]) {
7697 gsc_RandomAccessIterator* it = (gsc_RandomAccessIterator*) parentIterator;
7698 unsigned int* datastoreint = (unsigned int*) datastore;
7699 unsigned int n_crosses = datastoreint[0];
7700 unsigned int cap = datastoreint[1];
7701 unsigned int nparents = datastoreint[2];
7702 //unsigned int mapindex = datastoreint[3];
7703 unsigned int* parent_uses = datastoreint + 4;
7704 unsigned int parentixs[2] = { 0 };
7705
7706 if (*counter < n_crosses && (cap == 0 || (*counter) < cap * nparents)) {
7707 // get parents, randomly. Must not be identical or already been used too many times.
7708 parentixs[0] = gsc_randomdraw_replacementrules(it[0].d, nparents, cap, parent_uses, GSC_UNINIT);
7709 parentixs[1] = gsc_randomdraw_replacementrules(it[0].d, nparents, cap, parent_uses, parentixs[0]);
7710
7711 if (cap > 0) {
7712 parent_uses[parentixs[0]] += 1;
7713 parent_uses[parentixs[1]] += 1;
7714 }
7715
7716 // Neither of these should fail, if nparents is good.
7717 parents[0].loc = gsc_next_get_nth(parentIterator, parentixs[0]);
7718 parents[1].loc = gsc_next_get_nth(parentIterator, parentixs[1]);
7719 // Reiterate map. Might save us a read to not bother checking their values first.
7720 parents[0].mapindex = datastoreint[3];
7721 parents[1].mapindex = datastoreint[3];
7722 // This will cut short gsc_scaffold_make_new_genotypes execution if either parent is invalid.
7723 return GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(parents[0].loc) && GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(parents[1].loc);
7724 } else {
7725 return GSC_FALSE;
7726 }
7727}
7728
7737static void gsc_helper_make_offspring_cross(gsc_SimData* d, void* datastore, gsc_ParentChoice parents[static 2], gsc_GenoLocation putHere) {
7738 // (silly name)
7739 gsc_generate_gamete(d, gsc_get_alleles(parents[0].loc), (gsc_get_alleles(putHere) ), parents[0].mapindex);
7740 gsc_generate_gamete(d, gsc_get_alleles(parents[1].loc), (gsc_get_alleles(putHere)+1), parents[1].mapindex);
7741}
7742
7748static int gsc_helper_random_cross_checks(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum from_group, const int n_crosses, const int cap) {
7749 int g_size = gsc_get_group_size( d, from_group); // might be a better way to do this using the iterator.
7750 if (g_size < 1) {
7751 fprintf(stderr,"Group %d does not exist.\n", from_group.num);
7752 return 0;
7753 }
7754
7755 if (n_crosses < 1) {
7756 fprintf(stderr,"Invalid n_crosses value provided: n_crosses must be greater than 0.\n");
7757 return 0;
7758 }
7759
7760 if (cap < 0) {
7761 fprintf(stderr,"Invalid cap value provided: cap can't be negative.\n");
7762 return 0;
7763 }
7764 if (cap > 0 && cap*g_size < n_crosses) {
7765 fprintf(stderr,"Invalid cap value provided: cap of %d uses on %d parents too small to make %d crosses.\n", cap, g_size, n_crosses);
7766 return 0;
7767 }
7768
7769 return g_size;
7770}
7771
7797gsc_GroupNum gsc_make_random_crosses(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum from_group, const int n_crosses, const int cap,
7798 const gsc_MapID which_map, const gsc_GenOptions g) {
7799 int g_size = gsc_helper_random_cross_checks(d, from_group, n_crosses*2, cap);
7800 if (g_size == 0) {
7801 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
7802 } else if (g_size == 1) {
7803 fprintf(stderr,"Group %d must contain multiple individuals to be able to perform random crossing\n", from_group.num);
7804 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
7805 }
7806 if (d->genome.n_maps < 1) {
7807 fprintf(stderr,"Crossing requires at least one recombination map loaded\n");
7808 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
7809 }
7810 unsigned int map_index = 0;
7811 if (which_map.id != NO_MAP.id) { map_index = gsc_get_index_of_map(d, which_map); }
7812 if (map_index < 0) {
7813 fprintf(stderr,"Could not find recombination map with identifier %i.\n", which_map.id);
7814 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
7815 }
7816
7817 unsigned int* datastore = NULL; // cap = 0 means unlimited uses. Otherwise we need to track number of times each is used.
7818 if (cap > 0) {
7819 datastore = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(unsigned int)*(g_size+4),GSC_TRUE);
7820 memset(datastore + 4,0,sizeof(unsigned int)*g_size);
7821 } else {
7822 datastore = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(unsigned int)*4,GSC_TRUE);
7823 }
7824 datastore[0] = n_crosses;
7825 datastore[1] = cap;
7826 datastore[2] = g_size;
7827 datastore[3] = map_index;
7828
7829 gsc_RandomAccessIterator parentit = gsc_create_randomaccess_iter( d, from_group);
7830
7831 gsc_GroupNum offspring = gsc_scaffold_make_new_genotypes(d, g, (void*) &parentit, (void*) datastore,
7832 gsc_helper_parentchooser_cross_randomly,
7833 gsc_helper_make_offspring_cross );
7834
7835 gsc_delete_randomaccess_iter(&parentit);
7836 GSC_FREE(datastore);
7837 return offspring;
7838}
7839
7862unsigned int gsc_randomdraw_replacementrules(gsc_SimData* d, unsigned int max, unsigned int cap, unsigned int* member_uses, unsigned int noCollision) {
7863 if (max < 1 || (max == 1 && noCollision == 0)) {
7864 return GSC_UNINIT;
7865 }
7866 unsigned int parentix = 0;
7867 if (cap > 0) { // n uses of each parent is capped at a number cap.
7868 do {
7869 parentix = rnd_pcg_range(&d->rng,0,max - 1);
7870 } while (parentix == noCollision || member_uses[parentix] >= cap);
7871 } else { // no cap on usage of each parent.
7872 do {
7873 parentix = rnd_pcg_range(&d->rng,0,max - 1);
7874 } while (parentix == noCollision);
7875 }
7876 return parentix;
7877}
7878
7890static int gsc_helper_parentchooser_cross_randomly_between(void* parentIterator, void* datastore, unsigned int* counter,
7891 gsc_ParentChoice parents[static 2]) {
7892 // caller function should guarantee that nparents is not 1. How would you make a nonselfed cross then?
7893 gsc_RandomAccessIterator* it = (gsc_RandomAccessIterator*) parentIterator;
7894 unsigned int* datastoreint = (unsigned int*) datastore;
7895 unsigned int n_crosses = datastoreint[0];
7896 unsigned int* caps = datastoreint + 1; // caps[0], caps[1]
7897 unsigned int* nparents = datastoreint + 3; //nparents[0], nparents[1]
7898 unsigned int* map_index = datastoreint + 5; // map_index[0], map_index[1]
7899 unsigned int* parent_uses = datastoreint + 7; // parent_uses (nparents[0] + nparents[1] long)
7900 unsigned int parentixs[2] = { 0 };
7901
7902 if (*counter < n_crosses && (caps[0] == 0 || (*counter) < caps[0] * nparents[0])
7903 && (caps[1] == 0 || (*counter) < caps[1] * nparents[1])) {
7904 // get parents, randomly. Must not be identical or already been used too many times.
7905 parentixs[0] = gsc_randomdraw_replacementrules(it[0].d, nparents[0], caps[0], parent_uses, GSC_UNINIT);
7906 parentixs[1] = gsc_randomdraw_replacementrules(it[1].d, nparents[1], caps[1], parent_uses + caps[0]*nparents[0], GSC_UNINIT);
7907
7908 if (caps[0] > 0) {
7909 parent_uses[parentixs[0]] += 1;
7910 }
7911 if (caps[1] > 0) {
7912 parent_uses[caps[0]*nparents[0] + parentixs[1]] += 1;
7913 }
7914
7915 parents[0].loc = gsc_next_get_nth(it+0, parentixs[0]);
7916 parents[1].loc = gsc_next_get_nth(it+1, parentixs[1]);
7917 parents[0].mapindex = map_index[0];
7918 parents[1].mapindex = map_index[1];
7919 return GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(parents[0].loc) && GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(parents[1].loc);
7920 }
7921 return GSC_FALSE;
7922}
7923
7960gsc_GroupNum gsc_make_random_crosses_between(gsc_SimData*d, const gsc_GroupNum group1, const gsc_GroupNum group2, const int n_crosses,
7961 const int cap1, const int cap2, const gsc_MapID map1, const gsc_MapID map2, const gsc_GenOptions g) {
7962 int group1_size = gsc_helper_random_cross_checks(d, group1, n_crosses, cap1);
7963 int group2_size = gsc_helper_random_cross_checks(d, group2, n_crosses, cap2);
7964 if (group1_size == 0 || group2_size == 0) {
7965 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
7966 }
7967 if (d->genome.n_maps < 1) {
7968 fprintf(stderr,"Crossing requires at least one recombination map loaded\n");
7969 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
7970 }
7971 unsigned int map1_index = 0;
7972 if (map1.id != NO_MAP.id) { map1_index = gsc_get_index_of_map(d, map1); }
7973 if (map1_index == GSC_UNINIT) { //|| map_index > d->genome.n_maps) {
7974 fprintf(stderr,"Could not find recombination map with identifier %i.\n", map1.id);
7975 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
7976 }
7977 unsigned int map2_index = 0;
7978 if (map2.id != NO_MAP.id) { map2_index = gsc_get_index_of_map(d, map2); }
7979 if (map2_index == GSC_UNINIT) { //|| map_index > d->genome.n_maps) {
7980 fprintf(stderr,"Could not find recombination map with identifier %i.\n", map2.id);
7981 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
7982 }
7983
7984 unsigned int* datastore = NULL;
7985 int hascap1 = cap1 > 0 ? 1 : 0;
7986 int hascap2 = cap2 > 0 ? 1 : 0;
7987 if (hascap1 || hascap2) {
7988 datastore = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(unsigned int)*(hascap1*group1_size + hascap2*group2_size + 7),GSC_TRUE);
7989 memset(datastore + 7,0,sizeof(unsigned int)*(hascap1*group1_size + hascap2*group2_size));
7990 } else {
7991 datastore = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(unsigned int)*7,GSC_TRUE);
7992 }
7993 datastore[0] = n_crosses;
7994 datastore[1] = cap1;
7995 datastore[2] = cap2;
7996 datastore[3] = group1_size;
7997 datastore[4] = group2_size;
7998 datastore[5] = map1_index;
7999 datastore[6] = map2_index;
8000
8001 gsc_RandomAccessIterator parentit[2] = { gsc_create_randomaccess_iter( d, group1 ),
8002 gsc_create_randomaccess_iter( d, group2 ),
8003 };
8004
8005 gsc_GroupNum offspring = gsc_scaffold_make_new_genotypes(d, g, (void*) parentit, (void*) datastore,
8006 gsc_helper_parentchooser_cross_randomly_between,
8007 gsc_helper_make_offspring_cross );
8008
8009 gsc_delete_randomaccess_iter(&parentit[0]);
8010 gsc_delete_randomaccess_iter(&parentit[1]);
8011 GSC_FREE(datastore);
8012 return offspring;
8013
8014}
8015
8025static int gsc_helper_parentchooser_cross_targeted(void* parentIterator, void* datastore, unsigned int* counter,
8026 gsc_ParentChoice parents[static 2]) {
8027 gsc_RandomAccessIterator* it = (gsc_RandomAccessIterator*) parentIterator;
8028 int** datastoreintp = (int**) datastore;
8029 int ncrosses = **datastoreintp;
8030 if (*counter >= ncrosses) {
8031 return GSC_FALSE;
8032 }
8033
8034 int** crosses = datastoreintp+1;
8035 int* maps = datastoreintp[3];
8036
8037 parents[0].loc = gsc_next_get_nth(it, crosses[0][*counter]);
8038 parents[1].loc = gsc_next_get_nth(it, crosses[1][*counter]);
8039 parents[0].mapindex = maps[0];
8040 parents[1].mapindex = maps[1];
8041
8042 // This will cut short gsc_scaffold_make_new_genotypes execution if either parent is invalid.
8043 return GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(parents[0].loc) && GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(parents[1].loc);
8044}
8045
8078gsc_GroupNum gsc_make_targeted_crosses(gsc_SimData* d, const int n_combinations, const int* firstParents, const int* secondParents,
8079 const gsc_MapID map1, const gsc_MapID map2, const gsc_GenOptions g) {
8080 if (n_combinations < 1) {
8081 fprintf(stderr,"Invalid n_combinations value provided: n_combinations must be greater than 0.\n");
8082 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
8083 }
8084 if (d->genome.n_maps < 1) {
8085 fprintf(stderr,"Crossing requires at least one recombination map loaded\n");
8086 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
8087 }
8088 int mapindexes[2] = { 0, 0 };
8089 if (map1.id != NO_MAP.id) { mapindexes[0] = gsc_get_index_of_map(d, map1); }
8090 if (mapindexes[0] == GSC_UNINIT) { //|| map_index > d->genome.n_maps) {
8091 fprintf(stderr,"Could not find recombination map with identifier %i.\n", map1.id);
8092 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
8093 }
8094 if (map2.id != NO_MAP.id) { mapindexes[1] = gsc_get_index_of_map(d, map2); }
8095 if (mapindexes[1] == GSC_UNINIT) { //|| map_index > d->genome.n_maps) {
8096 fprintf(stderr,"Could not find recombination map with identifier %i.\n", map2.id);
8097 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
8098 }
8099
8100 const int* datastore[4] = { &n_combinations, firstParents, secondParents, mapindexes } ;
8101 gsc_RandomAccessIterator parentit = gsc_create_randomaccess_iter( d, GSC_NO_GROUP );
8102
8103 gsc_GroupNum offspring = gsc_scaffold_make_new_genotypes(d, g, (void*) &parentit, (void*) datastore,
8104 gsc_helper_parentchooser_cross_targeted,
8105 gsc_helper_make_offspring_cross );
8106
8107 gsc_delete_randomaccess_iter(&parentit);
8108 return offspring;
8109}
8110
8120static int gsc_helper_parentchooser_selfing(void* parentIterator, void* datastore, unsigned int* counter, gsc_ParentChoice parents[static 2]) {
8121 gsc_BidirectionalIterator* it = (gsc_BidirectionalIterator*) parentIterator;
8122
8123 parents[0].loc = gsc_next_forwards(it);
8124 parents[0].mapindex = *((unsigned int*) datastore);
8125 parents[1] = parents[0];
8126
8127 return GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(parents[0].loc);
8128}
8129
8141static void gsc_helper_make_offspring_self_n_times(gsc_SimData* d, void* datastore, gsc_ParentChoice parents[static 2], gsc_GenoLocation putHere) {
8142 unsigned int n = ((unsigned int*) datastore)[1];
8143
8144 // error checking parents are the same is not done.
8145 // error checking n >= 1 is not done.
8146
8147 char* tmpparent = gsc_get_alleles(parents[0].loc);
8148 unsigned int map = parents[0].mapindex;
8149 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(tmpchild,char,d->genome.n_markers<<1);
8150 char* output = gsc_get_alleles(putHere);
8151 int n_oddness = n % 2;
8152 for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
8153 if (i % 2 == n_oddness) {
8154 gsc_generate_gamete(d, tmpparent, tmpchild, map);
8155 gsc_generate_gamete(d, tmpparent, tmpchild+1, map);
8156 tmpparent = tmpchild;
8157 } else {
8158 gsc_generate_gamete(d, tmpparent, output, map);
8159 gsc_generate_gamete(d, tmpparent, output+1, map);
8160 tmpparent = output;
8161 }
8162 }
8163 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(tmpchild);
8164}
8165
8189gsc_GroupNum gsc_self_n_times(gsc_SimData* d, const unsigned int n, const gsc_GroupNum group, const gsc_MapID which_map, const gsc_GenOptions g) {
8190 /*int group_size = gsc_get_group_size( d, group);
8191 if (group_size < 1) {
8192 fprintf(stderr,"Group %d does not exist.\n", group.num);
8193 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
8194 }*/
8195 if (n < 1) {
8196 fprintf(stderr,"Invalid n value provided: Number of generations must be greater than 0.\n");
8197 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
8198 }
8199 if (d->genome.n_maps < 1) {
8200 fprintf(stderr,"Selfing requires at least one recombination map loaded\n");
8201 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
8202 }
8203 unsigned int map_index = 0;
8204 if (which_map.id != NO_MAP.id) { map_index = gsc_get_index_of_map(d, which_map); }
8205 if (map_index == GSC_UNINIT) { //|| map_index > d->genome.n_maps) {
8206 fprintf(stderr,"Could not find recombination map with identifier %i.\n", which_map.id);
8207 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
8208 }
8209 unsigned int datastore[2] = { map_index, n };
8210
8211 gsc_BidirectionalIterator parentit = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter( d, group );
8212
8213 return gsc_scaffold_make_new_genotypes(d, g, (void*) &parentit, (void*) datastore,
8214 gsc_helper_parentchooser_selfing,
8215 gsc_helper_make_offspring_self_n_times );
8216}
8217
8226static void gsc_helper_make_offspring_doubled_haploids(gsc_SimData* d, void* datastore, gsc_ParentChoice parents[static 2], gsc_GenoLocation putHere) {
8227 gsc_generate_doubled_haploid(d, gsc_get_alleles(parents[0].loc), gsc_get_alleles(putHere), parents[0].mapindex);
8228}
8229
8249gsc_GroupNum gsc_make_doubled_haploids(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group, const gsc_MapID which_map, const gsc_GenOptions g) {
8250 /*int group_size = gsc_get_group_size( d, group);
8251 if (group_size < 1) {
8252 fprintf(stderr,"Group %d does not exist.\n", group.num);
8253 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
8254 }*/
8255 if (d->genome.n_maps < 1) {
8256 fprintf(stderr,"Crossing requires at least one recombination map loaded\n");
8257 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
8258 }
8259 unsigned int map_index = 0;
8260 if (which_map.id != NO_MAP.id) { map_index = gsc_get_index_of_map(d, which_map); }
8261 if (map_index == GSC_UNINIT) {
8262 fprintf(stderr,"Could not find recombination map with identifier %i.\n", which_map.id);
8263 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
8264 }
8265
8266 gsc_BidirectionalIterator parentit = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter( d, group );
8267
8268 return gsc_scaffold_make_new_genotypes(d, g, (void*) &parentit, (void*) &map_index,
8269 gsc_helper_parentchooser_selfing,
8270 gsc_helper_make_offspring_doubled_haploids );
8271}
8272
8284static int gsc_helper_parentchooser_cloning(void* parentIterator, void* datastore, unsigned int* counter, gsc_ParentChoice parents[static 2]) {
8285 gsc_BidirectionalIterator* it = (gsc_BidirectionalIterator*) parentIterator;
8286
8287 parents[0].loc = gsc_next_forwards(it);
8288 parents[1] = parents[0];
8289
8290 if (GSC_IS_VALID_LOCATION(parents[0].loc)) {
8291 char inherit_names = *( ((char**) datastore)[0] );
8292 if (inherit_names) {
8293 ((char**) datastore)[1] = gsc_get_name(parents[0].loc);
8294 }
8295 return GSC_TRUE;
8296 } else {
8297 return GSC_FALSE;
8298 }
8299}
8300
8309static void gsc_helper_make_offspring_clones(gsc_SimData* d, void* datastore, gsc_ParentChoice parents[static 2], gsc_GenoLocation putHere) {
8310 char inherit_names = *( ((char**) datastore)[0] );
8311 if (inherit_names) {
8312 char* tmpname = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char)*(strlen(((char**) datastore)[1]) + 1),GSC_TRUE);
8313 strcpy(tmpname, ((char**) datastore)[1]);
8314 gsc_set_name(putHere,tmpname);
8315 }
8316
8317 gsc_generate_clone(d, gsc_get_alleles(parents[0].loc), gsc_get_alleles(putHere));
8318}
8319
8343gsc_GroupNum gsc_make_clones(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group, const int inherit_names, gsc_GenOptions g) {
8344 /*int group_size = gsc_get_group_size( d, group);
8345 if (group_size < 1) {
8346 fprintf(stderr,"Group %d does not exist.\n", group.num);
8347 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
8348 }*/
8349
8350 char do_inherit_names = inherit_names;
8351 char* nameinherit[2] = {&do_inherit_names, NULL };
8352
8353 gsc_BidirectionalIterator parentit = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter( d, group );
8354
8355 return gsc_scaffold_make_new_genotypes(d, g, (void*) &parentit, (void*) nameinherit,
8356 gsc_helper_parentchooser_cloning,
8357 gsc_helper_make_offspring_clones );
8358}
8359
8360
8377gsc_GroupNum gsc_make_all_unidirectional_crosses(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum from_group, const gsc_MapID mapID, const gsc_GenOptions g) {
8378 int group_size = gsc_get_group_size( d, from_group );
8379 if (group_size < 2) {
8380 if (group_size == 1) {
8381 fprintf(stderr,"Group %d does not have enough members to perform crosses\n", from_group.num);
8382 } else {
8383 fprintf(stderr,"Group %d does not exist.\n", from_group.num);
8384 }
8385 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
8386 }
8387 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(group_indexes,size_t,group_size);
8388 gsc_get_group_indexes( d, from_group, group_size, group_indexes );
8389
8390 // number of crosses = number of entries in upper triangle of matrix
8391 // = half of (n entries in matrix - length of diagonal)
8392 // = half of (lmatrix * lmatrix - lmatrix);
8393 int n_crosses = group_size * (group_size - 1) / 2; //* g.family_size;
8394
8395 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(combos0,int,n_crosses);
8396 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(combos1,int,n_crosses);
8397 int* combinations[2] = {combos0, combos1};
8398 int cross_index = 0;
8399 for (int i = 0; i < group_size; ++i) {
8400 for (int j = i + 1; j < group_size; ++j) {
8401 combinations[0][cross_index] = group_indexes[i];
8402 combinations[1][cross_index] = group_indexes[j];
8403
8404 ++cross_index;
8405 }
8406 }
8407
8408 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(group_indexes);
8409 gsc_GroupNum out = gsc_make_targeted_crosses(d, n_crosses, combinations[0], combinations[1], mapID, mapID, g);
8410 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(combos0);
8411 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(combos1);
8412 return out;
8413}
8414
8434gsc_GroupNum gsc_make_n_crosses_from_top_m_percent(gsc_SimData* d, const int n, const int m, const gsc_GroupNum group,
8435 const gsc_MapID mapID, const gsc_EffectID effID, const gsc_GenOptions g) {
8436 const int effIndex = gsc_get_index_of_eff_set(d, effID);
8437 if (n < 1) {
8438 fprintf(stderr,"Invalid n value provided: Number of crosses must be greater than 0.\n");
8439 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
8440 }
8441 if (effIndex == GSC_UNINIT) {
8442 fprintf(stderr,"Cannot find marker effect set with id %d\n", effID.id);
8443 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
8444 }
8445 if (m < 1 || m > 100) {
8446 fprintf(stderr,"Invalid m value provided: Percent to select must be between 1 and 100.\n");
8447 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
8448 }
8449
8450 // move the top m% to a new group
8451 int group_size = gsc_get_group_size(d, group);
8452 if (group_size < 1) {
8453 fprintf(stderr,"Group %d does not exist.\n", group.num);
8454 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
8455 }
8456
8457 int n_top_group = group_size * m / 100;
8458 printf("There are %d lines in the top %d%%\n", n_top_group, m);
8459
8460 gsc_GroupNum topgroup = gsc_split_by_bv(d, group, effID, n_top_group, GSC_FALSE);
8461
8462 // do the random crosses
8463 gsc_GroupNum gp = gsc_make_random_crosses(d, topgroup, 0, n, mapID, g);
8464
8465 // unconvert from a group
8466 gsc_GroupNum to_combine[] = {group, topgroup};
8467 gsc_combine_groups(d, 2, to_combine);
8468
8469 return gp;
8470}
8471
8498gsc_GroupNum gsc_make_crosses_from_file(gsc_SimData* d, const char* input_file, const gsc_MapID map1, const gsc_MapID map2, const gsc_GenOptions g) {
8499 struct gsc_TableSize t = gsc_get_file_dimensions(input_file, '\t');
8500 if (t.num_rows < 1) {
8501 fprintf(stderr, "No crosses exist in that file\n");
8502 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
8503 }
8504
8505 //open file
8506 FILE* fp;
8507 if ((fp = fopen(input_file, "r")) == NULL) {
8508 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open file %s.\n", input_file); exit(1);
8509 }
8510
8511 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(combos0,int,t.num_rows);
8512 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(combos1,int,t.num_rows);
8513 int* combinations[2] = {combos0,combos1};
8514 char buffer[2][NAME_LENGTH];
8515 // for each row in file
8516 for (int i = 0; i < t.num_rows; ++i) {
8517 // load the four grandparents
8518 fscanf(fp, "%s %s \n", buffer[0], buffer[1]);
8519 combinations[0][i] = gsc_get_index_of_name(d->m, buffer[0]);
8520 combinations[1][i] = gsc_get_index_of_name(d->m, buffer[1]);
8521 }
8522
8523 fclose(fp);
8524 gsc_GroupNum out = gsc_make_targeted_crosses(d, t.num_rows, combinations[0], combinations[1], map1, map2, g);
8525 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(combos0);
8526 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(combos1);
8527 return out;
8528}
8529
8562gsc_GroupNum gsc_make_double_crosses_from_file(gsc_SimData* d, const char* input_file, const gsc_MapID map1, const gsc_MapID map2, const gsc_GenOptions g) {
8563 struct gsc_TableSize t = gsc_get_file_dimensions(input_file, '\t');
8564 if (t.num_rows < 1) {
8565 fprintf(stderr, "No crosses exist in that file\n");
8566 return GSC_NO_GROUP;
8567 }
8568
8569 //open file
8570 FILE* fp;
8571 if ((fp = fopen(input_file, "r")) == NULL) {
8572 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open file %s.\n", input_file); exit(1);
8573 }
8574
8575 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(combos0,int,t.num_rows);
8576 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(combos1,int,t.num_rows);
8577 int* combinations[2] = {combos0,combos1};
8578 char buffer[4][NAME_LENGTH];
8579 const char* to_buffer[] = {buffer[0], buffer[1], buffer[2], buffer[3]};
8580 gsc_PedigreeID g0_id[4];
8581 int f1_i[2];
8582 // for each row in file
8583 for (int i = 0; i < t.num_rows; ++i) {
8584 // load the four grandparents
8585 fscanf(fp, "%s %s %s %s \n", buffer[0], buffer[1], buffer[2], buffer[3]);
8586 gsc_get_ids_of_names(d->m, 4, to_buffer, g0_id);
8587 if (g0_id[0].id == GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id || g0_id[1].id == GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id || g0_id[2].id == GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id || g0_id[3].id == GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
8588 fprintf(stderr, "Could not go ahead with the line %d cross - g0 names not in records\n", i);
8589 combinations[0][i] = GSC_UNINIT;
8590 combinations[1][i] = GSC_UNINIT;
8591 continue;
8592 }
8593
8594 // identify two parents
8595 f1_i[0] = gsc_get_index_of_child(d->m, g0_id[0], g0_id[1]);
8596 f1_i[1] = gsc_get_index_of_child(d->m, g0_id[2], g0_id[3]);
8597 if (f1_i[0] < 0 || f1_i[1] < 0) {
8598 // try different permutations of the four grandparents.
8599 f1_i[0] = gsc_get_index_of_child(d->m, g0_id[0], g0_id[2]);
8600 f1_i[1] = gsc_get_index_of_child(d->m, g0_id[1], g0_id[3]);
8601 if (f1_i[0] < 0 || f1_i[1] < 0) {
8602 f1_i[0] = gsc_get_index_of_child(d->m, g0_id[0], g0_id[3]);
8603 f1_i[1] = gsc_get_index_of_child(d->m, g0_id[1], g0_id[2]);
8604 if (f1_i[0] < 0 || f1_i[1] < 0) {
8605 fprintf(stderr, "Could not go ahead with the line %d cross - f1 children do not exist for this quartet\n", i);
8606 combinations[0][i] = GSC_UNINIT;
8607 combinations[1][i] = GSC_UNINIT;
8608 continue;
8609 }
8610 }
8611 }
8612
8613 //add them to a combinations list
8614 combinations[0][i] = f1_i[0];
8615 combinations[1][i] = f1_i[1];
8616
8617 }
8618
8619 fclose(fp);
8620 gsc_GroupNum out = gsc_make_targeted_crosses(d, t.num_rows, combinations[0], combinations[1], map1, map2, g);
8621 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(combos0);
8622 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(combos1);
8623 return out;
8624}
8625
8626
8627/*--------------------------------Fitness------------------------------------*/
8628
8643gsc_GroupNum gsc_split_by_bv(gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group, const gsc_EffectID effID, const int top_n, const int lowIsBest) {
8644 const int effIndex = gsc_get_index_of_eff_set(d, effID);
8645 if (effIndex == GSC_UNINIT || d->e[effIndex].effects.rows < 1 || d->m == NULL) {
8646 fprintf(stderr, "Either effect matrix or allele matrix does not exist\n"); exit(1);
8647 }
8648
8649 unsigned int group_size = gsc_get_group_size( d, group );
8650 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(group_indexes,size_t,group_size);
8651 gsc_get_group_indexes( d, group, group_size, group_indexes );
8652
8653 if (group_size <= top_n) {
8654 // well we'll just have to move em all
8655 gsc_GroupNum migration = gsc_make_group_from(d, group_size, group_indexes);
8656 return migration;
8657 }
8658
8659 // This should be ordered the same as the indexes
8660 gsc_DecimalMatrix fits = gsc_calculate_bvs( d, group, effID ); // 1 by group_size matrix
8661
8662 // get an array of pointers to those fitnesses
8663 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(p_fits,double*,fits.cols);
8664 for (int i = 0; i < fits.cols; i++) {
8665 p_fits[i] = &(fits.matrix[0][i]);
8666 }
8667
8668 // sort descending
8669 if (lowIsBest) {
8670 qsort(p_fits, fits.cols, sizeof(double*), gsc_helper_ascending_pdouble_comparer);
8671 } else {
8672 qsort(p_fits, fits.cols, sizeof(double*), gsc_helper_descending_pdouble_comparer);
8673 }
8674
8675 // save the indexes of the best n
8676 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(top_individuals,size_t,top_n);
8677 for (int i = 0; i < top_n; i++) {
8678 top_individuals[i] = group_indexes[p_fits[i] - fits.matrix[0]];
8679 }
8680 gsc_delete_dmatrix(&fits);
8681 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(p_fits);
8682 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(group_indexes);
8683
8684 // send those n to a new group
8685 gsc_GroupNum out = gsc_make_group_from(d, top_n, top_individuals);
8686 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(top_individuals);
8687 return out;
8688}
8689
8707gsc_DecimalMatrix gsc_calculate_bvs( gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group, const gsc_EffectID effID) {
8708 const int effIndex = gsc_get_index_of_eff_set(d, effID);
8709 if (effIndex == GSC_UNINIT || d->e[effIndex].effects.rows < 1 || d->m == NULL) {
8710 fprintf(stderr, "Effect matrix does not exist\n");
8711 return gsc_generate_zero_dmatrix(0, 0);
8712 }
8713 gsc_EffectMatrix e = d->e[effIndex];
8714
8715 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d, group);
8716
8717 gsc_DecimalMatrix bvs = gsc_calculate_utility_bvs(&it, &e);
8718
8719 gsc_delete_bidirectional_iter(&it);
8720 return bvs;
8721}
8722
8734gsc_DecimalMatrix gsc_calculate_utility_bvs(gsc_BidirectionalIterator* targets, const gsc_EffectMatrix* effset) {
8735 if (targets == NULL || effset == NULL) {
8736 fprintf(stderr, "Either targets or marker effects were not provided\n");
8737 return gsc_generate_zero_dmatrix(0, 0);
8738 }
8739
8740 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(genotypes, char*, 50);
8741 size_t n_genotypes = 0;
8742 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_start(targets);
8743 while (IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
8744 if (n_genotypes >= genotypescap) {
8745 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(genotypes, 2*n_genotypes);
8746 }
8747 genotypes[n_genotypes] = gsc_get_alleles(loc);
8748 ++n_genotypes;
8749
8750 loc = gsc_next_forwards(targets);
8751 }
8752
8753 size_t n_markers = effset->effects.cols;
8754 gsc_DecimalMatrix sum = gsc_generate_zero_dmatrix(1, n_genotypes);
8755 gsc_DecimalMatrix counts = gsc_generate_zero_dmatrix(n_genotypes, n_markers );
8756 gsc_DecimalMatrix counts2 = gsc_generate_zero_dmatrix(n_genotypes, n_markers );
8757
8758 size_t i = 0; // highest allele index
8759
8760 for (; i < effset->effects.rows - 1; i += 2) {
8761 // get the allele counts in counts
8762 gsc_calculate_utility_allele_counts_pair(n_markers, n_genotypes, (const char**) genotypes,
8763 effset->effect_names[i], &counts, effset->effect_names[i+1], &counts2);
8764
8765 // multiply counts with effects and add to bv sum
8766 gsc_add_doublematrixvector_product_to_dmatrix(&sum, &counts, effset->effects.matrix[i],
8767 &counts2, effset->effects.matrix[i+1]);
8768 }
8769 if (i < effset->effects.rows) { // deal with the last odd-numbered allele
8770 gsc_calculate_utility_allele_counts(n_markers, n_genotypes, (const char**) genotypes,
8771 effset->effect_names[i], &counts);
8772 gsc_add_matrixvector_product_to_dmatrix(&sum, &counts, effset->effects.matrix[i]);
8773 }
8774
8775 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(genotypes);
8776 gsc_delete_dmatrix(&counts);
8777 gsc_delete_dmatrix(&counts2);
8778
8779 return sum;
8780}
8781
8798gsc_DecimalMatrix gsc_calculate_allele_counts( gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group, const char allele) {
8799 // To upgrade this to use iterators instead, we'll need some modifications to DecimalMatrix. Future work.
8800 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(genotypes, char*, 50);
8801 size_t n_genotypes = 0;
8802 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = create_bidirectional_iter(d, group);
8803 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_start(&it);
8804 while (IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
8805 if (n_genotypes >= genotypescap) {
8806 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(genotypes, 2*n_genotypes);
8807 }
8808 genotypes[n_genotypes] = gsc_get_alleles(loc);
8809 ++n_genotypes;
8810
8811 loc = gsc_next_forwards(&it);
8812 }
8813 gsc_delete_bidirectional_iter(&it);
8814
8815 size_t n_markers = d->m->n_markers;
8816 gsc_DecimalMatrix counts = gsc_generate_zero_dmatrix(n_genotypes, n_markers );
8817
8818 gsc_calculate_utility_allele_counts(n_markers, n_genotypes, (const char** const) genotypes, allele, &counts);
8819
8820 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(genotypes);
8821 return counts;
8822}
8823
8837void gsc_calculate_utility_allele_counts( const size_t n_markers, const size_t n_genotypes, const char** const genotypes, const char allele, gsc_DecimalMatrix* counts) {
8838 if (genotypes == NULL || counts == NULL ||
8839 counts->rows < n_genotypes ||
8840 counts->cols < n_markers) {
8841 fprintf(stderr, "Inputs for calculating count matrix are improperly sized: calculation cannot proceed.\n"); return;
8842 }
8843
8844 for (size_t i = 0; i < n_genotypes; ++i) {
8845 //RPACKINSERT R_CheckUserInterrupt();
8846 if (genotypes[i] == NULL) {
8847 continue;
8848 }
8849
8850 for (size_t j = 0; j < n_markers; ++j) {
8851 int cell_sum = 0;
8852 if (genotypes[i][2*j] == allele) { ++cell_sum; }
8853 if (genotypes[i][2*j + 1] == allele) { ++cell_sum; }
8854 counts->matrix[i][j] = cell_sum;
8855 }
8856 }
8857}
8858
8881void gsc_calculate_utility_allele_counts_pair( const size_t n_markers, const size_t n_genotypes, const char** const genotypes,
8882 const char allele, gsc_DecimalMatrix* counts, const char allele2, gsc_DecimalMatrix* counts2) {
8883 if (genotypes == NULL || counts == NULL || counts2 == NULL ||
8884 counts->rows < n_genotypes || counts2->rows < n_genotypes ||
8885 counts->cols < n_markers || counts2->cols < n_markers) {
8886 fprintf(stderr, "Inputs for calculating count matrix are improperly sized: calculation cannot proceed.\n"); return;
8887 }
8888
8889 for (size_t i = 0; i < n_genotypes; ++i) {
8890 //RPACKINSERT R_CheckUserInterrupt();
8891 if (genotypes[i] == NULL) {
8892 continue;
8893 }
8894
8895 for (size_t j = 0; j < n_markers; ++j) {
8896 int cell_sum = 0;
8897 int cell_sum2 = 0;
8898 if (genotypes[i][2*j] == allele) { ++cell_sum; }
8899 else if (genotypes[i][2*j] == allele2) { ++cell_sum2;}
8900 if (genotypes[i][2*j + 1] == allele) { ++cell_sum; }
8901 else if (genotypes[i][2*j + 1] == allele2) { ++cell_sum2;}
8902 counts->matrix[i][j] = cell_sum;
8903 counts2->matrix[i][j] = cell_sum2;
8904 }
8905 }
8906}
8907
8908
8936gsc_MarkerBlocks gsc_create_evenlength_blocks_each_chr(const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_MapID mapid, const int n) {
8937 gsc_MarkerBlocks blocks;
8938 blocks.num_blocks = 0;
8939
8940 if (d->genome.n_maps < 1) {
8941 fprintf(stderr,"Creating blocks by chromosome length requires at least one recombination map loaded\n");
8942 return blocks;
8943 }
8944 int mapix = 0;
8945 if (mapid.id != NO_MAP.id) { mapix = gsc_get_index_of_map(d, mapid); }
8946 if (mapix >= d->genome.n_maps) {
8947 fprintf(stderr,"We don't have that recombination maps loaded. Using default map\n");
8948 mapix = 0;
8949 }
8950 gsc_RecombinationMap map = d->genome.maps[mapix];
8951
8952 if (n < 1) {
8953 fprintf(stderr,"Invalid n value: number of blocks must be positive.\n");
8954 return blocks;
8955 }
8956 if (map.n_chr < 1) {
8957 fprintf(stderr,"Map has no chromosomes, so it cannot be divided into blocks.\n");
8958 }
8959
8960 blocks.num_blocks = n * map.n_chr;
8961 blocks.num_markers_in_block = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*blocks.num_markers_in_block) * blocks.num_blocks,GSC_TRUE);
8962 blocks.markers_in_block = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*blocks.markers_in_block) * blocks.num_blocks,GSC_TRUE);
8963 for (int i = 0; i < blocks.num_blocks; ++i) {
8964 blocks.num_markers_in_block[i] = 0;
8965 blocks.markers_in_block[i] = NULL;
8966 }
8967
8968 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(temp_markers_in_block, int, 128);
8969 int bi = 0;
8970
8971 for (int chr = 0; chr < map.n_chr; ++chr) {
8972 int current_block_filling = 0; //counter of how many blocks we have in this chr so far
8973 double chrpos = 0;
8974 bi = 0;
8975
8976 // loop through each marker in this chromosome
8977 switch (map.chrs[chr].type) {
8978 case GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_SIMPLE:
8979 if (map.chrs[chr].map.simple.n_markers == 1) {
8980 int b = chr*n + 0;
8981 blocks.markers_in_block[b] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*blocks.markers_in_block[b]), GSC_TRUE);
8982 blocks.markers_in_block[b][0] = map.chrs[chr].map.simple.first_marker_index;
8983 ++(blocks.num_markers_in_block[b]);
8984 } else {
8985 for (int i = 0; i < map.chrs[chr].map.simple.n_markers; ++i) {
8986 //RPACKINSERT R_CheckUserInterrupt();
8987 chrpos += map.chrs[chr].map.simple.dists[i];
8988 while (current_block_filling < n - 1 && chrpos > current_block_filling / n) {
8989 int b = chr*n + current_block_filling;
8990 if (blocks.num_markers_in_block[b] > 0) {
8991 size_t bcapacity = sizeof(*blocks.markers_in_block[b])*blocks.num_markers_in_block[b];
8992 blocks.markers_in_block[b] = gsc_malloc_wrap(bcapacity, GSC_TRUE);
8993 memcpy(blocks.markers_in_block[b],temp_markers_in_block,bcapacity);
8994 }
8995
8996 ++current_block_filling;
8997 bi = 0;
8998 }
8999
9000 // save marker
9001 if (bi >= temp_markers_in_blockcap) {
9002 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(temp_markers_in_block,2*bi);
9003 }
9004 temp_markers_in_block[bi] = map.chrs[chr].map.simple.first_marker_index + i;
9005 ++(blocks.num_markers_in_block[chr*n + current_block_filling]);
9006 ++bi;
9007
9008 }
9009
9010 int b = chr*n + current_block_filling;
9011 if (blocks.num_markers_in_block[b] > 0) {
9012 size_t bcapacity = sizeof(*blocks.markers_in_block[b])*blocks.num_markers_in_block[b];
9013 blocks.markers_in_block[b] = gsc_malloc_wrap(bcapacity, GSC_TRUE);
9014 memcpy(blocks.markers_in_block[b],temp_markers_in_block,bcapacity);
9015 }
9016 }
9017 break;
9018
9019 case GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_REORDER:
9020 if (map.chrs[chr].map.simple.n_markers == 1) {
9021 int b = chr*n + 0;
9022 blocks.markers_in_block[b] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*blocks.markers_in_block[b]), GSC_TRUE);
9023 blocks.markers_in_block[b][0] = map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.marker_indexes[0];
9024 ++(blocks.num_markers_in_block[b]);
9025 } else {
9026 for (int i = 0; i < map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.n_markers; ++i) {
9027 //RPACKINSERT R_CheckUserInterrupt();
9028 chrpos += map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.dists[i];
9029 while (current_block_filling < n - 1 && chrpos > current_block_filling / n) {
9030 int b = chr*n + current_block_filling;
9031 if (blocks.num_markers_in_block[b] > 0) {
9032 size_t bcapacity = sizeof(*blocks.markers_in_block[b])*blocks.num_markers_in_block[b];
9033 blocks.markers_in_block[b] = gsc_malloc_wrap(bcapacity, GSC_TRUE);
9034 memcpy(blocks.markers_in_block[b],temp_markers_in_block,bcapacity);
9035 }
9036
9037 ++current_block_filling;
9038 bi = 0;
9039 }
9040
9041 // save marker
9042 if (bi >= temp_markers_in_blockcap) {
9043 GSC_STRETCH_BUFFER(temp_markers_in_block,2*bi);
9044 }
9045 temp_markers_in_block[bi] = map.chrs[chr].map.reorder.marker_indexes[i];
9046 ++(blocks.num_markers_in_block[chr*n + current_block_filling]);
9047 ++bi;
9048
9049 }
9050
9051 int b = chr*n + current_block_filling;
9052 if (blocks.num_markers_in_block[b] > 0) {
9053 size_t bcapacity = sizeof(*blocks.markers_in_block[b])*blocks.num_markers_in_block[b];
9054 blocks.markers_in_block[b] = gsc_malloc_wrap(bcapacity, GSC_TRUE);
9055 memcpy(blocks.markers_in_block[b],temp_markers_in_block,bcapacity);
9056 }
9057 }
9058 break;
9059 }
9060
9061 }
9062
9063 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(temp_markers_in_block);
9064
9065 return blocks;
9066}
9067
9089gsc_MarkerBlocks gsc_load_blocks(const gsc_SimData* d, const char* block_file) {
9090 struct gsc_TableSize ts = gsc_get_file_dimensions(block_file, '\t');
9091
9092 gsc_MarkerBlocks blocks;
9093 blocks.num_blocks = ts.num_rows - 1;
9094 blocks.num_markers_in_block = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int) * blocks.num_blocks,GSC_TRUE);
9095 blocks.markers_in_block = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int*) * blocks.num_blocks,GSC_TRUE);
9096
9097 FILE* infile;
9098 if ((infile = fopen(block_file, "r")) == NULL) {
9099 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open file %s.\n", block_file); exit(1);
9100 //return blocks;
9101 }
9102
9103 int bufferlen = d->genome.n_markers;
9104 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(markername,char,CONTIG_WIDTH);
9105 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(markerbuffer,int,bufferlen);
9106 int bi = 0; // block number
9107
9108 // Ignore the first line
9109 fscanf(infile, "%*[^\n]\n");
9110
9111 // Loop through rows of the file (each row corresponds to a block)
9112 while (fscanf(infile, "%*d %*f %*s %*s ") != EOF) {
9113 //for (int bi = 0; bi < n_blocks; ++bi) {
9114
9115 // Indexes in play:
9116 // bi: index in the blocks struct's arrays of the current block/line in the file
9117 // ni: number of characters so far in the name of the next marker being read from the file
9118 // mi: number of markers that have so far been read from the file for this block
9119 blocks.num_markers_in_block[bi] = 0;
9120 int c, ni = 0, mi = 0;
9121
9122 memset(markerbuffer, 0, sizeof(int) * bufferlen);
9123 while ((c = fgetc(infile)) != EOF && c !='\n') {
9124 if (c == ';') {
9125 markername[ni] = '\0';
9126
9127 // identify the index of this marker and save it in the temporary marker buffer `markerbuffer`
9128 int markerindex = gsc_get_from_unordered_str_list(markername, d->genome.n_markers, (const char**) d->genome.marker_names);
9129 if (markerindex >= 0) {
9130 ++(blocks.num_markers_in_block[bi]);
9131 markerbuffer[mi] = markerindex;
9132 ++mi;
9133 }
9134
9135 ni = 0;
9136 } else {
9137 markername[ni] = c;
9138 ++ni;
9139 }
9140 }
9141
9142 // copy the markers belonging to this block into the struct
9143 blocks.markers_in_block[bi] = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(int) * mi,GSC_TRUE);
9144 for (int i = 0; i < mi; ++i) {
9145 blocks.markers_in_block[bi][i] = markerbuffer[i];
9146 }
9147
9148 ++bi;
9149 }
9150
9151 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(markerbuffer);
9152 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(markername);
9153 fclose(infile);
9154 return blocks;
9155}
9156
9185void gsc_calculate_group_local_bvs(const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_MarkerBlocks b, const gsc_EffectID effID, const char* output_file, const gsc_GroupNum group) {
9186 const int effIndex = gsc_get_index_of_eff_set(d, effID);
9187 if (effIndex == GSC_UNINIT) {
9188 fprintf(stderr,"Nonexistent effect set with id %d\n", effID.id);
9189 return;
9190 }
9191 gsc_EffectMatrix e = d->e[effIndex];
9192
9193 FILE* outfile;
9194 if ((outfile = fopen(output_file, "w")) == NULL) {
9195 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open file %s.\n", output_file); exit(1);
9196 }
9197
9198 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(buffer,char,CONTIG_WIDTH);
9199
9200 int gsize = gsc_get_group_size(d, group);
9201 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(ggenos,char*,gsize);
9202 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(gnames,char*,gsize);
9203 gsc_get_group_genes(d, group, gsize, ggenos);
9204 gsc_get_group_names(d, group, gsize, gnames);
9205 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(gids,gsc_PedigreeID,gsize);
9206 gsc_get_group_ids(d,group,gsize,gids);
9207
9208 double beffect;
9209
9210 // for each group member
9211 for (int i = 0; i < gsize; ++i) {
9212 // for each block
9213 if (gnames[i] != NULL) {
9214 sprintf(buffer, "%s_1", gnames[i]);
9215 } else {
9216 sprintf(buffer, "%d_1", gids[i].id);
9217 }
9218 fwrite(buffer, sizeof(char), strlen(buffer), outfile);
9219
9220 // for each block
9221 for (int j = 0; j < b.num_blocks; ++j) {
9222 beffect = 0;
9223
9224 // calculate the local BV
9225 for (int k = 0; k < b.num_markers_in_block[j]; ++k) {
9226 for (int q = 0; q < e.effects.rows; ++q) {
9227 if (ggenos[i][2 * b.markers_in_block[j][k]] == e.effect_names[q]) {
9228 beffect += e.effects.matrix[q][b.markers_in_block[j][k]];
9229 }
9230 }
9231 }
9232
9233 // print the local BV
9234 fprintf(outfile, " %lf", beffect);
9235 fflush(outfile);
9236 }
9237
9238 if (gnames[i] != NULL) {
9239 sprintf(buffer, "\n%s_2", gnames[i]);
9240 } else {
9241 sprintf(buffer, "\n%d_2", gids[i].id);
9242 }
9243 fwrite(buffer, sizeof(char), strlen(buffer), outfile);
9244
9245 // for each block for the second haplotype
9246 for (int j = 0; j < b.num_blocks; ++j) {
9247 beffect = 0;
9248 // calculate the local BV
9249 for (int k = 0; k < b.num_markers_in_block[j]; ++k) {
9250 for (int q = 0; q < e.effects.rows; ++q) {
9251 if (ggenos[i][2 * b.markers_in_block[j][k] + 1] == e.effect_names[q]) {
9252 beffect += e.effects.matrix[q][b.markers_in_block[j][k]];
9253 }
9254 }
9255 }
9256
9257 // print the local BV
9258 fprintf(outfile, " %lf", beffect);
9259 fflush(outfile);
9260 }
9261 fwrite("\n", sizeof(char), 1, outfile);
9262 }
9263
9264 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(ggenos);
9265 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(gnames);
9266 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(gids);
9267 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(buffer);
9268 fflush(outfile);
9269 fclose(outfile);
9270}
9271
9298void gsc_calculate_local_bvs(const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_MarkerBlocks b, const gsc_EffectID effID, const char* output_file) {
9299 const int effIndex = gsc_get_index_of_eff_set(d, effID);
9300 if (effIndex == GSC_UNINIT) {
9301 fprintf(stderr,"Nonexistent effect set with id %d\n", effID.id);
9302 return;
9303 }
9304 gsc_EffectMatrix e = d->e[effIndex];
9305
9306 FILE* outfile;
9307 if ((outfile = fopen(output_file, "w")) == NULL) {
9308 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open file %s.\n", output_file); exit(1);
9309 }
9310
9311 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(buffer,char,CONTIG_WIDTH);
9312
9313 int gsize = 0;
9314 gsc_AlleleMatrix* m = d->m;
9315 do {
9316 gsize += m->n_genotypes;
9317 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
9318
9319 double beffect;
9320
9321 // for each group member
9322 m = d->m;
9323 int total_i = 0;
9324 do {
9325 for (int i = 0; i < m->n_genotypes; ++i, ++total_i) {
9326 // for each group member
9327 if (m->names[i] != NULL) {
9328 sprintf(buffer, "%s_1", m->names[i]);
9329 } else {
9330 sprintf(buffer, "%d_1", m->ids[i].id);
9331 }
9332 fwrite(buffer, sizeof(char), strlen(buffer), outfile);
9333
9334 // for each block
9335 for (int j = 0; j < b.num_blocks; ++j) {
9336 beffect = 0;
9337
9338 // calculate the local BV
9339 for (int k = 0; k < b.num_markers_in_block[j]; ++k) {
9340 for (int q = 0; q < e.effects.rows; ++q) {
9341 if (m->alleles[i][2 * b.markers_in_block[j][k]] == e.effect_names[q]) {
9342 beffect += e.effects.matrix[q][b.markers_in_block[j][k]];
9343 }
9344 }
9345 }
9346
9347 // print the local BV
9348 fprintf(outfile, " %lf", beffect);
9349 fflush(outfile);
9350 }
9351
9352 if (m->names[i] != NULL) {
9353 sprintf(buffer, "\n%s_2", m->names[i]);
9354 } else {
9355 sprintf(buffer, "\n%d_2", m->ids[i].id);
9356 }
9357 fwrite(buffer, sizeof(char), strlen(buffer), outfile);
9358
9359 // for each block for the second haplotype
9360 for (int j = 0; j < b.num_blocks; ++j) {
9361 beffect = 0;
9362 // calculate the local BV
9363 for (int k = 0; k < b.num_markers_in_block[j]; ++k) {
9364 for (int q = 0; q < e.effects.rows; ++q) {
9365 if (m->alleles[i][2 * b.markers_in_block[j][k] + 1] == e.effect_names[q]) {
9366 beffect += e.effects.matrix[q][b.markers_in_block[j][k]];
9367 }
9368 }
9369 }
9370
9371 // print the local BV
9372 fprintf(outfile, " %lf", beffect);
9373 fflush(outfile);
9374 }
9375 fwrite("\n", sizeof(char), 1, outfile);
9376 }
9377 } while ((m = m->next) != NULL);
9378
9379 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(buffer);
9380 fflush(outfile);
9381 fclose(outfile);
9382}
9383
9400char* gsc_calculate_optimal_haplotype(const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_EffectID effID) {
9401 const int effIndex = gsc_get_index_of_eff_set(d, effID);
9402 if (effIndex == GSC_UNINIT) {
9403 fprintf(stderr,"Nonexistent effect set with id %d\n", effID.id);
9404 return NULL;
9405 }
9406 gsc_EffectMatrix e = d->e[effIndex];
9407
9408 char* optimal = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char)* (d->genome.n_markers + 1),GSC_TRUE);
9409
9410 for (int i = 0; i < d->genome.n_markers; ++i) {
9411 char best_allele = e.effect_names[0];
9412 double best_score = e.effects.matrix[0][i];
9413 for (int a = 1; a < e.effects.rows; ++a) {
9414 if (e.effects.matrix[a][i] > best_score) {
9415 best_score = e.effects.matrix[a][i];
9416 best_allele = e.effect_names[a];
9417 }
9418 }
9419 optimal[i] = best_allele;
9420 }
9421 optimal[d->genome.n_markers] = '\0';
9422 return optimal;
9423}
9424
9425
9441char* gsc_calculate_optimal_possible_haplotype(const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group, const gsc_EffectID effID) {
9442 const int effIndex = gsc_get_index_of_eff_set(d, effID);
9443 if (effIndex == GSC_UNINIT) {
9444 fprintf(stderr,"Nonexistent effect set with id %d\n", effID.id);
9445 return NULL;
9446 }
9447 gsc_EffectMatrix e = d->e[effIndex];
9448 // assumes no alleles in the matrix are spaces.
9449
9450 int gsize = gsc_get_group_size(d, group);
9451 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(ggenes,char*,gsize);
9452 gsc_get_group_genes(d, group, gsize, ggenes);
9453
9454 char* optimal = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(char)* (d->genome.n_markers + 1),GSC_TRUE);
9455
9456 // for each locus
9457 for (int j = 0; j < d->genome.n_markers; ++j) {
9458 char best_allele = '\0';
9459 double best_score;
9460 for (int i = 0; i < gsize; ++i) {
9461
9462 // If the allele is different to the previous best (guaranteed if best_allele is not initialised)
9463 if (ggenes[i][2*j] != best_allele) {
9464 // Find it and see if it scores better.
9465 for (int a = 0; a < e.effects.rows; ++a) {
9466
9467 if (e.effect_names[a] == ggenes[i][2*j] &&
9468 (best_allele == '\0' || e.effects.matrix[a][j] > best_score)) { // if it scores better than current best
9469
9470 best_allele = ggenes[i][2*j];
9471 best_score = e.effects.matrix[a][j];
9472
9473 break;
9474 }
9475
9476 }
9477 }
9478
9479 // Repeat for second allele of the group member at that locus
9480 if (ggenes[i][2*j + 1] != best_allele) {
9481 // Find it and see if it scores better.
9482 for (int a = 0; a < e.effects.rows; ++a) {
9483
9484 if (e.effect_names[a] == ggenes[i][2*j + 1] &&
9485 (best_allele == '\0' || e.effects.matrix[a][j] > best_score)) { // if it scores better than current best
9486
9487 best_allele = ggenes[i][2*j + 1];
9488 best_score = e.effects.matrix[a][j];
9489
9490 break;
9491 }
9492
9493 }
9494 }
9495 }
9496 optimal[j] = best_allele;
9497 }
9498
9499 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(ggenes);
9500 optimal[d->genome.n_markers] = '\0';
9501 return optimal;
9502}
9503
9504
9516double gsc_calculate_optimal_bv(const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_EffectID effID) {
9517 const int effIndex = gsc_get_index_of_eff_set(d, effID);
9518 if (effIndex == GSC_UNINIT) {
9519 fprintf(stderr,"Nonexistent effect set with id %d\n", effID.id);
9520 return 0;
9521 }
9522 gsc_EffectMatrix e = d->e[effIndex];
9523
9524 double best_gebv = 0;
9525
9526 for (int i = 0; i < d->genome.n_markers; ++i) {
