9527 // Find the allele with the highest effect
9528 double best_score = e.effects.matrix[0][i];
9529 for (int a = 1; a < e.effects.rows; ++a) {
9530 if (e.effects.matrix[a][i] > best_score) {
9531 best_score = e.effects.matrix[a][i];
9532 }
9533 }
9534
9535 // add that highest allele to the score twice over
9536 best_gebv += (2*best_score);
9537 }
9538
9539 return best_gebv;
9540}
9541
9558double gsc_calculate_optimal_possible_bv(const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum group, const gsc_EffectID effID) {
9559 const int effIndex = gsc_get_index_of_eff_set(d, effID);
9560 if (effIndex == GSC_UNINIT) {
9561 fprintf(stderr,"Nonexistent effect set with id %d\n", effID.id);
9562 return 0;
9563 }
9564 gsc_EffectMatrix e = d->e[effIndex];
9565
9566 // assumes no alleles in the matrix are spaces.
9567
9568 int gsize = gsc_get_group_size(d, group);
9569 if (gsize == 0) {
9570 fprintf(stderr,"Nonexistent group %d\n", group.num);
9571 return 0;
9572 }
9573 GSC_CREATE_BUFFER(ggenes,char*,gsize);
9574 gsc_get_group_genes(d, group, gsize, ggenes);
9575
9576 double total_score = 0;
9577 char best_allele;
9578 double best_score;
9579
9580 // for each locus
9581 for (int j = 0; j < d->genome.n_markers; ++j) {
9582 best_allele = '\0';
9583 best_score = 0;
9584 for (int i = 0; i < gsize; ++i) {
9585
9586 // If the allele is different to the previous best (guaranteed if best_allele is not initialised)
9587 if (ggenes[i][2*j] != best_allele) {
9588 // Find it and see if it scores better.
9589 for (int a = 0; a < e.effects.rows; ++a) {
9590
9591 if (e.effect_names[a] == ggenes[i][2*j] &&
9592 (best_allele == '\0' || e.effects.matrix[a][j] > best_score)) { // if it scores better than current best
9593
9594 best_allele = ggenes[i][2*j];
9595 best_score = e.effects.matrix[a][j];
9596
9597 break;
9598 }
9599
9600 }
9601 }
9602
9603 // Repeat for second allele of the group member at that locus
9604 if (ggenes[i][2*j + 1] != best_allele) {
9605 // Find it and see if it scores better.
9606 for (int a = 0; a < e.effects.rows; ++a) {
9607
9608 if (e.effect_names[a] == ggenes[i][2*j + 1] &&
9609 (best_allele == '\0' || e.effects.matrix[a][j] > best_score)) { // if it scores better than current best
9610
9611 best_allele = ggenes[i][2*j + 1];
9612 best_score = e.effects.matrix[a][j];
9613
9614 break;
9615 }
9616
9617 }
9618 }
9619 }
9620 total_score += (2*best_score);
9621 }
9622
9623 GSC_DELETE_BUFFER(ggenes);
9624 return total_score;
9625}
9626
9638double gsc_calculate_minimal_bv(const gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_EffectID effID) {
9639 const int effIndex = gsc_get_index_of_eff_set(d, effID);
9640 if (effIndex == GSC_UNINIT) {
9641 fprintf(stderr,"Nonexistent effect set with id %d\n", effID.id);
9642 return 0;
9643 }
9644 gsc_EffectMatrix e = d->e[effIndex];
9645
9646 double worst_gebv = 0;
9647 double worst_score;
9648
9649 for (int i = 0; i < d->genome.n_markers; ++i) {
9650 // Find the allele with the highest effect
9651 worst_score = e.effects.matrix[0][i];
9652 for (int a = 1; a < e.effects.rows; ++a) {
9653 if (e.effects.matrix[a][i] < worst_score) {
9654 worst_score = e.effects.matrix[a][i];
9655 }
9656 }
9657
9658 // add that highest allele to the score twice over
9659 worst_gebv += (2*worst_score);
9660 }
9661
9662 return worst_gebv;
9663}
9664
9665/*--------------------------------Saving-----------------------------------*/
9666
9684void gsc_save_markerblocks(const char* fname, gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_MarkerBlocks b,
9685 const gsc_MapID labelMapID) {
9686 FILE* f;
9687 if ((f = fopen(fname, "w")) == NULL) {
9688 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open file %s for writing output\n", fname); return;
9689 }
9690
9691 int mapix;
9692 if (labelMapID.id == NO_MAP.id || (mapix = gsc_get_index_of_map(d, labelMapID)) == GSC_UNINIT) {
9693 gsc_save_utility_markerblocks(f, b, d->genome.n_markers, d->genome.marker_names, NULL);
9694 } else {
9695 gsc_save_utility_markerblocks(f, b, d->genome.n_markers, d->genome.marker_names, &d->genome.maps[mapix]);
9696 }
9697}
9698
9718void gsc_save_genotypes(const char* fname, gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum groupID,
9719 const int markers_as_rows) {
9720 FILE* f;
9721 if ((f = fopen(fname, "w")) == NULL) {
9722 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open file %s for writing output\n", fname); return;
9723 }
9724
9725 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d, groupID);
9726
9727 gsc_save_utility_genotypes(f, &it, d->genome.n_markers, d->genome.marker_names, markers_as_rows);
9728
9729 delete_bidirectional_iter(&it);
9730 fclose(f);
9731}
9732
9753void gsc_save_allele_counts(const char* fname, gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum groupID,
9754 const char allele, const int markers_as_rows) {
9755 FILE* f;
9756 if ((f = fopen(fname, "w")) == NULL) {
9757 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open file %s for writing output\n", fname); return;
9758 }
9759
9760 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d, groupID);
9761
9762 gsc_save_utility_allele_counts(f, &it, d->genome.n_markers, d->genome.marker_names, markers_as_rows, allele);
9763
9764 delete_bidirectional_iter(&it);
9765 fclose(f);
9766}
9767
9789void gsc_save_pedigrees(const char* fname, gsc_SimData* d,
9790 const gsc_GroupNum groupID, const int full_pedigree) {
9791 FILE* f;
9792 if ((f = fopen(fname, "w")) == NULL) {
9793 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open file %s for writing output\n", fname); return;
9794 }
9795
9796 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d, groupID);
9797
9798 gsc_save_utility_pedigrees(f, &it, full_pedigree, d->m);
9799
9800 delete_bidirectional_iter(&it);
9801 fclose(f);
9802}
9803
9819void gsc_save_bvs(const char* fname, gsc_SimData* d, const gsc_GroupNum groupID,
9820 const gsc_EffectID effID) {
9821 FILE* f;
9822 if ((f = fopen(fname, "w")) == NULL) {
9823 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open file %s for writing output\n", fname); return;
9824 }
9825
9826 int effix = gsc_get_index_of_eff_set(d, effID);
9827 if (effix == GSC_UNINIT) {
9828 fprintf(stderr, "Marker effect set %i does not exist: cannot calculate breeding values\n", effID.id); return;
9829 }
9830
9831 gsc_BidirectionalIterator it = gsc_create_bidirectional_iter(d, groupID);
9832
9833 gsc_save_utility_bvs(f, &it, &d->e[effix]);
9834
9835 delete_bidirectional_iter(&it);
9836 fclose(f);
9837}
9838
9841static int gsc_helper_is_marker_in_chr(const size_t markerix, const gsc_LinkageGroup chr, double* pos) {
9842 int offset;
9843 switch (chr.type) {
9844 case GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_SIMPLE:
9845 offset = markerix - chr.map.simple.first_marker_index;
9846 if (offset >= 0 && offset < chr.map.simple.n_markers) {
9847 if (pos != NULL && chr.map.simple.n_markers > 1) {
9848 *pos = chr.map.simple.dists[offset] * chr.map.simple.expected_n_crossovers;
9849 } else {
9850 *pos = 0; // if there is only one marker on chromosome
9851 }
9852 return GSC_TRUE;
9853 } else {
9854 return GSC_FALSE;
9855 }
9856 case GSC_LINKAGEGROUP_REORDER:
9857 for (size_t i = 0; i < chr.map.reorder.n_markers; ++i) {
9858 if (markerix == chr.map.reorder.marker_indexes[i]) {
9859 if (pos != NULL) {
9860 *pos = chr.map.reorder.dists[i] * chr.map.reorder.expected_n_crossovers;
9861 }
9862 return GSC_TRUE;
9863 }
9864 }
9865 return GSC_FALSE;
9866 }
9867 return GSC_FALSE;
9868}
9869
9927void gsc_save_utility_markerblocks(FILE* f, const gsc_MarkerBlocks b, const size_t n_markers,
9928 char** const marker_names, const RecombinationMap* map) {
9929
9930 // Header only gets printed if there are multiple columns.
9931 // (If no map is provided, we print only the third column (markers in each block))
9932 if (map != NULL) {
9933 const char header[] = "Chrom\tLen\tMarkers\n";
9934 fwrite(header, sizeof(char)*strlen(header), 1, f);
9935 }
9936
9937 for (size_t i = 0; i < b.num_blocks; ++i) {
9938 if (map != NULL) {
9939 // If we are provided a map, then try to find and print the length of each block
9940 int isonchr = -1;
9941 double len = 0;
9942 if (b.num_markers_in_block[i] > 0) {
9943 double minpos = 0;
9944 double maxpos = 0;
9945 for (int chrix = 0; chrix < map->n_chr; ++chrix) {
9946 if (gsc_helper_is_marker_in_chr(b.markers_in_block[i][0],
9947 map->chrs[chrix],&minpos)) {
9948 isonchr = chrix;
9949 maxpos = minpos;
9950 for (size_t j = 1; j < b.num_markers_in_block[i]; ++j) {
9951 double pos;
9952 if (gsc_helper_is_marker_in_chr(b.markers_in_block[i][j],
9953 map->chrs[chrix],&pos)) {
9954 maxpos = (pos > maxpos) ? pos : maxpos;
9955 minpos = (pos < minpos) ? pos : minpos;
9956 } else {
9957 isonchr = -1;
9958 break;
9959 }
9960 }
9961 len = maxpos - minpos;
9962 break;
9963 }
9964 }
9965 }
9966
9967 if (isonchr >= 0) {
9968 fprintf(f,"%d\t%lf\t",isonchr,len*100);
9969 } else {
9970 const char colns[] = "-\t-\t";
9971 fwrite(colns, sizeof(char)*strlen(colns), 1, f);
9972 }
9973 }
9974
9975 // Print the markers contained in the block
9976 for (size_t j = 0; j < b.num_markers_in_block[i]; ++j) {
9977 size_t k = b.markers_in_block[i][j];
9978 if (k <= n_markers) {
9979 fwrite(marker_names[k], sizeof(char)*strlen(marker_names[k]), 1, f);
9980 } else {
9981 fprintf(f,"%i",(int)k);
9982 }
9983 fputc(';',f);
9984 }
9985
9986 fwrite("\n", sizeof(char), 1, f);
9987 }
9988
9989 fflush(f);
9990 return;
9991}
9992
9999static void gsc_scaffold_save_genotype_info(FILE* f, gsc_BidirectionalIterator* targets,
10000 size_t n_markers, char** const marker_names, const int markers_as_rows,
10001 void (*bodycell_printer)(FILE*, gsc_GenoLocation, size_t, void*), void* bodycell_printer_data) {
10002
10003 // legacy feature: if printing a specific group's members, put the group number in the top left corner cell
10004 if (targets != NULL && targets->group.num != NO_GROUP.num) {
10005 fprintf(f,"%d",targets->group.num);
10006 }
10007
10008 size_t ntargets;
10009 switch (markers_as_rows) {
10010 case GSC_TRUE:
10011 ntargets = 0;
10012 // Header row (genotype names)
10013 if (targets != NULL) {
10014 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_start(targets);
10015 while (IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
10016 fwrite("\t", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10017 ++ntargets;
10018 char* n = gsc_get_name(loc);
10019 if (n != NULL) {
10020 fwrite(n, sizeof(char)*strlen(n), 1, f);
10021 } else {
10022 fprintf(f, "%d", gsc_get_id(loc).id);
10023 }
10024
10025 loc = gsc_next_forwards(targets);
10026 }
10027 fwrite("\n", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10028 }
10029
10030 // Body (genotypes and genotype names)
10031 // - This is our row counter
10032 size_t row = 0;
10033 gsc_GenoLocation* genos = NULL;
10034 // - This is our genotype position cache, because BidirectionalIterator does not have a built-in cache
10035 if (ntargets > 0 && ((row < n_markers || (ntargets > 0 && row < targets->cachedAM->n_markers)))) {
10036 genos = gsc_malloc_wrap(sizeof(*genos)*ntargets, GSC_FALSE);
10037 if (genos != NULL) {
10038 genos[0] = gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_start(targets);
10039 for (size_t i = 1; i < ntargets; ++i) {
10040 genos[i] = gsc_next_forwards(targets);
10041 }
10042 }
10043 }
10044 while (row < n_markers || (ntargets > 0 && row < targets->cachedAM->n_markers)) {
10045 // Row header
10046 if (row < n_markers) {
10047 if (marker_names[row] != NULL) {
10048 fwrite(marker_names[row], sizeof(char)*strlen(marker_names[row]), 1, f);
10049 }
10050 }
10051
10052 // Row body
10053 for (size_t i = 0; i < ntargets; ++i) {
10054 gsc_GenoLocation loc;
10055 if (genos != NULL) {
10056 loc = genos[i];
10057 } else {
10058 loc = (i == 0) ? gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_start(targets) :
10059 gsc_next_forwards(targets);
10060 }
10061
10062 fwrite("\t", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10063 bodycell_printer(f,loc,row,bodycell_printer_data);
10064 }
10065
10066 fwrite("\n", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10067 ++row;
10068 }
10069 if (genos != NULL) { GSC_FREE(genos); }
10070
10071 break;
10072
10073 case GSC_FALSE:
10074 // Header row (marker names)
10075 if (marker_names != NULL) {
10076 for (size_t i = 0; i < n_markers; ++i) {
10077 fwrite("\t", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10078 if (marker_names[i] != NULL) {
10079 fwrite(marker_names[i], sizeof(char)*strlen(marker_names[i]), 1, f);
10080 }
10081 }
10082 fwrite("\n", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10083 }
10084
10085 // Body (genotypes and genotype names)
10086 if (targets != NULL) {
10087 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_start(targets);
10088 while (IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
10089 // Row header
10090 char* n = gsc_get_name(loc);
10091 if (n != NULL) {
10092 fwrite(n, sizeof(char)*strlen(n), 1, f);
10093 } else {
10094 fprintf(f, "%d", gsc_get_id(loc).id);
10095 }
10096
10097 // Row body
10098 for (size_t i = 0; i < targets->cachedAM->n_markers; ++i) {
10099 fwrite("\t", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10100 bodycell_printer(f,loc,i,bodycell_printer_data);
10101 }
10102 fwrite("\n", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10103
10104 loc = gsc_next_forwards(targets);
10105 }
10106 }
10107
10108 break;
10109 }
10110
10111 fflush(f);
10112 return;
10113}
10114
10117static void gsc_helper_output_genotypematrix_cell(FILE* f, gsc_GenoLocation loc, size_t markerix, void* NA) {
10118 if (IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
10119 fwrite(gsc_get_alleles(loc) + 2*markerix, sizeof(char)*2, 1, f);
10120 }
10121}
10122
10125static void gsc_helper_output_countmatrix_cell(FILE* f, gsc_GenoLocation loc, size_t markerix, void* data) {
10126 if (IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
10127 char allele = *(char*) data;
10128 int count = 0;
10129 if (get_alleles(loc)[2*markerix] == allele) { ++count; }
10130 if (get_alleles(loc)[2*markerix + 1] == allele) { ++count; }
10131 char out = '0' + count;
10132 fwrite(&out, sizeof(char), 1, f);
10133 }
10134}
10135
10183void gsc_save_utility_genotypes(FILE* f, gsc_BidirectionalIterator* targets,
10184 size_t n_markers, char** const marker_names, const int markers_as_rows) {
10185 gsc_scaffold_save_genotype_info(f, targets, n_markers, marker_names, markers_as_rows,
10186 &gsc_helper_output_genotypematrix_cell, NULL);
10187}
10188
10237void gsc_save_utility_allele_counts(FILE* f, gsc_BidirectionalIterator* targets,
10238 size_t n_markers, char** const marker_names, const int markers_as_rows, const char allele) {
10239 gsc_scaffold_save_genotype_info(f, targets, n_markers, marker_names, markers_as_rows,
10240 &gsc_helper_output_countmatrix_cell, (void*)&allele);
10241}
10242
10249static void gsc_scaffold_save_ancestry_of(const gsc_AlleleMatrix* m, gsc_PedigreeID p1, gsc_PedigreeID p2,
10250 void (*strprinter)(char*, size_t, void*), void (*intprinter)(int, void*), void* printer_data) {
10251 gsc_PedigreeID pedigree[2];
10252
10253 // open brackets
10254 strprinter("=(", sizeof(char)*2,printer_data);
10255 char* name;
10256
10257 // enables us to print only the known parent if one is unknown
10258 if (p1.id == GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id || p2.id == GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
10259 p1.id = (p1.id >= p2.id) ? p1.id : p2.id; //max of the two
10260 p2.id = p1.id;
10261 }
10262
10263 if (p1.id == p2.id) {
10264 if (p1.id != GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) { //print nothing if both are unknown.
10265 // Selfed parent
10266 name = gsc_get_name_of_id( m, p1);
10267 if (name != NULL) {
10268 strprinter(name, sizeof(char)*strlen(name), printer_data);
10269 } else if (p1.id != GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
10270 intprinter(p1.id,printer_data);
10271 }
10272
10273 if (gsc_get_parents_of_id(m, p1, pedigree) == 0) {
10274 gsc_scaffold_save_ancestry_of(m, pedigree[0], pedigree[1],strprinter,intprinter,printer_data);
10275 }
10276 }
10277 } else {
10278 // Parent 1
10279 name = gsc_get_name_of_id( m, p1);
10280 if (name != NULL) {
10281 strprinter(name, sizeof(char)*strlen(name),printer_data);
10282 } else if (p1.id != GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
10283 intprinter(p1.id,printer_data);
10284 }
10285 if (gsc_get_parents_of_id(m, p1, pedigree) == 0) {
10286 gsc_scaffold_save_ancestry_of(m, pedigree[0], pedigree[1],strprinter,intprinter,printer_data);
10287 }
10288
10289 // separator
10290 strprinter(",", sizeof(char),printer_data);
10291
10292 // Parent 2
10293 name = gsc_get_name_of_id( m, p2);
10294 if (name != NULL) {
10295 strprinter(name, sizeof(char)*strlen(name),printer_data);
10296 } else if (p2.id != GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
10297 intprinter(p2.id,printer_data);
10298 }
10299
10300 if (gsc_get_parents_of_id(m, p2, pedigree) == 0) {
10301 gsc_scaffold_save_ancestry_of(m, pedigree[0], pedigree[1],strprinter,intprinter,printer_data);
10302 }
10303
10304 }
10305
10306 // close brackets
10307 strprinter(")", sizeof(char),printer_data);
10308}
10309
10312static void gsc_helper_ancestry_strprinter_file(char* str, size_t strlen, void* data) {
10313 FILE* f = (FILE*) data;
10314 fwrite(str, strlen, 1, f);
10315}
10316
10319static void gsc_helper_ancestry_intprinter_file(int i, void* data) {
10320 FILE* f = (FILE*) data;
10321 fprintf(f, "%d", i);
10322}
10323
10383void gsc_save_utility_pedigrees(FILE* f, gsc_BidirectionalIterator* targets,
10384 const int full_pedigree, const AlleleMatrix* parent_pedigree_store) {
10385
10386 if (targets == NULL) { return; }
10387
10388 gsc_GenoLocation loc;
10389 switch (full_pedigree) {
10390 case GSC_FALSE:
10391 loc = gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_start(targets);
10392 while (IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
10393 // Offspring
10394 char* n = gsc_get_name(loc);
10395 if (n != NULL) {
10396 fwrite(n, sizeof(char)*strlen(n), 1, f);
10397 } else {
10398 fprintf(f, "%d", gsc_get_id(loc).id);
10399 }
10400
10401 // Parents
10402 for (int parent = 0; parent < 2; ++parent) {
10403 fwrite("\t", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10404 n = NULL;
10405 gsc_PedigreeID p = (parent == 0) ? gsc_get_first_parent(loc) : gsc_get_second_parent(loc);
10406 if (p.id != GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id && parent_pedigree_store != NULL) {
10407 n = gsc_get_name_of_id(parent_pedigree_store, p);
10408 }
10409 if (n != NULL) {
10410 fwrite(n, sizeof(char)*strlen(n), 1, f);
10411 } else if (p.id != NO_PEDIGREE.id) {
10412 fprintf(f, "%d", p.id);
10413 }
10414 }
10415
10416 fwrite("\n", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10417 loc = gsc_next_forwards(targets);
10418 }
10419
10420 break;
10421 case GSC_TRUE:
10422 loc = gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_start(targets);
10423 while (IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
10424 // Offspring
10425 fprintf(f, "%d\t", gsc_get_id(loc).id);
10426 char* n = gsc_get_name(loc);
10427 if (n != NULL) {
10428 fwrite(n, sizeof(char)*strlen(n), 1, f);
10429 }
10430
10431 // Parents (recursively)
10432 if ((gsc_get_first_parent(loc).id != GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id ||
10433 gsc_get_second_parent(loc).id != GSC_NO_PEDIGREE.id)
10434 && parent_pedigree_store != NULL) {
10435 gsc_scaffold_save_ancestry_of(parent_pedigree_store,
10436 gsc_get_first_parent(loc), gsc_get_second_parent(loc),
10437 gsc_helper_ancestry_strprinter_file, gsc_helper_ancestry_intprinter_file, (void*) f);
10438 }
10439
10440 fwrite("\n", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10441 loc = gsc_next_forwards(targets);
10442 }
10443
10444 break;
10445 }
10446
10447 fflush(f);
10448 return;
10449}
10450
10471void gsc_save_utility_bvs(FILE* f, gsc_BidirectionalIterator* targets, const gsc_EffectMatrix* eff) {
10472 if (targets == NULL || eff == NULL) { return; }
10473
10474 gsc_DecimalMatrix bvs = gsc_calculate_utility_bvs(targets, eff);
10475 gsc_GenoLocation loc = gsc_set_bidirectional_iter_to_start(targets);
10476
10477 for (size_t i = 0; i < bvs.cols; ++i) {
10478 if (IS_VALID_LOCATION(loc)) {
10479 fprintf(f, "%d", gsc_get_id(loc).id);
10480 fwrite("\t", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10481 char* n = gsc_get_name(loc);
10482 if (n != NULL) {
10483 fwrite(n, sizeof(char), strlen(n), f);
10484 }
10485 fwrite("\t", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10486 } else {
10487 fwrite("\t\t", sizeof(char)*2, 1, f);
10488 }
10489
10490 fprintf(f, "%lf", bvs.matrix[0][i]);
10491 fwrite("\n", sizeof(char), 1, f);
10492
10493 loc = gsc_next_forwards(targets);
10494 }
10495
10496 gsc_delete_dmatrix(&bvs);
10497 fflush(f);
10498 return;
10499}
